30913711.review:
Singularity has some great thoughts to it but ultimately the circa-2007 graphics & lack of multiplayer kind of kill the fun for me. The graphics are reminicent of the classic FPS called Wolfenstein: Enemy Territory, which i've racked up several hundred hours on, but, Singularity is essentially Single-player only at this point in time (multiplayer is dead). Much like Quake4, the graphics are actually too chintzy to forgive & look past & the gameplay doesn't make up for it enough to be worthwhile to slog through. Doom3, even though it is of the same era, has an immediately engrossing 'scary horror thriller' type storyline going on that really takes you into the action. Doom4, of course, is a new classic, but that is unfair to mention since that game came out in 2016 so it has all the razzle-dazzle special effects that are possible in this day & age.

The story is just too lacking in feminine influences to me.. are the guys homos or something? where are the broads... Anyways, what really put the nail in the coffin for this particular "scary FPS thriller" is the recent purchase of the remastered Metro 2033: Redux, which basically solved the things I thought were annoying about the first game of that series & it is a fun game again. In that game, there are both male and female characters who are active participants in the gameplay, & that makes it WAY more fun. No offense, but no chicks after a while just seems like a sausage-fest. just sayin'! The main protagonist is a guy & this isn't Tomb Raider or anything but it is a little more even-handed & there are couples flirting with each other & people trying to settle down & all that. Oh, and the storyline is excellent & you really get a feel for the events going on. It really takes you into what seems to be post-apocalyptic Russia of the year (you guessed it) 2033 in the future.

Rating: 5/10 there are better sci-fi / scary FPS's out there to play instead. OK for it's time, but pretty bad graphically by modern FPS standards. Oh well. The Chipotle burrito & NOS soda I had with the game was good! That's gotta count for something. It was more fun to travel by ZX6r to the fast food restaurant & back to get some food while waiting for the game to load than the actual game.

30911357.review:
I don't write many game reviews but I did feel compelled to write this one. The irony is most of you who are interested in playing the game probably shouldn't read it because my review itself will contain spoilers. Though on the outset I will say if you enjoy time travel games, this one has a great story and is a decent FPS so I can recommend it. What isn't a spoiler is that it is well known the game contains 3 possible endings and this is where the majority of my criticism will lie. I will of course use the formatting for concealing the spoiler parts so please don't mouse over the blacked out area if you don't want to see spoilers.

[spoiler]My main gripe with this game is that there is no quote "good" ending. All 3 endings are bad and I probably shouldn't be bothered by it but it's my review so.....if I didn't like something....I'm going to say I didn't like it. Basically the endings consist of you kill one guy or you kill the other guy or you kill both guys. Killing Barisov means you basically help the bad guy take over the world but then he becomes paranoid of you and you have a falling out. The world is still pretty much controlled by Russia but now there is 2 warring factions within Russia. If you kill Demichev the bad guy (you also go back in time and kill yourself thereby killing Demichev in the past) (I think the developers THOUGHT this was theoretically the "best" ending), you still wind up with a Russia controlled communist world only it's run by Barisov instead (supposedly the benevolent dictator...yea, riiiight). The last ending is killing both guys and you escape/disappear into obscurity with most people either considering you a myth or a fairy tale but then some years later a tyrannical evil dictator rises up with bizarre powers and takes over the world which is clearly implied to be you. I really do enjoy games where your moral choices have consequences and this isn't a game that pretends to be that. With that being said, not having an ending where you can put the timeline back to the way it was; that, combined with 3 HORRIBLE endings, just left me feeling a bit down. I did NOT feel good completing the game. I'm no Russia hater and I'm certainly not so jingoistic (look it up, it's a great word) to imply America ruling the world would have any less corruption but not having a morally high ground ending just left me feeling unsatisfied. Certainly not enough to not recommend the game, I was just disappointed to a fairly large degree. I doubt I will be replaying this any time soon. Bottom line, a really well done game with 3 terrible endings.[/spoiler]

I would be really interested to know what others who have completed the game think of this review. Maybe I'm just too sensitive but I do really love America.

30862195.review:
A game that i would compare to HL2, but with less diversity. You get a chrono tool that lets you create time bubbles or let you age enemies and also you can catch rockets or grenades with it and fling them back. It feels a bit like the gravity gun. The enemies you encounter are slow and fast zombie like creatures and also soldiers. 

I guess you allready saw, why i think the game is a bit like HL2 and i would even go that far, that they took the game as inspiration. But its not a bad clone and it realy worth to play trough.

The only thing that annoyed me a bit was, that the textures load on the running game.
This way you dont have loading times between the maps, but you see here and the low res textures on walls and items.

-Music 06/10 
there was background music, but if i would hear any background song of this game, i can't say if it is from singularity)
-Sound 09/10 
can't realy say much about this, the sound effects where good, the voiceacting also (german), just the lip synchronisation, wasnt on point all the time
-Graphics 07/10
If the textures where fully loaded, the game looks nice. But if you see then these washed out textures, then it killed the scenery
Gameplay 8/10
You gain 7 weapons throughout the game which basicly fills the minimum range
Pistol, SMG, Shotgun, Sniperrifle, Minigun, Nailgun (Load for to shoot, explodes after a while) and a grenade launcher.
You can also wear for a time being 2 "superweapons" Remotebullet rifle (pretty cool) a rocket launcher.

Since you wear 2 weapons at a time, you mostly use the weapons the soldier wield to get a supply of ammo.
They often use the SMG and the Shotgun, so these are mainly your weapons.

There are some gravity riddles, the level is mostly linear and you have a few bossfights.
Phasing between the time, is possible at different points, but this is just to transport you to the next area (okay these is ONE puzzle, where you can wear a create trough these time cracks).

I give the game 75%, so it worths to buy it.

30849500.review:
Let me just start by saying that this is, hands down the best Time Manipulator game I've ever played.

The combat in this game makes great fun, mostly because of all your powers that comes from your "TMD" or so to say, Time Manipulation Device.

With it you can

[b]Age:[/b] [list]
[*]Speeds up the aging process of objects and/or enemies. (Using the ability on humans will kill them instantly, turning them into a pile of dust and bones.)
[*]Using the ability on "Zeks" (Which is the most common mutant you'll encounter throughout the game) will slow them down.[/list]

[b]Renew:[/b][list]
[*]Renews the state of objects to its original state.[/list]

[b]Revert:[/b][list]
[*]An upgrade of the Age/Renew ability that will turn soldiers into mutants.[/list]

[b]Impulse:[/b][list]
[*]Lets out a short ranged burst of energy from the device, knocking back enemies and objects.
[*]Can be upgraded at the Augmentor to increase range and damage.[/list]

[b]Chronolight:[/b][list]
[*]The chronolight allows you to pull objects that are out of phase back into our dimension.[/list]

[b]Gravity Manipulation:[/b][list]
[*]This is the first upgrade to your TMD and this is where the fun begins! This ability will let you lift most things up, e.g explosive barrels, hand grenades, missiles. This ability is what makes [i]the combat great fun.[/i]
[*]You can also loot items at a distance with the Gravity Manipulation ability.[/list]

[b]Deadlock:[/b][list]
[*]This is the second upgrade to your TMD and it creates a blue sphere that slows objects within its range.[/list]

[b]ChronoPing:[/b][list]
[*]Creates glowing footsteps showing you where to go (in case you get lost).[/list]


All these abilites (or well at least most of them) can be upgrade through stationary devices called [i]Augmentors.[/i]
You can also use the Augmentors to upgrade your character, e.g your health, your stamina, your maximum TMD energy etc, etc...

You also use your powers to solve a few puzzles (Don't worry if you're not a puzzle fan, it's not what the game's focused on so you won't be doing puzzles throughout half of the game if that's what you thought).

The story is linear and REALLY good, I've been told a lot of times not to judge a book by its cover, but it still happens from time to time. And since the publisher of the game is the one and only Activision I thought it would just be another shooter (Of course an enjoyable one since that's what Activision does).

[b]BUT...[/b] I was wrong, the game really surprised me with its story, it continued to pursue this line of argument throughout the entire story... This added up with the combat made this purchase one of my most worthy purchases of all time. I really enjoyed it and will probably play it through multiple times in the future.

RECOMMENDED!

30821131.review: This is the FPS you should be playing. It's fantastic. An FPS/RPG style hybrid where you find resources to upgrade your weapons and abilities. Abilities? Yes, you control TIME. Not just the cheesy slow bullets time either, but you can rapidly age doors to rust them off their hinges, reverse time to reconstruct a rotted bridge, etc. The center of the story is time manipulation, so you can kind of assume the story is all about time travel and the complexities of how that might work. The story isn't revolutionary, but it is well done. The shooting is fun and most of the combat feels very well balanced and executed. This is one of those hidden gems that simply did NOT get the attention it deserved.

30766381.review:
The most irresponsible time travelling I think I've ever done in a first person shooter.


What's good:
Solid shooting mechanics. 
Linear gameplay, but very polished.
Crazy alternate timeline.
Good voice acting.
Time manipulation super powers.
Creepy atmosphere.


What's not good:
Small, irritating explodey enemies. (so annoying)
Tension destroying shooting segments.
Glowy yellow critical hit places on bosses. (seriously? Why does everyone do this now?)
Ubiquitous stair repair. 
Unsatisfying ending choices.


Overall a very enjoyable game. Should take you about six hours to get through. More if you take your time trying to find all of the little secrets stashed everywhere. 

You should try it if you're looking for a creepy FPS with time travel elements.


Here's a link to my full review on my website:
http://www.opinionatedslant.com/singularity

Complete with screenshots!

30730996.review:
I absolutely loved this one. 
Like a perfect blend between Bioshock and Half-Life in terms of gameplay, in a setting which kind of reminds of Metro 2033 with a story as twisting as Bioshock Infinte. 

I heard of this game by mere coincidence, as some would say, or rather, echoes in the time-space; and decided to look it up. It is true as many people say, this is a game which has not really gotten the attention it deserves. Maybe a little overshadowed by the titles mentioned above. But anyone who enjoyed those games will love this one, as it is a awesome hybrid between them all. 

It also kind of takes you back (intended) to a time when gaming was simple yet satisfying. Not extremely complex mechanics and character leveling and ability systems. There are some character and equipment upgrades which can be done, and although they affect the gameplay a lot, it does not really take the attention away from the game. 

Secrets and bonuses are not that challenging to find, yet rewarding. And there are some really neat references, both subtle and blatantly obvious. 
You will most likely experience at least one 'jump scare' and one annoying puzzle mechanic. But other than that, it is more a 'aim, shoot, kill and reload' kind of game with a really intriguing story with several endings. 
Some parts of the story are actually possible to foresee and calculate beforehand, but the twists and time theory will get your mind blown at least once. 

Needlessly to say, it is a game well worth your attention and money. The game is of a satisfying length with all the classic elements and phases and will not consume too much of your time... he. he. 

I loved the ending which I experienced, with the subtle hints embedded. 
There are a major amount of red lines (or stars) to build upon, if one would ever find time to explain. 

Awesome game. 
Yeah, buy it.

And the confusing usage of cyrillic script at some points were truly amusing.
10/10, would love to visit 'Katoyaga 12' and pling the writer again.

30692762.review:
Singularity is often overlooked because it didn't do so well when it was released back in 2010, which is a bit of a shame because this is a solid shooter with a pretty nice story, satisfying combat and a cool time shifting gameplay mechanic. It's also not hard to see that the game is heavily influenced by Half-Life 2.

The graphics hold up well despite it's age and it runs smooth as butter without issues on modern systems like Windows 10. FOV is a bit of a problem though, being way too small, some people might experience motion sickness because of this. Luckily there are programs like Flawless Widescreen that will fix this easily without any tampering with the game files.

The game is a little short though, it will take you about 7 to 8 hours to finish it and the ending is a bit lackluster. That said, this is Raven Software's last game before being swallowed up by Activision and being the developers of such classics as Hexen, Soldier of Fortune, the Star Wars Jedi Knight series and Wolfenstein, you know they can provide an action packed game and that's exactly what Singularity is, short but sweet, and well worth a purchase for any FPS fan.

30536472.review:
I first heard about this game roughly six years ago when I was first getting into FPS games. It was described to me as some sort of mashup of Half-Life and Metro. I looked up some videos and chalked it down as some generic activision broshooter.

I was wrong.

I don't really remember how this game ended up in my library. I think I'd last played it sometime in... 2013 or 2014? All I knew is I ended up liking it. I was scrolling through my library reorganizing all my games earlier today when I saw this game on the list and I thought to myself "somehow I don't remember anything about this game other than it being cool".

I'm a couple hours into my second playthrough and yes, this game is as cool as I remember. I think if you want to more accurately describe it compared to other games, it's Half-Life meets Metro with a sprinkle of Bioshock and RE5/6. All in a good way. At it's core it's something of an action horror game. It's got a few jumpscares and the voice acting is hit and miss, but the level design, though linear, is well-paced and entertaining and the setpieces are beautiful. Just remember. Train boss. Remember. It's a good setpiece.

Visually... It's a bit dated for a game released in 2010, considering it's an Xbox 360 port, but on a technical level, despite the lack of very advanced graphics settings, the game looks clean and crisp and it's not hard to look at. (I've picked a few screenshot-worthy scenes already.) Optimization is fine, can't say a lot on that front.

All in all, I think this game has sooorta fallen out of the spotlight and just like me, I don't think a lot of people even remember it exists. Definitely a hidden gem at this point. Pick it up.

30208189.review:
[i]
Singularity es de esos shooters antiguos con muy buen balance entre historia y jugabilidad. La primera, por la ambientación pos Guerra Fría distópica mediados la década de 1950 y el año 2010, en la isla de Katorga 12, un reducto cercano a Sajalín, en la URSS y es/fue usada por los soviéticos para la investigación y producción de tecnologías basadas en un elemento que sólo se encuentra en aquella Isla, el E99.

Entre todas esas investigaciones: el DMT (Dispositivo de Manejo de Tiempo), que permite no sólo los viajes intertemporales, sino manipular objetos y seres a través de este.

En torno a lo anterior, gira una jugabilidad bastante bien lograda; que recoge buenas caractarísticas de otros juegos como Timeshift (por el manejo del tiempo), Bioshock (por el uso de "poderes" dados por el DMT) y los buenos Call of Duty (por su faceta FPS). Esa jugabilidad es bastante fértil, ya que no sólo permite mejoras del personaje, dispositivo y armas, sino que también ofrece un desarrollo entretenido, especialmente tras la segunda mitad de su campaña.

Para ser un juego de 2010, es un juego recomendado, principalmente por:

+++ Historia interesante, con viajes en el tiempo y buen ambiente, en torno a instalaciones científicas deterioradas. 

+++ Combates con grandes posibilidades dadas por la combinación de armas y los poderes del DMT.

+++ ¡Todavía tiene multijugador!

No obstante, hay que tenerse en cuenta que:

- El jugador ansioso, es fácil que crea que se trata de un juego soso si se basa en las primeras horas. Pero su desarrollo es así, y con el pasar del tiempo, nos enteramos de cómo va y se hace muy entretenido.

-- Es un juego lineal (como muchos de su época).

- A precio normal, es costoso (es de Activision, cómo no). Pero en rebajas, sí que vale su adquisición.

80/100. 

Gracias por leer.[/i]

30051800.review:
A non-cover based shooter that is pretty decent.

One complaint I have is that the power ups and upgrades aren't very relevant until late-game, and running out of ammo is a serious problem (especially when your standard melee attack gets replaced with an attack which uses another set of ammo). Considering how tough the enemies are until late game, this can be frustrating.

Another complaint is that the characters are flat. The only one who has any sort of depth is the villain, so the ending is kind of a non-issue (or it was for me anyway). The entire world could have ended and I wouldn't have been upset because I wasn't invested in any "reality" over any other, honestly. And yet, the ending was still better than the ending of Tyranny, which is a huge mark up in my book.

The graphics are good, there are a few jump scares (one very effective one) and a lot of the combat is fun once you get used to how spongy everyone is. Throwing explosive barrels and such at enemies or destroying cover and taking advantage of the battlefield yielded me some fun results. The atmosphere in some bits is pretty oppressive, though I think they could have taken better advantage of that than they did.

The voice acting is pretty good, the animation is decent, and overall the game is fun to play through. You can see that I have ~5 hours of play time as of this review, and that's about how long it took me to play through it. It's a bit short, but then, it didn't need to be longer.

Overall a very solid game, if imperfect. It's 7 years old at this point, so don't hold that against it. Pick it up on sale if you have an afternoon's worth of free time.

29914762.review:
Really good campaign FPS. The game overall reminds me of Hard Reset mixed with Half Life 2. 

It's got an interesting story, not spectacular but as far as FPS goes, it ranks up there. The shooting is solid, a bit bland with some weapons, the revolver and shotgun in particular are not very good but the rest of the arsenal feels pretty good to use. The weapons are quite aesthetically pleasing as well, they have that retro mixed with futuristic look. 

The best part about the game though is the powers, you get to slow down time, age and reverse age objects/people, you can turn a person into a monster and have him battle other humans for you, there's telekinesis, you feel badass basically.

The monster/level variety is good as well, it doesn't get boring and you're not stuck in the same place constantly fighting the same enemies, it keeps switching it up which keeps the game entertaining. I finished the game in one sitting and I never found myself wondering how long is left in the game and that's something that happens quite often with me.

The game does have a few drawbacks, for one it's quite short, I finished it in 5 hours only. The graphics are a little bit outdated, especially with some of the texture work but models and whatnot are mostly fine. Another thing I really didn't like was that you are only allowed to carry two weapons at a time, that means you don't really get to shoot some weapons as much unless you decide to play multiple times. 

The performance was surprisingly good too, constant 120+ fps for me (keep in mind I was playing on GTX 580), no drops or anything like that, not a single bug encountered, quite impressed with that. 

Definitely recommend for FPS fans.

29716412.review:
Singularity essaye très fort de reproduire ce qu'avait accompli Bioshock avant lui, mais reste au final un FPS passable, au concept excitant sur le papier mais quasiment inutile en pratique. 

Le temps, censé être au coeur du gameplay, est régulièrement exploité mais au travers d'actions gadgets (ouvrir des caisses, alimenter des portes, tuer des mecs) et de quelques bonnes trouvailles jamais renouvelées.

Pourtant, avec un peu d'imagination, on peut entreapercevoir ce qu'aurait pu donner les quelques bonnes idées présentes à une plus grande échelle. Je pense par exemple à cette scène où l'on parcourt un bateau en train de "vieillir", ces armes à l'utilisation singulière (projectiles dirigeables), ces décors changeant d'époque au gré des impulsions de la Singularité ou encore cette fin assez peu subtile mais néanmoins osée. 

Un jeu qui réussit à vous envoyer six heures dans le futur en ayant un peu trop vu le temps passer.

Awesome linear cooridor shooter where you use a gun that warps and uses time to your advantage. Great game to power through on a weekend!

Story is interesting and fun in an 80's movie way

7-8 hours of gameplay that never really slows down

CONS:
Reeks of late 2000's shooter (Kicking doors to shoot baddies in slow motion, equiping 2 weapons only, the only color is BROWN) 
No subtitles
Stupid easy half way through after a few powerups

I highly recommend Singularity if it somehow missed your radar if you liked games like Half-life 2, Bioshock, Timeshift, Doom 3, F.E.A.R., and Resistance.

29673705.review:
[h1]一个关于时间的悖论[/h1]

[strike]奇点这个游戏其实无视了一堆关于时间的悖论：外祖母悖论之类的，在玩的时候丢掉智商跟着编剧的节奏走其实很有趣的。[/strike]

游戏主要讲的是2010年美军奉命去某俄罗斯远东的小岛上去调查电磁风暴现象（[spoiler]世界线变动率1.000000[/spoiler]），之后主角刚到就被电磁风暴卷回了1955年，之后人都到了过去了，雁过留声，人过留名，随便干点啥就产生了蝴蝶效应（[spoiler]世界线变动率0.1234567[/spoiler]），时间表示自己直接gg，于是主角便在另一位iq破万的前苏联科学家（[spoiler]本来死了，由于主角改变了历史就幸存了[/spoiler]）的帮助下试图修正世界线。最后产生了三个结局（严重剧透：[spoiler]反正你主角最后也没能力把世界线还原到1.0000，最好的也是0.999999[/spoiler]）

嗯，另外。。。
日常黑毛子(1/1)

算了，我编不下去了，你们看这个剧情解析吧：
————WARNING：严重剧透————————
[spoiler][url=https://zhidao.baidu.com/question/162872387.html] https://zhidao.baidu.com/question/162872387.html[/url][/spoiler]
———————————————————————


[h1]汉化问题[/h1]

游戏全程无字幕，因此找不到汉化，收集要素录音机的内容全靠听力，Note部分字体看的也有点累，不过这些仅仅是帮助你更好的理解游戏剧情的，不看也可以。大部分录音机都是记录某个人在灾难发生后的挣扎的故事。

[spoiler]毛子味英语也是一个难点。。正统美音我都有些听不懂呢[/spoiler]

[h1]主观评分[/h1]
+剧情：时空穿梭+阴谋论好评。
+射击手感很好，手柄开辅助瞄准之后就是突突突的事情（手柄辅助瞄准紧闭GTA V直接黏人那种差一点，基本上准心附近开瞄准直接就会粘到人身上）。
+时间能力赛高！
+惊悚程度做得很好，前期确实我被吓到了（[spoiler]潜水转弯突然冒出一个尸体那块吓得我差点抛掉手柄。[/spoiler]）
+画质很好，难以想象这是2010年的游戏。
+多结局好评，但是读上一个checkpoint之后有一长段剧情不能跳过。
-武器虽然多，但是实际用到的还是那把冲锋枪最多，剩下几个不好找补给。
-没有字幕，有种莫名其妙的做了7h的英语听力考试的感觉。
-[spoiler]前期吓死我了，我可是连生化危机7都不敢玩的怂逼，我还以为这是个突突突的游戏呢，到那时想到自己买的游戏，哭着也要玩完。QAQ[/spoiler]

最终得分： 8.7/10 
没法汉化，因此不给9分，哼╭(╯^╰)╮。

推荐：如果英语能力过关，对于时空方面的游戏（比如说：量子破碎之类的）感兴趣，建议打折时入手。

[spoiler]当年在大众软件杂志上看到过这个游戏发售前的介绍，没想到时隔7年终于玩到了，感谢G胖[/spoiler]

[b]只是可惜了，这样一个神作却由于没有内置字幕导致埋汰。[/b]

Singularity is truly a diamond in the rough of first-person shooters. It has a solid and compelling story with a nearly silent hero. It borrows elements from Bioshock, Half-Life and Doom. The game is quite short with only about 7-8 hours of playtime. I recommend you grab this when it is on sale. Here are some key points you should know before you purchase Singularity. 

[b] Pros: [/b]

[list]
[*]Fun and interesting abilities that let you manage every fight
[*]Various enemies 
[*]Dismemberment 
[*]Engaging story 
[*]Upgrades to weapons and equipment 
[*]Great voice acting
[/list]

[b] Cons: [/b]
[list]
[*]Low replayability 
[*]Linear level design 
[*]Some textures look quite dated
[*]The game is a console port and has a very low FOV which takes a little getting used to or can be corrected with a mod. [*]However, some mods don't work so you might need to search around to find which one works for you. 
[/list]

[b] Note: There is a post-credits scene! Don't worry, even if you skip the credits you will not skip the scene! [/b]

29481380.review:
[h1]Комунистический bratushka[/h1]
В своей странной любви к шутерам категории B внезапно наткнулся на эту игру, которая является сводным братом Колл оф дюди и внезапно Биошока. Весь замес происходит на страшном секретном советском острове Каторга-12, где когда-то 60 лет назад проводились страшные советские комунистические эксперименты над страшным элементом, но что-то пошло не так. Помимо страшных мутантов зомби в мясорубку ввязываются стремные современные русские спецназеры, а во время командировок в прошлое еще и уютные красноармейцы с Kalashnokov-47.
Не смотря на сеттинг больше напоминающий клюквенный кисель, в игре очень забористый и динамичный сюжет, постоянно куда-то толкающий игрока на различные приключения. То в канализацию с зомбями, то на барикады, то в прошлое, то в будущее, то за миловидной бабой, туда-сюда и обратно. Причем сюжет развивается настолько динамично, что по возвращению во времени сразу в лицо кидает тебе изменения, мучительного саспенса "И грянул гром" здесь и близко нет.
А в остальном обычный серый шутерок, с движком и механикой 1-2 Модерн варфаеров, намеком на прокачку и прикольные спецспособности + бонус-треком разные концовочки в пределах 3 минут от последнего чек-пойнта (после прохождения можно понажимать их все).

29219594.review:
[h1]1-sentence Review :[/h1]
Surprisingly good game, thanks to its well crafted atmosphere, its convincing settings in an abandoned Russian scientific base where things went wrong, and a couple of original gameplay mechanisms, but unfortunately not great FPS due to its lack of rhythm, intensity and challenge, Singularity is overall a very decent experience if you manage to turn your brain off on all the little and bigger discrepancies of the game.

[h1]Pros :[/h1]
- Nice atmosphere, intriguing and slightly oppressive
- Decent variation of the enemies
- 1 good boss fight
- No save/load, but decent placement of the checkpoints (with a couple of exceptions)
- Decent time to beat the game : around 12-14 hours, without speeding :)
- Time based powers offering unique gameplay possibilities
- Nice story, but...

[h1]Cons :[/h1]
- ...But a lot of things in the story don't make much sense, especially the ending(s)
- The time based powers have 0 reality logic, it's only game logic (eg: you can make environment older, but only the specific parts designed to do so)
- FPS gameplay really lacks of impact & intensity ; it's significantly less engaging than the best FPS games
- In Hard difficulty, the game is globally very easy for the average hardcore gamer, except for a few hard passages (which are welcome)
- 1 small mini-bomb enemy is really painful (painful isn't same as hard ;-) ), especially coupled to the next point
- Our character doesn't run fast enough, can sprint only for a very short time, and is easy to get stuck in crumbles or crate edges while doing so
- Loot is somewhat random but it doesn't bring anything (except made me want to load the last checkpoint on a couple occasions)
- There are 2 or 3 times more health-packs and ammunition than required to beat the game
- You can upgrade each weapon point by point, which means you're very encouraged to always use the same weapon, especially as you'll never lack ammunition for it, which brings some lack of variety in the fights
- No subtitles for the numerous video and in-game audio-logs
- It misses a couple of special (and usable) weapons... eg: where is my plasmagun ?!? ;-)

[h1]FOV & Resolution :[/h1]
the FOV in the game is quite narrow so it might not be of the taste of everybody ; moreover, the game doesn't support resolution bigger than 1920x1080.
To fix these 2 issues, get this : https://www.flawlesswidescreen.org/ ; it's not ideal, but it's working.

29211112.review:
[h1]Teal Deer[/h1]
[list]
[*][b]Developers:[/b] Raven Software
[*][b]Publishers:[/b] Activision
[*][b]Initial release:[/b] Jun 2010
[*][b]Genre:[/b] FPS, Action, Time Manipulation, Horror, lite Puzzle Solving 
[*][b]#Worth/NotWorth:[/b] #HellYes
[*][b]BSERC[/b] - (Borderline Sardonic and Extremely Reductive Comparison): TimeShift, Project Snowblind
[/list]
[h1]Exposition, Concurrence and Summation[/h1]

[i][b]Singularity[/b] is a hidden gem of a bygone era [/i]

The mid to late Double Aughts is a era of semi generic saturation. Not only were there a bountiful number action/FPS games but they all had extremely similar vibes. Not to mention the few that were literally about the same subject. Time Manipulation and/or some sort of physics manipulation. 

Singularity is one that got completely buried, even more so on PC than the much smaller number of titles available each console generation. Just remember for a moment. Resistance: Fall of Man,  TimeShift, FEAR, Half Life 2, Project Snowblind, BLACK, Dead Space, Mass Effect, Timespltters, Psi Ops, Fracture.. Hell for the sake of brevity let us not forget the other end of the spectrum -- Darkest of Days and Legendary; and the list goes on. I list all these just to reiterate how incredibly saturated the market was. There was no one to save Singularity from itself. Keep in mind this list is omitting however many iterations of Call of Duty, Battlefield and Medal of Honor there were at the time. 

[h1]Gameplay[/h1]
This game still holds up. Granted, it is not as old as some of those others. The guns feel good. The powers feel good. They integrate in ways you may not expect from initial inspection. I only played this once on PC and have indeed played it back in the day so I admittedly have some nostalgia. 

You collect E99, a fictional substance required to power the TMD or Time Manipulation device. This has two types, one to power more effective means of dispatching enemies and one to spend on upgrades. These are however separate from weapon upgrades. The game also has some lite puzzle solving which will task you from throwing stasis fields, rapidly aging and restoring objects that have E99 present within them usually to remove some sort of blockage. 

There are a lot of elements from other games I still yet did not mention. It feels little like BioShock at times. Only in it's [i]”feel”[/i]. There is a weapon called a Seeker which allows you to in slow motion control the path of an explosive bullet. I'd mention Heavenly Sword here but I feel the power of referential definitions is starting run out. There is also a grenade launcher that allows you to roll a grenade on the ground under and through obstacles should you wish. [i] Inserts Insomniac weapon design[/i]. 

[b]THE GIST
Singularity is one of those like I said, is a semi generic FPS action game and if you'll excuse the unintentional pun. It's kind of like a time capsule. No one really has any reverence yet for these late 00's shooters. But it's essentially a dead genre. Singularity I think, captures the essence of this era while still feeling very modern.[/b]

[url=http://store.steampowered.com/curator/25764029/][i]Follow my curation for more[/i][/url]

29148100.review:
Solid shooter. I liked the plot and the atmosphere. Had some good jump scares and some genuinely creeeeepy moments. A decent take on time travel story-wise. The only negatives I would give the game are the following:

1. It has a BAD case of "consolitis". Meaning that you can tell it was primarily designed for game consoles not PC gaming. This is NEVER a good thing.

--You can only have two weapons which is stupid and really restricts the fun as you often don't have the weapon you need for a certain situation and keeps you from experimenting with new weapons when you've settled in on two you find useful. 
--You only have save points in the game and can't save when you want to. This keeps you from exploring and trying different things. On top of that you only have one save so once you hit a save spot, you can't go back to previous spots. At least there's plenty of them so you hardly ever have to replay large sections of the game when you die or have to quit in the middle of an save chunk. Also, the game immediately closes off any area you've been to so there's no going back for any reason. 

2. The ending is, iffy. There are four total endings and while it does let you go back and do each one without restarting the game, none of them are particularly satisfying. Not bad just not satisfying. It appears that they left it pseudo-open for the sequel that's never going to happen now that the company has been disbanded.

All in all a fun ride with some slight flaws. Don't know if I'd play through it again, but I'd certainly recommend it.

SIИGULAЯITY  научно-фантастический шутер от 1 лица разработанный студией Raven Software 

Перед нами стандартный FPS с элементами хоррора. Действие игры проходит на острове "Каторга 12" c весьма мрачной историей. На острове случилась техногенная катастрофа, превратившая всех его жителей в чудовищ. СССР нашли новый минерал E-99 по-своему потенциалу превосходящий любое оружие в мире и в ходе пары тройки неудачных экспериментов утопили Каторгу-12 в крови "постоянные ядерные взрывы, временные аномалии, монстры. Все радости жизни нас радостно ждут" В целом сюжет для шутера крайней достойный. В наличии 3 концовки и небольшая нелинейность "появляющаяся только в финале, но всё же" Клюквенный сеттинг так же не сильно бьёт по мозгам. Камуняки захватили мир, разработали убер оружие, диктатура и всё в таком духе. Медведей в шапке ушанке и I like to drink vodka в игре не наблюдается. Вполне себе стандартная научная фантастика с путешествиями во времени, диктатурой и злым главный Генеральным секретарём партии, свергнувшим Хрущёва "не дал мужику США кукурузой засеять" 

Плюсы: 
+ Добротная клюква в игропроме и кинематографе достаточно редкое явление
+ Нелинейный сюжет 
+ Один из лучших Миниганов в играх 

Минусы: А вот здесь всё на много сложнее. Игра не предлагает ни каких новых идей и если вы опытный игрок скорее всего ничем удивить она не сможет. СССР да и вся сюжетная линия антагонистов больно напоминает Wolfenstein, Ундервафля главного героя передаёт привет BioShock, заигрывание с путешествиями во времени так же не ново, Спец способности протагониста тратят через чур, много ресурсов по этому их применение за частую бесполезно, разнообразный арсенал оружия в этой игре не используется "Автомат и Миниган слишком имбалансные стволы" Добавляем сюда Unreal Engine 3 с подгрузками текстур. Максимальное разрешение 1280x720 "абалденно в прямоугольнике играть" и в целом отсутствие графических настроек. Короткую продолжительность. На среднем уровне сложности игра заняла всего 5 часов "я смотрел все 3 концовки" Да и в целом выглядит она очень вторично, хотя при этом играется очень приятно. 

Итог: 6.5/10

P.s Рекомендовать её или нет вопрос очень сложный. Если только на безрыбье или новичкам. Опытному игроку она ничего предложить не сможет. Особого челленджа в ней тоже нет. Так развлекуха на 1 вечер.

29062301.review:
[h1] DISCLAIMER: This is a full review, and NOT a first impressions review like all my other reviews, if you want a better full review, then please read better reviews then mine [/h1]

Singularity is a game developed by Raven Software and published by Activision. Singularity is singularly good (#cleverwording)

This little-known title is a cracker of a game which, even though it borrows from several other games, does so in it’s own idiosyncratic and original way rather than simply ripping them off. There isn’t a dull moment in its five or so hours of gameplay and the always enjoyable combat is backed by a solid story, good voice acting, some cool enemies, and a decent A.I.

There’s a wide variety of weapons available and every one of them feels good to wield and most of them produce very satisfying results. However, it’s the Time Manipulation Device (or TMD) that’s the star of the show and this weapon/tool is impressively designed and implemented. It allows the player to manipulate both time and matter in a number of ways every one of which is great fun to use

Graphically the game is acceptable enough, although some of the textures leave a little to be desired, some people have experienced glitches but I had none, and you get to fight your way through a reasonably varied range of well-designed environments

As a story-driven, linear FPS, Singularity hits the nail on the head and does so with a refreshing streak of inventiveness and individuality. I just wish it had lasted a little longer, as I was having so much fun!

[h1] RECOMMENDED :) [/h1]

28748287.review: This game is a underrated FPS gem. Singularity is a 2010 FPS by the legendary developers Raven Soft. The game is set in two timelines. One in 1950 and one in 2010. There is obviously some time travel involved and the TMD. TMD stands for Time Manipulation Device. This device gives you varying abilities, including but not limited to deploying  a stasis field and rapidly aging and unageing objects. Using this abilities is a lot of fun and very well implemented. The game has a unusual difficulty curve in the sense that it stars out hard and becomes easier as you get more abilities. The is one of the best FPS games I played this year. The only problem I have is that the game is short at 9 hours per playthrough. Definitely recommend.

28740309.review:
So Singularity is a game made by Raven software back before they were just another call of duty studio. This game did not sell very well and thats why they just help with call of duty games now. 

This game is fairly unique taking place in a world were the soviete union never fell, it doesnt really go into why it never fell but insteads it takes place on a single island that the USSR abandoned for an unkown reason. The US government sends you  and others to find out what this island is. Then pretty much in the first 10 minutes everything goes wrong. The helicopter you are riding in goes down and only 1 other member survives. You make your way thru the island which has tones of lore and stuff to click on. You find out this place was to test an element called E-99 that was suppposed to beat Americas nuclear power. 

This element E-99 has some crazy powers to it and you find out it could be used to alter reality like making plants grow or even reverse aging. But with all things it was used as a weapon and thats were things went really wrong on this island because it mutated people and multiple other things. 

So a little while later you enter a building after seeing an amazing bust of Stalin ( most likely made of Stalinium)  and soon after you get sent back in time right when the facility went defunct and exploded. It takes a weird turn when you rescue a random person. It terns out rescuing this person had weird affects on time. 

This is all about the first 30 minutes of the story. 

Lets talk about gameplay.

It starts out has a horror game with spooky parts and jumpscares ( really there is jumpscares thru the entire game).  The gun play is pretty close to call of duty. If you remove the monsters and just have weird time stuff this could of easilt been called Call of duty:  Singularity thru time or some other name. 

Besides the random monster encounters you are shooting at generic Soviet soldiers, the only real change in these soldiers is basically juggernauts like ion call of duty. This game is really similar to call of duty. 

The monster designs are pretty unique rather then just simple zombies. There is a tall stretched out one, mutated soldiers that have electrical powers and can teleport and more I dont want to spoil all the monsters. 

Besides the generic shooting you have several weird weapons that rely on E-99 they are mostly useless and I just found the shotgun be good for 95% of the game. The other 5% I used the minigun. 

Then finally you get a time device that goes on your wrist. It has several uses like fixing broken things, braking working things, aging monsters and creating time bubbles. YOu can also kill enamies with it but it was just easier to unload on enamies with the shotgun. 

There was one part that I thought was pretty unique. The way it put you into the stealth section instead of just disabling your weapon or punishing you for using it in said part the game slowly made ammo more and more scarce leading up to this part so by the time you got to the stealth section you had little to no ammo. 

The best thing about the game are the endings. Yes endings plural and they are all amazing. Honestly the endings blew me away. Now I only did one ending but I watched the others.

The game has multiplayer but I dont think anyone is playing it. 

This game is great but has some flaws. 7.5/10. Get it during a steam sale. 

My letsplay 
https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLde6zR52GkyvOZlxqwxFztAnPQpU1CJg4

28650051.review:
Singularity crossed my radar back in 2012, someone from a gaming club i was part of suggested it. Apparently it didnt do so well upon release and im not surprised since i didnt even know it existed. 
I bought it for the Xbox 360 and i really liked it, it seemed like a cross between Fear 2 and COD4 and i was pleasantly surprised by this. 
The games' plot is rather thin and rather cliche, but i like it none the less. It has an engaging plot (although the "twist" is revealed to you in the fist 30 minutes so i wouldnt really call it a twist) that held my attention all the way until the end. The A.I. is competent enough and there are some interesting mechanics at play, namely that the player can use time travelling abilities. The use of time travel has been done before in games but the game keeps the idea fresh by introducing some cool puzzles and making the game challenging while fun.

The game isnt terribly long (about 8 hours or so) but considering the price these days that seems like an okay deal. 

The issue i have with it is that the graphics options are non- existant. You can choose between a handful of resolutions (although there are not nearly enough choices in my opinion) and a few other bits but there are no advanced settings like shadows, lighting, or even textures. The game looks okay in general but the textures look awful in some areas and the lighting effects have aged terribly. 

Desipte these issues the game does run like a dream! 

There are a few other minor issues: The hit- detection seems flimsey at times, there is no navigation indecator or mini- map, and you basically trip over health kits and e99 which detracts away from the challenge somewhat (although this is negated slightly by the puzzles). 

All in all it is a good game, but my recommendation depends on price. If you can get the game for less than £10 then i'd say its worth it, if not then dont bother. 

Id give it a 3/5 stars

28648043.review:
[i]Борис, пришла пора уничтожить этот Америка! Допивай водка и нажимай кнопка, красный как борсч.[/i]
Именно такой забористой клюквой встретит нас [b]Singularity[/b] (матрешки приобретаются отдельно) По сюжету после второй мировой войны в гонке ядерного вооружения ученые СССР обнаружили новый элемент E99. В дальнейшем на крупном месторождении этого элемента, что на поверку оказался великолепной заменой урану, был построен научный город Каторга-12 (какой бы русский добровольно поехал жить в город с таким названием - любезно умалчивается) Однако ученые не смогли сдержать крутой нрав нового элемента и в результате катастрофы почти все погибли, а проект было решено закрыть. 

[h1]ОЦЕНКА*[/h1][url=http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=412623516]*Что означает каждая оценка? А также полный список всех моих обзоров можно увидеть кликнув по этому тексту.[/url]
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=863758541
[h1]РАЗБОР ИГРЫ[/h1]
Спустя несколько лет на заброшенном объекте произошел мощный радиоактивный выброс, который Россия никак не прокомментировала, и американским государством было решено выслать туда разведку в мирных целях (несколько хорошо вооруженных отрядов).
Наш протагонист - капитан Ренко, как раз входит в один из таких отрядов. Уже на месте он попадает во временную аномалию и сам того не ведая сильно меняет историю не в лучшую сторону. Теперь основной целью будет разобраться в творящемся хаосе и по возможности всё вернуть в зад.

Как игра [b]Singularity[/b] добротный шутер от первого лица, что сделан студией [b]Raven[/b] которая собаку съела в этом жанре. 
Механика, как это сейчас принято говорить с ностальгическими нотками в голосе, работает по старым канонам. Никакого зализывания ран и отсиживания укрытиях. Прём в лоб и питаемся исключительно аптечками дабы не помереть. 

Оружие представлено стандартным набором (пистолет, автомат, дробовик и т.д.). Взять с собой можно только два типа. И изредка находить диковинные прототипы, работающие на новой технологии, как например полуавтоматическая винтовка, пулей которой можно управлять. Помимо оружия Ренко находит Мобильный Временной Преобразователь, благодаря которому все бои приобретают особый окрас. 

МВП способен устаревать или омолаживать объекты. Рассыпать в прах укрытие врага, рассыпать в прах самого врага, создавать аномальные зоны, где течение времени замедляется, всё это можно в тактическом плане использовать в свою пользу. Помимо этого, МВП умеет вполне сильно бодаться (руки с ногами разлетаются у всех, кто оказался в радиусе поражения) и работать как грави-пушка из [b]Half-Life 2[/b].  В результате получаем ультимативный девайс, отвечающий на все вопросы по ходу сюжетной кампании.

Вне боя МВП может использоваться для решения простеньких головолом. Порой, правда, притянутых за уши. Как например главный герой может скакнуть в прошлое, чтобы вырвать от туда ящик и перенести его в будущее и всё это ради того, чтобы залезть на припятсвие нам по грудь. 

Враги попадаются разные - от обычных людей, до очень быстрых монстров. К каждым нужен свой подход, а по сюжету нам даже встретится пара боссов, что для жанра редкое событие. 

Проходя миссии внимательные игроки могут находить E99 в капсухал, чтобы улучшать себя (больше здоровья и крепче морда) или разные чертежи и комплекты деталий, для своего оружия. Смысла в ней только не особо много. 

Игра проходится быстро и задорно. Всю кампанию можно пробежать за 6-7 часов и даже получить от этого удовольствие.
Жаль, что над самим миром [b]Raven[/b] потрудились хуже. Помимо капающей с потолка клюквы, в игре полно агит.роликов, которые почему-то построены скорее по лекалам американской пропаганды, а встречающиеся записки и бобины с аудио-дневниками унылы чуть меньше чем полностью.

[h1]Singularity на самом деле жалко. У Raven была возможность сделать игру уровня Resistance 3 - но получился неплохой шутер, за которым приятно посидеть пару вечеров. но не более.[/h1]

28560739.review:
[b]Ты очередной герой, который решил найти приключений на свою задницу. 
На свободную высадку американских на территории явно всем пофиг... Ни Китаю, ни России. 
Эта игра стала прорадителем игры Quantum Break.

[h1][b]О межпространственных временных червоточинах из 70х :[/b][/h1]
• на просторных локациях сразу можно увидеть явную халтуру... достаточно взять снайперку или приглядеться в даль, как увидишь либо фон, либо 2D текстурки.
• американцы явно не знают, что таблица Менделеева есть таблица Менделеева... ну ни как столпа из элементы. 
• по ходу сюжета, разработчики так и не определились, что у них за жанр... но что-то про сингулярность.

• противники даже не стараются спрятать голову... прям какой-то тир. 
• противники не способны попасть в героя, который на 50% высовывается из укрытия.

• как удачно, что при катастрофе он выжил. 
• как удачно, что он повлиял на ход истории, чтобы сюжет произошел. 
• как удачно, что именно он нашел прибор изменения временной сингулярность. 
• в принципе, после получения прибора оружия больше не нужны. 
• если ничего не делать, то противники будут кричать "Противник замечен, нужна помощь !" бесконечно.

[h1][b]Межвременная сингулярность пространства : 7.4/10[/b][/h1]
Повсюду злие русский... Развлекайтесь ![/b]

28511596.review:
Singularly good

This little-known title is a cracker of a game which, even though it borrows from several other games, does so in it’s own idiosyncratic and original way rather than simply ripping them off. There isn’t a dull moment in its 10 or so hours of gameplay and the always enjoyable combat is backed by a solid story, good voice acting, some cool enemies, and a decent AI. There’s a wide variety of weapons available and every one of them feels good to wield and most of them produce very satisfying results. However, it’s the Time Manipulation Device that’s the star of the show and this weapon/tool is impressively designed and implemented. It allows the player to manipulate both time and matter in a number of ways every one of which is great fun to use. Graphically the game is acceptable enough, although some of the textures leave a little to be desired (some people have experienced glitches but I had none), and you get to fight your way through a reasonably varied range of well-designed environments. As a story-driven, linear FPS SINGULARITY hits the nail on the head and does so with a refreshing streak of inventiveness and individuality. I just wish it had lasted a little longer, as I was having so much fun. 4/5

28503843.review:
Я давно слышал об этой игре, и она довольно долго висела у меня в списке желаемого. В прошлую распродажу я приобрел и только спустя 9 месяцев, когда мне захотелось сыграть в какой-нибудь коротенький экшн я запустил её.
Если вкратце, то игра хороша. Да, к ней можно предъявить несколько претензий, но все они мелкие и никак не меняют общее впечатление от игры: сюжетные дыры, отсутствие последнего босса или, хотя бы какого-либо вызова в последнем уровне, ограничение в 2 пушки и большое количество клюквы (для некоторых это минус).
По сути, это обычная Колда, но с прокачкой, скилами, монстрами, совьет солдатен и временными петлями. По отдельности мы это видели, и не раз, но все вместе нет (при таких элементах игре бы больше подошел открытый мир, под тип метроидвании). Механика стрельбы (кроме пистолета и рейлгана) хороша, впечатляющих моментов много, а игра старается подкидывать вам новые ситуации.
Разработчикам из Raven Software (Hexen, Soldiers of Fortune, Quake 4, Star Wars Jedi Knight: Jedi Academy, Wolfenstein и др.) невезло. Они делали хорошие игры, но их нормально не рекламировали, не разводили хайп, а в последние годы постоянно урезали бюджет и сроки выпуска и, как результат, продавались их игры плохо. Согласно steamspy эта игра имеется всего лишь у 150 000 людей, и это с учетом того, что игра несколько раз была в Хамблбандле, что для игры такого плана недостаточно. Как результат, большая часть сотрудников уволена, а сама компания сейчас находится в анальном рабстве у Активижн, где рисует мультиплеерные карты для Калища. Sad story.

28396577.review:
This game out of all the games I have played from Half-Life 2, to PORTAL 1 (& 2), to Time Rifters is one of the more interesting but odd FPS game I have played in recent years, with a great concept that had a good execution in the conclusion, let's start off with the basic main setting, you are a soldier in what I think is either the Russian Military, US Army, or Marine Core, going to investigate a abandonned island near Russia to find a small town near the docks in ruins, to which, as you explore to see what happened, a big wave of energy then came towards you before you are transported into the past, which was the same area, except newly developed & on fire, but as you are running through the burning down facility, you come across a man trying to get out of a burning room to which you save him, & after so you are transported back to your time... But wait, there's more, the man you saved, has changed the world drastically, negative or positive? Not gonna spoil it, you have to play it.
Now onto the gameplay, & mechanics, the hit detection always seemed okay, all my shots hit the enemy I was aiming at in  the right way, the guns are fairly different from real life guns, making them look interesting & new, but in all reality, they handle the same as real life guns, but this isn't a modern shooter as it includes medpacks, the sound effects of the guns don't sound all too impactful, but it isn't too bad, now onto the other mechanics, later on in the beginning you recieve this device known as the TMD, which can do many things, such as making objects age to new, or age to dust, but this doesn't exactly do this to everything, but it is still used while not feeling too much like a gimmick as you will come across new safe's that you have to age so you can get whats inside, or find a aged crate you can bring into modern age so you can get whats inside of it, & along side this you get whats called the Deadlock, to which you fire out an orb that expands on contact, & inside this orb time is slowed down, basically it's bullet time but only for a specific area, so it isn't too special, but it still is an interesting gadget incase there is a group of enemies, never gets old deadlocking a bunch of enemies in a area before blasting all their heads with a shotgun.
My overall conclusion, the story itself is intruiging, but what always scratched my head is how under developed some characters feel like, to which, there are pretty much only four characters in this campaign you really meet, now as for the overall gameplay, it is non-stop action, & even when the game takes a break to tell story, it is usually short & fast, one thing I wish they did in this game is to maybe make it more challenging, there are some frustrating areas, but this game is overall easy, & if your an experienced FPS player, I'd highly suggest playing it on Hard mode, cause even on hard mode for me, a player who beat DOOM, & QUAKE, only beat this game in 5-6 hours, & yes, this game did needed length cause it is a short game, but for a short game, it is damn worth every penny (Atleast, on the sale, buy it on sale), as it is so fun, I overall give it a 7/10 Great Fun, but a few short ends that keeps this game from being "Game of The Year" Great. 
But to me, it is "Underrated FPS of The Decade" Great.

28335523.review:
Singularity had the potential to be something truly great. A promising concept (time manipulation) combined with an interesting sci-fi plot, Singularity instead doesn't use its chosen gimmick to its fullest, relegating it to mild puzzle solving (with some occasional gigantic logic holes - why can't I just climb over this collapsed door instead of crawling through yet more sewer pipe to get to the same place?) and some moderately useful combat abilities, most of which can only be used a handful of times per engagement; I ended up forgetting I had them. In addition, the game has only one proper boss fight and basically gives you God Mode near the end, making the difficulty not so much peak as plunge. You can get through practically the entire game with the assault rifle and the shotgun (the game conveniently provides a nearby sniper rifle whenever the situation calls for it).

That's not to say Singularity is a bad game. It isn't. The shooting feels tight and the ability to upgrade the damage, capacity, and reload times of your weapons is neat. It just could have been so, so much better if they had used their tools more effectively, given us more to do with the time manipulation mechanic, and hadn't tried to crowbar in some Bioshock-esque "twists" near the end. Missed opportunities, but still worth getting on sale.

7/10

28307491.review:
Singularity é outro daqueles títulos de qualidade razoável, mas que ninguém conhece.  Não é uma obra prima, mas entrega uma excelente atmosfera de tensão ao redor da história, apesar de apostar todas as fichas em repetir elementos já usados em jogos de sucesso, sem se preocupar em criar uma identidade própria.

A trama é muito boa baseada em alteração temporal através de um dispositivo criado pela União Soviética. Inicialmente, a velha temática da guerra fria causa desânimo pelo clichê, mas conforme se avança, deixa o jogador cada vez mais intrigado com o desenrolar dos fatos.

Você é um fuzileiro americano e, ao que tudo indica, a atual Rússia mantém uma base secreta da época da guerra fria, onde experimentos eram realizados visando aplicações militares. Tais experimentos nunca foram usados em combate e a ilha removida do mapa, cabendo a você e a sua equipe descobrir o motivo de os russos terem abandonado o projeto.

Devido à distorção no tempo causada pela singularidade, é possível presenciar durante a campanha vários acontecimentos do passado, que ocorrem como se fossem flashbacks, aumentando o constante clima de tensão e deixando os jogadores mais vidrados na história.

Há três finais diferentes, mas eles são determinados apenas pelas ações feitas nos últimos instantes da campanha, sendo que nada que você tenha feito durante o resto do jogo importará nesta definição.

O jogo conta com arsenal variado, com destaque pra o TMD que é uma aparelho chave tanto para o desenrolar da história quanto para a jogabilidade de Singularity. Porém não se pode deixar de reparar que as semelhanças com outros jogos extrapolam os limites da mera inspiração, principalmente no caso de Bioshock.

As armas são parecidas, os potes de mana são parecidos, o uso de armas na mão direita e ataques alternativos na esquerda funciona da mesma forma, até mesmo a questão dos gravadores é bastante semelhante.

Também é possível se fazer upgrades nas armas e adquirir [strike]novos plasmídeos[/strike] novas habilidades para o TMD, além de melhorar características do próprio personagem através de máquinas espalhadas pelo cenário afora. Caso você seja um jogador que xereta em todos os cantos, vai chegar no final com quase todas as upgrades.

Os gráficos são razoáveis e bonitos no geral, com a ambientação muito boa e variada, por locais que vão desde áreas residenciais a laboratórios ou navios de carga. Porém os inimigos são bem feinhos e sem inspiração alguma, principalmente os soldados, que parecem todos ter o mesmo rosto.

Um ponto negativo é que o jogo é inacessível para quem não entende inglês falado, pois não há nenhuma forma de legenda, nem mesmo em inglês. Pra “melhorar” a situação, a dublagem é feita com sotaque russo, que embora eu ache bem legal pra ajudar na ambientação, atrapalha ainda mais o pessoal que tem dificuldade a entender o que está se passando.

No geral, Singularity é um jogo que, apesar de ser fraco tecnicamente e sem nenhuma característica de grande destaque, é bastante divertido, e possuidor de uma história muito boa, não deixando a peteca cair em nenhum ponto crítico. É um jogo que certamente eu recomendaria, desde que observada a ressalva quanto ao idioma. BOM (7/10).

28082679.review:
Singularity это необычный и очень годный шутан. Это этакая смесь Bioshock'а и Колды, где на пратежении 6 часов гемплея ты не отрывно бегаешь по острову Каторга-12 и отстреливаешь монстров, солдат, хохлов и прочей скам и при этом юзаешь свою супер руку (странно что не правую). Рука(я буду называть это так) это как раз одна из особенностей игры, и дает игроку куча тактических приемуществ, таких как замедление времени, превращение врага в eбаку, состаривать противника и т.д. Сюжет же достаточно интересный, вся эта тема с изменением будующего мне очень понравилась, плюс игру красит вся эта атмосфера ссср и заброшенного острова. Также по ходу игры можно читать разные записочки и слушать записи которые больше раскрывают сюжет и нагнетают. В конце даже будет какой никакой неожиданный поворот.
Вообщем описывать можно ещё много и уже понятно что игра удалась, не без своих минусов конечно. Проходить мимо такого проекта точно не стоит, несмотря на то что ему почти 7 лет это очень хороший шутерок.
Итог: 7,5 сингулярностей из 10
P.S. Если правильно подстроиться можно потрогать жопу своей напарницы

27972178.review:
Willkommen bei Call of Metro: Back to the Future, oder willkommen bei Singularity.
Dieses Spiel hat mich ehrlich gesagt überrascht. Ich habe es mir im Sale gekauft und nicht mehr als einen 0815-Shooter erwartet. Bekommen habe ich CoD-haftes Shooter-Gameplay, eine dichte Atmosphäre, ein paar Jumpscares und eine sogar recht gute Story. Das Spiel mag kurz sein, aber ich war die knapp Sechs Stunden gut unterhalten.

Man Spielt den Soldaten Ranko, dessen Hubschrauber abstürzt, als sein Team die russiche Insel Katorga 12 untersuchen will. Nun mag man denken, man bekommt eine Story a la Amerikanischer Freedom-Fighter vs. den bösen Ivan....Stimmt. Aber nicht nur. Es gibt auch gute Russen. Und vor allem Monster, die durch das Element E99 geschaffen wurden. Dazu kommt eine gehörige Priese Zeitreisen. Mehr will ich zur Story nicht sagen.

Beim Gameplay ist auch alles relativ bekannt. Man hat maximal zwei Waffen, dabei ein paar interessante ideen,. Munitionstechnisch ist es aber am günstigsten, mit der stinknormalen Schrotflinte udn dem Sturmgewehr rumzulaufen. 
Und nanu? Keine Hp-Regeneration? Health-Packs? Tatsächlich war ich davon angenehm überrascht. Allerdings hatte ich auf normal immer maximale Kits dabei, da man damit vollkommen zugeschüttet wird. Reinrennen und umholzen klappt also.
Dazu kommen noch ein paar Upgrades, die das ganze noch einfacher machen, sich aber selten spürbar auswirken. 
Wirklich Abwechslung bringt da das ZMG. Das Zeitmanipulationsgerät. Es kann Timestop-.Blasen verschießen, Impulse abgeben, Dinge altern oder verjüngen und das alles auch während des Kampfes. Das bringt eine große Portion abwechslung, allerdings ist die Energie arg begrenzt. Erst in den letzten Zehn Minuten bekommt man ein Upgrade, das unendliche Energie bringt. Ein New Game+ wäre schön gewesen, in dem man dann als übermächtiger Timelord durchrennt. Aber naja.

TL:DR
Guter Shooter mit ein paar netten Ideen, bekanntes gameplay, recht gut gealtert. Sehr kurz, im Sale aber allemal Wert.

PS: Sucht euch ein Tutorial, wie man Patch 1.1 bei Steam installiert, sonst leidet das Spiel an Fehlern im Textur-Streaming.

Singularity is first-person shooter where you are at a Russian installation and things have gone south.  But with the harnessing of Element 99 (Einsteinium? I don't think it is but let's just go with alternative universe) you can use special abilities (like aging a crate made from E99 to break it open, reversing the age of stairs with E99 in them to gain access to areas, or aging enemies into skeletons and more!) - you can also use E99 that you pick up to upgrade your weapons and augment your character (more health and whatnot)

one gripe I have with the game is that the movement feels a bit sluggish (I felt the same thing when I played Dead Island but maybe it's just my preference to foot-speed) - and you might have to play with the mouse sensitivity, but the movement speed is the biggest gripe i have.

I enjoyed playing the game, but I think I got it when it was on sale for $7.50 or some such - the game isn't burned into my memory so I don't know how memorable of an experience you might have, but for less than $10 I enjoyed it quite a bit.

Достаточно необычная игра, скажу вам, хоть это и FPS. Некая смесь BioShock, Half-Life и Call of Duty. На протяжении прохождения всей игры у меня проходили ассоциации с этими тремя сериями игр. Быстренько я её прошёл. Пора высказаться о ней.
Графика. Очень красивая, выполненная на движке Unreal Engine 2.5. На таком же был сделан BioShock. Дизайн почему-то по красоте своей напоминает Half-Life 2. Как будто и тут принимал участие Виктор Антонов.
Озвучка. Хорошая английская озвучка, на другой и не хотелось особо играть.
Сюжет. Интересный, но немного напоминает Call of Duty, так как тут не обошлось без плохих русских. Что же за тенденция такая идёт: в шутеры засунуть плохих русских. До коли это будет продолжаться, товарищи?
Геймплей. Есть в игре и пострелушки, и несложные загадки. Также помимо оружия используем сверхспособность, связанную со временем.
Отличная игра с интересным сюжетом, отличным геймплеем, пусть и не очень долгая, зато останется у вас в памяти под добрым и необычным названием. Взять стоит:)

26324232.review:
Average shooter that possesses exceptional atmosphere, detailed backdrops and a decent story. Worth a purchase at $5 or less, but it’s shortness (6 to 10 hours) creates value issues at higher prices (the multiplayer is dead).
Total size on my hard drive: 7.7 GB.
You can [url=https://youtu.be/PfJBU6VANj8]view the opening of the game here[/url].

A large EMP pulse from an island blinds a United States satellite, so the US sends a team to investigate. The pulse originated from Katorga-12 – an old Soviet research settlement founded around the mines of a mysterious mineral, E-99. Even traversing the initial level, pulses occasionally appear, creating “time spikes” that suddenly take your character to a different time; then another “spike” sends you back to the present. The truth becomes clear: the Soviets were able to utilize E-99 to create a time-travel device (among other uses). The device and the two scientists who would control it become the centerpiece of a journey through multiple time-lines to prevent the alteration of history. Like in any good time-travel story, preventing one disaster makes other disasters possible. While the story is linear, there are multiple endings; none of them are specifically “good,” each requiring an element of sacrifice. A decent sense of closure, but it’s bitter-sweet because there was clearly the possibility for a sequel (which has never materialized). Decent voice-acting and character models only add to the experience. The soundtrack is serviceable, but not exceptional.

If time-travel isn’t something you care about, and you just want a cool first-person shooter, well, you’ll get it. The fps part, anyway. The coolness isn’t really there. The game is linear. The combat mechanics work, there is a decent variety of weapons, and there are some upgrade choices to be made, too (remember to equip a perk, not just purchase it). The enemies comprise Soviet soldiers and strange creatures that mutated from all the E-99 radiation (contemporary timeline) – some of which are truly gigantic beasts. But the character movement feels heavy and slow, there is no cover mechanic, and chaingun + sniper rifle means you can handle all situations with little need to bother with other weapons. Some of the other weapons are really good – the grenade launcher which can launch a grenade that you then guide forward to the target was my other favorite – and the E99 weapons (where available) are over-powered as hell, but except for specific situations, there is little call to use them. And these “specific situations” usually have a weapon locker nearby, so it’s easy to switch to what is needed, then switch back when done. If you find yourself overwhelmed, pulse the wrist-mounted TMD (Time Manipulation Device). It’s got decent knock-back that can give you a breather when you need it. Multiplayer is dead.

But the primary attraction of Singularity is the atmosphere. It reeks with it. Every area is incredibly detailed, whether exploring an old Soviet barracks in the current timeline (rust, dirt, cracked glass, smoke) or traversing a laboratory in 1955 (bright, clean, apparatus everywhere). The graphics help in this department: though occasionally low-res, Singularity is one of the best uses of the Unreal 3 engine I have seen. And because it is Unreal 3 (and highly optimized), it runs great at maximum settings on moderate equipment (I easily hit 120fps @1080p on an R7 260X). 

Singularity is a fun ride, no question, but you’ll have to really love the atmosphere and story to play it more than once, which hurts its overall value. Singularity rarely drops below $7.50 when on sale, but if it does, go ahead and get it.

Notes:
- A 3-button mouse is REQUIRED. Without the game-play mechanic tied to Mouse Button 3, some sections will be nearly (if not entirely) impossible to complete.
- Frame-rate is capped at 120fps.
- There are no subtitles for any language.

26169508.review:
Singularity (Juego de acción del año 2010), explica la trama del Capitán Renko que debe ir en una misión encargada por el pentagono a la Isla de Katorga-12, donde los rusos han descubierto un nuevo mineral capaz de abrir brechas en el espacio-tiempo el E-99. Sin embargo, las cosas se salen de control cuando se enteran de que Katorga-12 lleva mas de 50 años sin actividad, y todos los posibles supervivientes fueron mutados tras la exposición al mineral.
La misión de Renko ahora cambia, no sólo para averiguar que sucede en la isla, si no para reescribir la historia misma e intentar corregir todas las anomalias temporales.

El juego en si es bastante corto, (8-10 horas como máximo), hay muy pocas armas y de 1 sólo tipo, es decir un solo fúsil, una pistola, una escopeta, etc. Sin embargo cada una de ellas posee habilidades y mécanicas únicas utilizando el E-99.
Además de estas armas, existe el DMT (un crono-dispositivo) capaz de jugar con la realidad y el tiempo, que a decir verdad es MUY útil durante el juego, y en lo personal me ha salvado la vida un par de veces.

La historia es muy completa, y compleja pero divertida y engancha bastante con las brechas y saltos temporales a lo largo del juego, nada que decir una obra maestra.

Muy recomendable.

Singularity is a great game, very under appreciated, it really deserves a sequel. 
It first comes out as a Bioshock rip off but I actually enjoyed a lot more than that game, it's a crazy mixture of that with Half-Life 2. [spoiler]And maybe inspired the end of Bioshock Infinite? This would not be the first time that an imitation inspired the original franchise.[/spoiler]

What it really needs improvement is the PC port of the game because this is obviously a direct X360 port, to confirm this  you just need to look at the low resolution of the textures outside of the main areas and, off course, the "Saving, do not turn off" warnings.

The game don't have a lot of graphics options forcing you to go to REGEDIT to tweak the few extra options like Volumetric Light and Anisotropic filtering (Don't try to run it with the DX10 enable, the game don't support it , I don't even know why there is a option for that) and if you want anti-aliasing you need to force it in your graphics card options. 

[b]And if the game suddenly don't want to start anymore just reinstall PhysX and will probably fix it.[/b]

This needs a least a re-release with improved graphics, advanced options and with full steam integration.

25629933.review:
I honestly do not understand what everyone finds so endearing about this game that I've read from the other reviews.  This is a horror game that mostly only uses jump scares, gross (but generic) monsters and eerie music.  This game has obviously aged and not particularly well which is a little sad for something only from 2010.

The shooter mechanics are boring and unoriginal the guns aren't balanced even slightly.  The gunplay itself feels so unsatisfying as you will constantly wonder if you're making contact with the enemy as the usually never react to shots until they're dead or almost dead occasionally.  The secondary mechanics become repetitive very quickly and the age of the game really shows here because you will constantly see things you should be able to use with these mechanics but won't be able to so you can go through the exact script that the director had in mind.  The game is at least a little buggy I had it freeze on me just by reading a note.  It was at that point I just could barely take it anymore, but I kept going on for a little bit.

The last straw for me was the suiciding insect enemies that come in waves and are more annoying than zoobats, you will get hit, you will die because you will have no idea where they're coming from until after 5 of them are hitting you from that direction at the same time.  Which is a hilarious contrast to the Russian soldiers you will fight which shout out where they're coming from and who go down quicker than star trek red shirts.  

Maybe this one just wasn't for me, I don't know but I could find a lot of flaws here and the plot was intriguing it wasn't good enough to keep me interested past its flaws.

25597742.review:
这款游戏身上能看到各种其他类型游戏的影子。战斗中特异能力和生命值能量值的设定明显有生化奇兵系列的影子，枪战和各种小型boss战也很有半条命的感觉，和人类敌人的前期战斗则更像自家的cod系列，而叙事风格与游戏的流程也更像是cod黑色行动那种风格。综合下来，这款动视新创立的ip杂糅了各方元素，最后形成了这个，有野心素质合格但并不算优秀的奇怪的作品。
这款游戏最大的缺点就是游戏想走的路线太多，导致最后那个也不像，每一章的游戏方式都截然不同。游戏开局的学校章节气氛做的很不错，很有一种恐怖游戏的感觉，大量的文献和录音的叙事手法实在是太像生化奇兵系列，而初期手枪的无力也给人有一种少许的紧张感。
就当我以为这款游戏就要这样走下去的时候，随着第一把散弹的出现一切都改变了（这也是这游戏的重要问题，武器系统不平衡，一把散弹打天下）。游戏的风格不知怎么的随着和队友的配合，明显感觉到了cod的影子，各种坍塌，队友救人，合作狙击，简直就是cod一段翻版（甚至连队友死都是cod死队友桥段），这又把游戏的节奏拉向了cod，而早期的自己寻找档案探索的内容一下子就基本不见了。
而当主角拥有时空能力之后，游戏的模式又变成了生化奇兵，能量槽恢复缓慢，不过可以自己打针来补满，升级技能以及自定义被动的设定根本就是生化奇兵。技能方面的话除了e技能bug之外，基本没有太大的作用。e技能点慢之后基本就是一个大型时间停止，持续时间能让你在里面跳个舞再出来，后期无论什么敌人，怪物在这个技能下全都一点威胁都没有。
这期间的关卡设计和隐藏房间的设定，明显有种半条命系列的感觉，主角基本化身孤单战士，偶尔有妹子不过基本没什么作用。单枪匹马对抗各种小怪物。
剧情方面的话结局那里的确有点小惊喜，剧情也算尚可，基本能通过隐藏的文字猜到结局。不过由于流程太短也没有字幕，加上游戏节奏的更替过于频繁，使得这款游戏显得并不算上特别印象深刻。
不过价格打折真便宜，推荐给英语听力尚可的同学，讲真英语听力不算难（除了苏联英语）。不过即使你不懂英语也无所谓，一点也不耽误你理解游戏。喜欢cod黑色行动系列的玩家可以考虑入。

25579336.review:
Un fps qui fait très bien son boulot, avec une histoire ni trop simple, ni trop compliqué et des méchanique de gameplay intéressantes et variées. Plutôt que de se perdre dans son principe de voyage temporel, il se contente de simplement modifier un élément et construire le "futur" que cela implique sans se soucier du reste, c'est crédible sans avoir besoin de se jutifier tout le temps.

On est donc là devant un excellent exemple de jeu qui a compris ce qu'on attends de lui, avec une courbe de difficulté un poil faiblarde, surtout après le passage du PEARL. Les armes sont variées et le MT qui constitue l'objet de tous les désirs du méchants s'avère très versatile.

En fait, le seul vrai point noir du jeu reste son keymapping, en effet et de manière assez incompréhensible, les développeur on décidés de mettre "Recharger" et "Utiliser" sur la toucher, ce qui est assez pénible par moment. Rien d'insurmontable en somme.

25500152.review:
SINGULARITУ is a first person shooter with some time manipulation elements made by Raven Software (who's previous works include Heretic, Hexen, Jedi Outcast and Quake 4)

The story starts with you investigating some abandoned soviet island before discovering some mutants and science experiments gone terrible wrong, and you're pulled back in time where you accidentally fuck things up royally. You spend the rest of the game trying to fix your mistake, traveling back and forth between two time periods, all while shooting mutants and commies and solving an ocasional puzzle. 

The gameplay is pretty much your typical modern first person shooter - you have a decent variety of guns (about 10) which you can only carry 2 of. Most of the weapons are actually pretty fun to use, and you can upgrade each weapons's damage, magazine capacity and reload time. Apart from your guns you also have your Time Manipulation Device (or T.M.D.) which gives you additional combat options (freeze time in a certain radius, age oponents quickly, some telekinetic abilities). You also use the T.M.D. for solving some puzzles here and there and I never really had much trouble with them. The T.M.D. can also be used to age and de-age some items like stairs, safes, fuse boxes, barrels etc. It's not much but it is pretty fun. 

You'll mostly be fighting soviet soldiers who shoot at you, and mutants who try to melee you. The soldiers have different guns but pretty much all of them will be shooting at you. The mutants have a bit more variety - some of them can phase in and out, some of them are kamikazes (aka annoying as fuck), and some of them are big guys who take a lot of punishment before going down. 

Now let's talk about the problems. First off this is a very lazy console port. There are barely any video options, the FOV is really low and can't be changed without a separate program (I used Flawless Widescreen) and there are no subtitles, which is really unfortunate because everyone talks with a russian accent in this and it's hard to hear what they're saying sometime. Another issue I have is that the game took me 4 hours to finish on Normal, which was way too forgiving. So I feel like 20 euros is a pretty steap asking price. 

Overall, Singularity is an okay game. It doesn't do anything amazing but it's pretty solid all around and I can't find too many things to complain about. Pretty fun, would recommend.
