16562196.review:
I remember first reading about this game in an issue of Game Informer.  This was roughly 5 or 6 years ago.  To this day, this game is one of the most fun FPS games I've played in a while.  Interacting with your environment by manipulating time was an awesome concept, and it's executed extremely well in Singularity.  That, coupled with your very Bioshock-like grab-bag of powers like pseudo Telekinesis and the ability to slow down time in a certain radius and it makes for very refreshing gameplay.

Also, I can honestly say that I haven't had as much fun playing a weapon any game as I have playing with the Seeker.  Seriously, that weapon is some fun shit.

16557145.review:
[h1]Good points:[/h1]
[list]
[*]Intriguing story
[*]cool enemies, weapons and powers.
[*]good pacing
[*]Looks really good to this day
[*]Good audio quality
[/list]

[h1]Bad points:[/h1]
[list]
[*]Game feels very rushed at the end
[*]Weapon upgrade system is just bad
[*]No real explanation of what upgrades do
[*]No subtitles
[*]very unbalanced difficulty level
[*]story has many loopholes and leaves you with so many questions
[/list]

[h1]Story[/h1]
The story has a lot of potential in this game, and I'd say they pull of the story about halfway into the game. After that a lot of things start to happen kinda without explanation. So I strongly feel that this game was rushed at the end and that the game kinda suffered for it, this is something I will come back to several times in this review. 

[h1]Characters[/h1]
You yourself is much like a Gordon Freeman, voiceless and even faceless in this game. I honestly think this is a bit of a shame, they could have made the story more intriguing and interesting if they character you were playing had feelings and thoughts on the situation. The other characters are pretty standard. There's the good guy, bad guy and the cute girl, these are the three NPC characters you interact with pretty much. They're not well written and you don't care about them but they do their part. Perhaps if the game wasn't rushed this wouldn't have happened.

[h1]enemies, weapons and powers[/h1]
The enemy design is really cool in this game, the monsters are scary, gross and challenging to kill. They do lack a bit of variety so you won't see to many different kind of enemies. But the game isn't super long so it's okay. In between fighting monsters you will be shooting at Russians, they are standard NPC's with guns, not much to discuss there. 

The weapons in this game feel great, look great feel very balanced. The problem I have with them is that there are like 6-7 weapons in total at the end of the game, and I only touched the first three because the others were just introduced to damn late and you have already spent so much upgrade points on the early weapons that it doesn't feel worth it switching to the new ones, this might be a side effect of the game being rushed as well. The weapon upgrade system leaves a lot to wish for, each weapons needs 9 points to be fully upgraded. I'm not even sure if I find a total of 20 upgrade points through the whole game. 

The powers are probably what carries this game, You have a device on your arm with lets you age specific objects in the world, stop time in an area, levitate and throw objects (kinda like HL2 gravity gun). It's just a ton of fun and the effects look fantastic. They come up with some interesting puzzles with it as well.

[h1]Difficulty and upgrades[/h1]
Much like most games this game lets you choose between easy, medium and hard difficulty. I tried normal on my first play-through and I honestly don't think I died a single time. I'm now playing it again on hard and I still have a very easy time. I can play through some parts without any problem and then die seven times in a row in the next area, so the difficulty level feels a bit unbalanced. 

You can also purchase upgrades for you character and your "gravity gun" in this game, which I think is really fun, The bad part is that you have to find the blueprint for the upgrade in the world and they're sometimes a bit hidden. Meaning that you could potentially miss out on some essential upgrades for you character simply because you didn't look around the room enough. They also don't give you enough points here to upgrade everything but that's fine, it makes you have to choose what to prioritize and what you feel is more important to you. 

[h1]Conclusion[/h1]
This review might have sound really negative overall but don't get me wrong, I genuinely enjoyed this game a lot and would recommend it to anyone. If you play this game you won't get mad or irritated at all the bad traits I've pointed out, rather you will acknowledge them and perhaps, like me, realize that this game with a bit more time and polishing could easily have been a 10/10.

16528975.review:
My major dislike about Singularity was the sudden spikes in the difficulty curve.   In a couple of the set pieces the difficulty spiked to being rage-quit-inducingly hard.

Second to that the charecter voice acting was really, really quiet, making it almost impossible to follow the exposition being delivered by the game charecters (this is particularly bad for a time travel based game like Singularity).

It felt like the time-travel/time manipulation mechanic was under-used and could have benefited from a more complete Portal-like exploration of the mechanics available to the player.

The art and weapons are on par for an Unreal engine 3 game and solidly implemented.

The plot felt weak and the finale nonsensical and un-satisfying.  Yet this game is still better than Bulletstorm.

16022525.review:
The game has an interesting story, has creative design and solid gameplay, it has so much potential to be a very good game, but it lacks polish, it looks like an unfinished piece to me.

I like the game pretty much actually, the TMD and the guns are fun, love that Kasimov SNV-E99 Sniper Rifle. And the machinery design is just amazing, remember the TMD upgrading process? 
Also the story... I took some time to clear the timelines after finishing the game, and found out that the there're some major paradoxes, I always like paradox settings. 

I can see singularity had borrowed a lot from Bioshock, but I don't think the story was told in a good way like Bioshock. The characters are just stereotype, they come and go and talk, just to get me moving in the  game.  There's just one villain has a name. If you break down the story and see it for yourself, you'll realize it's something big. I hope i can say this is a great story, but it's just an interesting one.

[spoiler]And come on~~~If by killing Demichev can solve the problem, why can't I just kill him in the past, why must I kill myself in the past if I can simply shoot Demichev in the head. I've shot Demicev 2 times in the head, and the last time I did it, he's still alive and talking!!! Then he even stood himself up and continued talking!!!...Totally ruins the ending.  [/spoiler]

Other Cons!
The save system really sucks!!!!!!!!!! Especially in the first 1/3 of the game, some people would probably quit due to this, Autosave is understandable, lots of games use autosave. But singularity just saves in wrong places all the time!!! It's like the checkpoints are just placed there without much consideration. 

E-99 money, story notes, records, upgrade systems, they all pops up now and then to "invite" you to interact with them. But lots of those moments, while I was interacting with them, then the combat started, so I had to quit reading/upgrading, because there wasn't a pause in game when you're reading/upgrading.

The puzzles are made for the TMD, so that you can use the TMD. 

All in all, I still finished the game, some moments were enjoyable, the story kept me thinking after the ending, so I would say this is a good game, a rare one indeed! If you like half-life 2 and Bioshock 1&2, you should try this one,

16000753.review:
Un juego que empieza muy bien y pincha a la mitad de muy mala manera.

Al princpio, el juego apunta maneras: Somos un soldado americano que se mete en una instalación científica rusa abandonada para investigarla, y por unos problemas se queda solo. Nos tocará explorar la zona y enseguida encontraremos que aquí el tiempo funciona de manera extraña. Encontraremos un dispositivo de control temporal, pasillos por los que avanzar y enemigos a los que matar por el camino.

Recuerda mucho a Half-Life 1 y 2 en su desarrollo y estructura (Gravity gun incluida), su armamento y los tipos de enemigos que nos encontramos. Dicen que también se parece a Bioshock, pero a mí no me lo pareció.

Vamos, que hasta ahí me gustaba lo que me encontraba. Poca variedad de enemigos, pero compensada con un buen ritmo y diseño de niveles, que aseguraban una variedad de situaciones decente incluso con esa limitación, y buenos cambios entre exploración, puzzles y combate, algunos de ellos muy trepidantes y con dificultad bien ajustada, necesitando gestionar la munición y manejar diferentes armas.

Desgraciadamente, todo eso cambia a partir de la mitad del juego (la escena del tren). 

No sé qué pasaría, pero a partir de ahí la dificultad se vuelve inexistente (Subimos de nivel muy rápido y tenemos munición para aburrir), dejan de salir nuevos enemigos, no hay apenas combates y es todo tirar p'alante, ni siquiera puzzles, y la historia/ambientación del juego no me parece lo bastante fuerte para poder aguantar todo lo demás por sí sola...

En resumen, un juego que se quedó a medias, por el motivo que fuese. Una pena.

When I bought this game I thought I was just gonna get a game similar to RAGE, a fun FPS with a decent story and plot. However, I got much more than that with singularity. I found myself on the edge of my chair enjoying a great narrative about time travel and how you can re-write the past to change the future. 
Dont worry about this game aging poorly either cause I played all of it recently in 2015, and still found this game more than acceptable (coming from a guy who loves graphics a lot). So heres a list

Pros
-Great Narrative
-Interesting Gameplay mechanics with a device found in-game
-Aged very well (basically meaning it doesnt fell old)
-Cool Guns
-Awesome Level Design and Themes
-RPG level up elements with currency (level up guns, stats, and your TMD)

Note that gunplay is average, but I believed designed that way due to the fact that once you start getting upgrades, you become the grim reaper destroying everything in your path, feels like Wolfienstien gunplay. 

9/10 Would Travel in Time Again

15786688.review:
С этой игрой я познакомился еще задолго,до регистрации первого аккаунта в Steam. На тот момент я был лютым пиратом и наткнулся на данный шедевр на одном довольно известном трэкере. Хитро закрученный сюжет и довольно симпатичные скриншоты побудили меня сыграть в Сингулярность, и всё,заверте! Я прошел игру на одном дыхании,а после перепроходил не один десяток раз,в результате нашел абсолютно все секретные места,залез куда только можно и нельзя. Как только увидел в Steam так сразу же и приобрел.

Сюжет
Хитрые русские находят новый элемент,который возможно приблизит их к мировому господству в будущем. В связи с этим на острове воздвигается научный городок с учеными и реактором,но что-то пошло не так.. Реактор бомбанул,почти все людишки превратились в НЁХ и всё бы на этом возможно и закончилось,но..вездесущие пиндocы, со своим желанием насаждении демократии, суют свой нос и в данную заварушку,конец немного предсказуем..
Играем мы за бравого американского солдафона с портативной херовиной на руке для изменения временного континуума. Старим или омолаживаем всё, что попадается под руку,а именно вражеских солдат,ящики и даже грузовые корабли. В игре довольно около научный сюжет и атмосфера заброшенности с потерявшимися во времени мутантами и злыми гениями. Несколько концовок прилагается.

Плюсы

1. Первый плюс это конечно же сюжет(Игр про время наклепано конечно дофига, но свои изюминки есть не везде)
2.Атмосфера(Огромный заброшенный научный городок с лабораториями,больничками и заводами)
3.Монстры(Реально стрёмные мутанты,прохожу сейчас в 28-й раз,но в некоторых местах пугаюсь всё равно)
4.Внушительный арсенал(Управляемые пули как бонус)
5.Сам процесс старения или омоложения(Увы всё заскриптовано и взаимодействовать можно только с  предметами с е99)
6.Клюква (Тонны клюквы,фанатам понравится)
7.Длина игры(Вы врядли пробежите игру за пару вечеров)
8.Возможность прокачки себя любимого и свои пушечки(Это радует)

Минусы
 Хоть игра и шикарная,но всё не может быть замечательно.

1.Наитупейший AI (вражины прут толпами и мрут под шквальным огнём игрока,стены и укрытия?не,не слышали)
2.Игра полна штампов(Русские со своим мировым господством и амеры-спасители)

Выводы

Игра получилась замечательной и душевной. Я не понял,то ли это такой замысел создателей,то ли это просто от безысходности,но игра полна сценами из других игор. Наслаждаться это не мешает,но если вы кроме доты играли еще в что нибудь,то заметите без труда о чем я тут говорю. Обязательна к покупке всем ностальгирующим по СССР и просто любителям около научных вещей. 10 зиков из 10

15747664.review:
Very creative shooter with a cool story and interesting gameplay with some creative weapons. 

You play as Captain Krencho and you and your team of US Special Forces Soldiers are called to a small russian island to find out what happened there. At first it seems like your ordinary "Kill all bad guys" story like in other shooters or action movies, but the story is really interesting, especially later in the game plus there are three endings! 

Basically it´s an ordinary shooter, but the TMD gives you powers like turning back the time for a rusted explosive barrell. A few seconds later you have a brand new explosive barrel which you can throw at your enemies. 
The TMD is also used for some riddles, which aren´t really hard but bring some variety in the game. 

The arsenal is nothing fancy at the beginning, you have your pistol, assault rifle, shotgun, etc.

But two guns are really cool: The grenade launcher where you can fire a regular grenade which explodes a few seconds later or you can steer it while it´s rolling over the floor.
Then there is the rifle where you can steer the bullet, which is also pretty funny. 

The gore system is high. Raven Software made two of the most violent games in gaming history: Soldier of Fortune 1+2.
Singularity is also gory, but not as much as SOF1+2. You can shoot of limps from the enemies and the human enemies suffer when you cripple them, but they die very fast and the gameplay is about as fast as in SOF1, so you really don't notice how much pain you´re causing. :D 

Overall Singularity is a very fun shooter and like Mark from the "Classic Game Room" always says:

Highly recommended!

15723091.review: When this game was released i thought nothing of it mostly because it came out when the plague of sub par fps games started. I only decided to try this game once i  saw it on a top 10 hidden gems countdown. I did enjoy my time with the game but i do have a few problems with it that may ruin the game for some people. For starters the game is a measly 5 hours long with little replay value. Yes the game dose have multiple endings but the game saves your progress right before your chose what ending you will get. My next problem is the difficulty. The game in my opinion was way to easy. The tmd made combat interesting but it also made you unstoppable. And the amount of medkits you get are insane. there were many times where i would pass up on 5 in one room because i was maxed out. I only died once and stood there and let 5 monsters chomp on me while i spun around. The few bosses that are there honestly just feel like normal enemies with giant fuck me blisters on them. The only thing that stuck out in my mind was the weapon selection. you have your basics like a revolver, assault rifle, shotgun, and sniper rifle. But then you start getting guns like the spikeshot that is a railgun with a delay or a grenade launcher that has grenades that you can move on your own. However you are limited to two guns that you can carry except for super weapons. I went through most of the game with the assault rife as my primary for most of the game. and if the is a situation where you can use a gun to its fullest there is convinently a dead body with on laying right in front of you. The super weapons bring the most flavor to the table. The seeker fires an explosive round that you can control in a cool bullet time scene. And then there is a rocket launcher. Ok they may have run out of ideas at that point. The game is fun however and if you looking to kill some time (no pun intended) i recommend picking this game up only on a sale though.

15714420.review:
So Singularity was quite a fun game.  The TMD(time manipulation device) was pretty cool though way OP at the end.  The deadlock power was all I really used once it was unlocked and made battling the mutants pretty trivial.  The concept of the game with multiple timelines paradoxes and so on was cool, as were the endings(which I wont spoil).  I found the only weapons that I needed were the Volt(shotgun) and Valkyrie(assault rifle), the 'Seeker' special weapon was cool also and useful when available.

I see a lot of comparisons of this game to BioShock.  This game does not compare to BioShock which was a masterpiece; these games are not in the same league.  This gameplay is very linear and quite dated, filled with invisible walls and places it looks like you aught to be able to go but are blocked off from by an invisible barrier(one of my hates in games).

So to sum up the + and - :

+ Fun Game
+ Nice concept
+ TMD is cool device

- Absolutely linear with no real choice until the very end
- Invisible walls
- No depth to the game just a basic shooter
- Your way back to explore a different path or collect an item keeps on getting mysteriously blocked by closing doors etc - can be very frustrating especially when you can see a nice item like a weapon upgrade that you can no longer go back to get.

So all-in-all the game is worth playing if you can get it at < £5 or so on sale but dont expect any depth or challenge to the gameplay - this is a game you play then forget.

The TDM just makes it too easy to kill but it does present more interesting puzzles late in the game.

15707497.review:
While it's reminiscent of many other games, Singularity is greater than the sum of its oft-borrowed parts. The time & space manipulation in puzzle solving has a Portal-esque feel to it, the gunplay and sci-fi elements are evocative of the Half-Life series, and the alternate reality's sprawling landscapes filled with intricate details and satirical propaganda clearly show that BioShock rubbed off on the developers. In fact, the Time Manipulation Device (TMD) employed by the game is essentially a Plasmid from BioShock – equipped on your hand, you'll use it to do things like reverse or speed up the age of items and enemies to bring variety to combat and navigate the devastated, apocalyptic terrain.

Though Singularity is certainly guilty of taking more than a few elements from other games, it puts its own spin on those elements well and creates enough of an original feel to consider it a legitimately good game in and of itself, making the experience an entertaining entry in the first-person shooter genre. The notes, recordings, and projector footage you find from the past (again, sound familiar?) range from amusing to frightening, and help to further illustrate the game's 1955 & 2010 versions of Russia which you jump to and from in order to rewrite history and correct time travel paradoxes. The consistently thick, tense atmosphere aside, this is the game's strongest asset, I feel, and could've been explored more thoroughly. This and its disappointing length are its greatest flaws, though the fact that the majority of players find the game too short shows just how enjoyable it is. When it was over, I wanted more of it, and I intend on a second playthrough – something the game encourages, as the plot twist at the conclusion recontextualizes the events preceding it.

Singularity isn't the most original or creative game, and it only grazes the surface of deeper themes (the illusion of free will, the responsibility scientists have to mankind, the inherent paradoxes in time travel) in favor of maintaining a breakneck pace, but it does so many things right that its flaws are forgiveable and, in the grand scheme of things, minor. I consider this a good choice for anyone who enjoys action or first-person shooter games, especially the ones I mentioned in this review as well as others in that vein.

15687766.review:
So, just a quick thought on this game. 
For one, while it´s on sale, pick it up immedietly if you are a fan of the old bioshock games. (among other classics this game rips off=) 
You play as an american soldier that investigates an old Soviet island with a messed up research base. You will encounter time distortion, time travel, some awesome guns and gadgets. 
Back when this game was made it was a looker, kind of dated today, think of any old Unreal 2.5-3 engine game. There are exceptions to this rule, like bulletstorm, a year older but three years better looking =) But I digress. 
I like that the game is heavy on the story, I like the combat even if it feels kind of old. Fun to kill both monsters and humans, like when you use a time device to make them turn into ash in front of you. =) 
It does support gamepad, I play it with my Xbox 1 pad but it misses the overlay so you have to figure out which button is Pad 11 for example, this is easy and should not drag down the overall score. An underrated title that I am glad I revisited during the sale. I recommend you getting it if this review sounds like your kind of game. I mean, 5 bucks, former AAA title, no brainer, right? =)

EDIT: Just a fast addition. I want and beat the game. According to steam it took me 8h but I know I was tabbed out for certain lengths of time. My best guess would be just over 6h and that is with lots of exploring. It also has multiple endings and I have played 2 so far. I still say GET THIS GAME. In the same leauge as Bioshock 1-2 for sure.

15652083.review:
Давненько я не встречал подобных игр, которые затягивают с первым минут. Игра очень понравилась. Напомнила смесь Bioshock и Fallout 3, на мой субъективный взгляд.
В игре присутствует отличный сюжет. К сожалению, проект не русифицирован, это может быть проблемой для людей, не знающих английского.  Но тем, у кого нет трудностей  с иностранным языком, будет крайне интересно следить за разворачивающейся в игре историей. 
Радует картинка. И это не смотря на 5 лет с момента выхода игры. Вообще, окружающий мир – это сплошная «клюква» с портретами и памятниками Ленину, Сталину и кучей агитационных плакатов, надписи на которых далеко не всегда выполнены на русском языке. Если вас коробит от «Красной жары» и прочих лент, показывающих советское общество глазами американцев, демонстрирующих его гротескно, стереотипно, то играть не стоит, наверное. Но, если вы с юмором относитесь к «клюкве», то игра вас не разочарует.   
Для игрока имеется неплохой арсенал оружия: от классики шутеров, до очень оригинальных оружий.  К сожалению, ношение оружия героем реализовано в духе современных игр и протагонист с собой может таскать только два ствола. Мне, как любителю олдскула, это не понравилось. И ещё один момент, что разочаровал: очень мало патронов. Просто катастрофически. Даже на лёгком уровне сложности. Разбавлю последние негативные нотки положительным моментом: в игре присутствует возможность улучшения имеющегося оружия. Вот это здорово. 
Кроме того, в Singularity богатый выбор врагов. Имеются союзники, помогающие герою. 
Звуковое оформление и эффекты на высоте.

Мой вердикт: любителям качественных шутеров однозначно рекомендую!

15630179.review:
So, you have played all the 'big' FPS titles around, looking for something else to play and you want a reccomendation.. get Singularity.  

I have played through this on both 360 and PS3 before picking it up on PC, it is one of the few games that truely deserve the title of 'hidden gem'.  

So whats it like?  Well, its a sci-fi FPS, along the same lines as half-life and with just as much interesting cool puzzles and lore.  

Furthermore, the story is great, which is unusual for a FPS.  It would hold its own with the classics such as Bioshock.  I won't go into too much detail but it involves time travel and it is quite well thought out, sure like every time travel escapade in recent memory it has slight plot holes but hey your carrying huge guns and blowing things apart on every turn.

An added extra is the atmosphere, its a well thoughtout game and the setting is amazing, especially when things get changed by time and you see the same environment but from a different era.

All in all, if you want a romp-gun fest.. get this game.. if you want a cool sci-fi adventure... get this game.. if you want a game you can highly reccomend to your friends and feel good when they also love it.. get this game.

Was ich nicht so toll fand war das man in den Spiel keine Full-HD Auflösung (1920x1080) einstellen kann, das maximale was hier im 16:9 Modus geht ist 720p (also 1280x720), allerdings kann man in der Registery die Auflösung manuell einstellen, damit ihr nicht lange suchen müsst, ihr müsst unter "HKEY_CURRENT_USER\Software\Activision\Singularity" die Werte "ResX" und "ResY" mit euerer gewünschten Auflösung füttern und ganz wichtig dann auch den Wert von "UserSelectedResolution" von 0 auf 1 ändern, weil ansonten stellt das Spiel jedes mal wieder eine Standard-Auflösung ein^^

Ich habe laut Steam 7 Stunden Spielzeit bei den Spiel, allerdings sind da auch einige Pausen mit dabei, also reelle Spielzeit sind vielleicht so 5-6 Stunden gewesen, ich habe allerdings die ganzen Notizen die man alle im Spiel finden kann nicht gelesen, war meiner Meinung nach auch nicht so wichtig, da man genug von der Story durchs Spielen mit bekommt :)

15238267.review:
''Время никого не щадит''

Singularity - шикарнейший шутан, серьёзно, где вы ещё видели подобное?. Пальнул в чувака сгустком энергии и состарил его в прах.
Сюжет игры очень интересен и своеобразен. Единственное - он не особо то и привлекателен, потому что игра сама по себе ''мрачная''. Персонажи не запоминаются, ибо уж очень быстро они уходят... Из всех персонажей, что я реально запомнил, были:

1) Лейтенант Джеймс Девлин - эт кент гл.героя. Его никак ну нельзя забыть, он вместе с Ренко с самого начала.
2) Капитан Натаниель Ренко - эт сам гл.герой.
3) Кэтрин или Кэт - тёлка с хорошим задом(всё, что я запомнил о ней).
4) Виктор Барисов и его ''коллега'' Николай Демичев - этих парней забыть никак нельзя, они играют огромную роль в игре и её концовке.

Но на самом деле, персонажей гораздо больше, чем вы думаете, многим из них просто не уделили должного внимания в ходе игры.

Из-за чего вообще весь сыр бор в игре?. А из-за того, что зависливые советы нашли уникальный(новый), элемент-99(E-99). Ведь у США на тот момент уже было ядерное оружие, а чтобы далеко не отставать от США, СССР по приказу товарища Сталина развернули не далеко от Камчатки ''Каторгу-12''(да-да название меня тоже напрягло) и всё это под руководством Виктора Борисова, одного из главных героев. Позже на Каторге произошла катастрофа, а миротворческие супер-пупер силы США, опасаясь за повторение Чернобыля, отправляют туда развед-группу.

МВП - эта игрушка, от которой зависит суть игры, она делает гл.героя властелином времени. У МВП есть несколько способностей: заморозка, хроносканирование, гравитация, импульс. Использование этих способностей по ходу игры необходимо, а самое главное весело.
Местами игра даже страшная и пугающая, но это лишь местами, в целом она напоминает известную ''Timeshift''. Но только в Singularity вас ждёт интересный сюжет с 3-я концовками, повороты, которые повлияют на сюжет игры, пару реально запоминающихся персонажей и МВП. Воистину уникальная (после TimeShift) игра, которая доставит вам море удовольствия.


Оценка этой замечательной игре 9/10 и 9, только за некую отрешенность персонажей от сюжета.

15057236.review:
Wow, Singularity was actually pretty good. 

The game was released around the same time as Timeshift, both dealing somewhat with using time-changing combat abilities. But hands down, Singularity was a much better game. 

PLOT - above average

Let's be fair, for the most part of the game, you have no idea why you're running around killing people and charging up some bomb. The basic premise is your character, Renko, saved a dictator in the past, and now the present is under totalitarian control. So now you try to go back and right that wrong. Very linear story, BUT you are presented with 3 possible ending cutscenes, depending on who you shoot at the end. 

GAMEPLAY - very good

You have a choice between some very generic guns (assault rifle, shotgun, pistol), but also some very interesting weapons. Here are my favorite:

1. Sniper Rifle - has a limited ability to slow down time to let you line up the shot. 
2. Seeker Rifle - special weapon with limit supplies that lets you control the path of a sniper bullet. 
3. Autocannon - combined with the time-stopping Deadlock, this is hilarously over-powered. 

I stuck with autocannon and sniper rifle for the majority of the gameplay. 

The Time-Manipulation Device itself doesn't have very many abilities. I think Deadlock is what everyone uses, just to freeze all the enemies in its bubble. Impulse sends a short-range shockwave, and is very satisfying when enemies get up close to you, and you either blow them away or apart. 

VISUALLY - nauseating

It's an old game. Everything looks beige in color, and texture resolutions are very low. The geometry also makes you feel a little sick. 

SOUND - lacking

There is absolutely no music, just creepy ambient sounds. There's no music even for the title screen! The only music is in the CCCP propaganda films! Gunfire sounds average at most. The voice acting is also mediocre. You don't get attached to anybody. 

OVERALL - more enjoyable than I thought. A little on the long side, to be honest. 

Rating: 7/10

Singularity: Good Video Games.

Let's talk about what made me happy:

Pride of place in an FPS: Weapons. They are your primary means of interacting with other entities, and damn are they nice. Many of them are neat spins on regular ol' bread and butter guns, and that's okay, but the look and feel of some guns is just great. The minigun has brake pads around the barrel. The shotgun has this neat locking top pump action. The rifle has a fan that spins as you fire. The Railgun has a timed delay explosive charge. Aside from looking neato frito, they all feel damn great and tear guys up very nicely. The other side of this is the TMD, which has powers and upgrades meted out to it through the course of the game and is great fun to oof at when you hit dudes with it. Seriously I was apologizing to AI for blowing them off their shins and leaving the feet standing. It's pretty grisly.

Speaking of AI, the enemies are neat too. You have monsters and tough monsters and soldiers and tough soldiers, but that's boiling things right down to sump. They all have their neat features,  You can shoot limbs off the creatures and they'll keep coming, sometimes even after they're ostensibly dead. Soldiers will hide behind bigger dudes and try and flank you, though it's standard tactics it's still fun to play with. Between monsters and soldiers, there's a nice gamut of enemies, but though the groups have a nice variety within themselves, it's the way they're placed through the game that's cool. You'll be fighting some monsters and suddenly soldiers will drop in on cleanup, or the guy you're shooting will be clawed from behind, and infighting hell breaks loose either way. It's always fun to be the one in the eye of the storm, and Singularity does it wonderfully.

Let's talk design elements real quick, since Singularity has a bunch I really like. Found Story? Check. Audio logs, notes, interactive items, flashbacks, secrets, all of the good stuff. Oh, what's that, you want wordless little vignettes? You got them too. If you like exploring the world in your FPSs and being rewarded for that with tidbits, you'll feel right at home. Tagging -horror onto your game's genre might have been the "in" thing, but Singularity does the horror elements right. The opening hour or so is filled with jumps and scares, but not jumpscares. You're dropped here and there's noises and movement and OH GOD WHAT IS THAT KILL IT FUCK. Give it another couple of hours and you'll be topping those guys left and right, but there's howls in the distance that make you a little uneasy. Most mutant enemies go through this cycle of unknown-scary-identified-understood-kill with impunity. You'll get to know their weaknessess and strategies, but not before feeling a little uneasy that you don't. Another thing I'd like to touch real quick is the set pieces, the kind of ones where you'll be talking about games to a friend and you'll say "Remember that one mission in Singularity, on the bridge, when you-" and they'll go "Yeaahhhh, that was so good!" They're money, all I need to say. 

+
Fantastic design all around
Neat writing and backstory
Memorable encounters throughout, including bosses
Heaps of little unf-worthy touches

-
Some genericity in places (playing it safe?)
Gets progressively linear-er
Phase Ticks and Sewers
Expensive as hell for it's age

Singularity is worth playing through if only to get a crash course in what FPS games in the mid-2000s were like, since it cribs stuff from all it's neighbours while managing to remain it's own beast and being very good for it. It also layers some of it's own stuff on top of that, and is, in general, very good. Time well spent (HAH).

14669671.review:
This game is amazing. You have a choice of using I think 9 or 10 different weapons ( a FRIKKIN MINIGUN IS ONE OF 'EM), good enemy variety, interesting story.
They executed the concept of time manipulation so well that I never forgot about using those powers, and I never felt annoyed to have to use those powers. 
The Story is easy to get into, it's not vague or over the top.
You might think it's attempting to be a horror game after the first 20 minutes of having played it, it's not. There are maybe 2 or 3 jumpscares in the entire game, just tiny instances that wouldn't really bother you.
The level design is amazing, going back in time to the same place you're currently in, which was rusty and falling apart, then 50 years ago it's lookin' slick and futuristic, it's got a Wolfenstein: The New Order feel to it. 
The bosses are fantastic, they aren't hard to beat, they aren't pure BS in the sense that they attack for 2 minutes then have an open spot to shoot for 10 seconds. You're constantly fighting the bosses. You're constantly on edge.
10/10. The price tag is a bit steep, but I'd recommend this any day. If it's ever on sale, you won't have to think twice about buying it (I hope).

Katorga-12. Nevar 4get ;_;

In all honesty though, this is a "Hidden Gem" game if ever I've played one. A great selection of unique and fun weapons that all have weight to them (dat sniper rifle), a great gore/gib system, frantic combat with competent AI, a half way decent story, and unique time bending abilites that give you the edge you need in combat. Words can't describe how fun it is to put a squad of 4 or more enemies into a stasis bubble, walking into the bubble, taking aim and firing a bullet right between each enemies eyes, then collapsing the bubble and watching all 4 mean go flying backwards as their brains leak out the back of their foreheads. Or dropping a grenade at their feet and watching them explode inside the stasis bubble in super slow motion. Good times. And in the end game, when you get your final upgrade, you're literally a god amongst men. 

This game represents what Activision COULD have given us- fun, unique, and well designed shooters, that encouraged fun over realism, weapons that all had unique functions instead of "This rifle shoots really fast, this one shoots in 3 round bursts, and this one fire slowly but deal lots of damage." 

Instead we're stuck with a new Cawwa Doody every year. Our sins our great, and we gotta carry that weight. No amount of rewinding time will fix this now.

This is another of Raven's under-rated gems, one of those games that's better than it has any right to be. It's a solid shooter that riffs on BioShock's environment storytelling but with a little less depth, and has an innovative time-manipulation mechanic that's sadly under-used, mostly reduced to a lock-and-key mechanic. This game is a gem which i highly suggest picking up. The graphics may have aged with some textures not really looking great - this though really matters very little when you encross yourself in it's story whihch is told through recordings and notes scattered throughout the desolate and forgotten environment. There are many mini stories which where for e.g. you come across three dead bodies and suddenly you are transported into a vision of the past where you get to witness the final moments of these sorry dead folk. It really pulls you into the environment. 

The excellent weapon play is really exiting with your standard Pistol, Assault, Shotguns, Snipers, Grenade Launchers with some additional old favourites like the "Gatling" style Autocannon and the Spikeshot which reminds me of the half life 2 crossbow but has explosive spikes, all of  which can be upgraded - add to this nicely imagined power houses like the Seeker Rifle and the exquisite TMD which can age and de-age items, phase shift and pulse pound your enemies among other things. It really is a completely experience where your imagination lets you run free when getting into gun fights. I for mone thoroughly enjoyed using the TMD to catch rockets and grenades fired by the enemy and launch these back as payback (another huge reminder of the Half Life 2 Gravity Gun) - alkso enjoyable is capturing enemies in a time buddle and unleashing a volley of rounds into each ones head - wait for the time to run  out and enjoy their heads explode

Games this reminded me of are - Wolfenstein, Half Life, Bioshock, Fear, Red Faction (with the destroying and repairing environments with the TMD and Pulse to see where you go) as well as Dead Space. It honestly has it all and is really worth the $29 if you can afford it and feel like a game which will thrill you for the 12 odd hours of game play.

13127863.review:
I didn't expect much, but I was surprised to find a ton of cool game mechanics. The ability to selective age objects, create time warp felds, slow down time when scoping, and use telekinesis opened up a lot of cool gameplay doors. These aren't, perhaps, new features - other games have tried it out before. But this game makes an effort to let you interact with tons of environmental objects, which is nice - it turned an otherwise standard shooter experience into something that felt pretty interactive.

But the game's flaws outrank the fun. In order to get the sound to work, you need to disable any recording devices in Windows. The sensitivity bar won't allow you to go lower than a certain amount (which is still way too high), so instead of trying to find a config file, I just halved the DPI on my mouse. The FOV is artifically low (we're talking probably 65, here) so you get a claustrophobic sense of the world.

I might have been able to forgive these shortcomings (and I did, for a few hours), but the real killer was the unbalanced gameplay. I handled giant mutants, blinking mutants, hordes of russians, and twisted undead with no problem. But at a specific point in the game, you're placed into the position of dealing with enemies who kill you in 2-3 shots, and which you're unable to really fight back against. The swarm of suicide bugs who, with three different hits, will kill you. The blade-armed assassin mutant who could take a literal dozen sniper shots to the head (!!) without being visibly damaged. These encounters took about half an hour to get past (a long time to spend in one encounter), with lots of frustration. And worst, they're surrounded by other no-problem encounters. I had thought to crank down the difficulty and cheese my way through these speedbumps, but you can't even do that.

Add that to the game's general low-res appearance, uninteresting environments (someone said it was all brown - that's true), and unsatisfying sound; and the result was that I simply couldn't find a reason to continue playing.

13011229.review:
An immersive science fiction first-person shooter with time manipulation mechanics that I highly recommend to fans of the genre.

You play as a soldier who becomes the wielder of the TMD (Time Manipulation Device). With it your mission is to rewrite history to repair the singularity and save mankind from utter annihilation.

You have an arsenal of weaponry at your disposal, most of which have a secondary fire. Your TMD also serves as a weapon - as it can age items and humans/monsters backwards or forwards. You use the device to navigate your way through the hazardous environments as well as gain an additional approach to firefights. You can upgrade your person and weapons by exploring and collecting energy cells.

Easy, Normal, and Hard difficulties are available.

Games of similar feel: 
Wolfenstein Series
Bulletstorm
Quake IV
Call of Duty Series (Except with mutants).

12994112.review:
Excellent shooter. Highly recommend

Set in a "somewhat postapocalyptic" soviet environment this is a classic First person shooter with some "super-powers" added besides the usual guns. Gameplay is reminiscent of Bioshock, while the setting and atmosphere are close to Metro 2033.
You play as an american soldier sent to investigate closed down and abandoned Soviet facility, where you uncover mistery E99 element and events follow.
What I really liked about the game:
-The gameplay is very solid. You have good amount of different, well-designed weapons (the game keeps giving you new ones right until the end, that way it keeps things interesting). Also you have some superpowers (not from beginning but quite early into the game you get your first one) and the list of the things you can do grows. Timeshift bubble, aging opponents, impulsing all around you, telekinesis. All that good stuff. Overall, the shooting part is fun and makes you feel like a bad-ass. The 'puzzles' won't take 
-The setting. Very gruesome, graphic. Reminiscent of Metro but more "paranormal" stuff.
What is not particularly great but holds up:
-The story. It's pretty linear and straightforward for a game about time-travel and altering history/future, but still it is enjoyable and grips you until the end. The game even has 3 endings, but they are basically the same, just different cut-scenes in the end and you can replay last 1 minute of the game to see them all.
What I disliked:
-For a game that's been out for like 2 years already there's too many bugs. I've had to restart the game around 5 times due to game-breaking bugs (NPCs stuck or disappearing, doors not opening e.t.c) and the thing is - I've wasted good amount of time in each of those instances to figure out that something is wrong. Once there was a sequence where a girl opened some door and I needed to defend her from monsters. Well, the thing got stuck and the monsters spawned endlessly and I couldn't undestand that something is wrong until I wasted all my bullets, medkits, e99 energy and they just killed me (I wasted around 10-15 minutes I think) and after restart the process ended in like 3 monsters and 15 seconds.

All in all, solid title. Recommend to play it if you like shooters, enjoyed Metro 2033 and/or Bioshock.

12871959.review:
So I delayed in writing a review for this game, and while I normally do it after I play a title, my procrastination took over.

Singularity is an interesting alternate-history title, but is mostly under the radar due to general lack of attention. It sets the player in a timeline where the Soviet Union discovered a new compound under the designation "E99", but something goes awry and leaves the island a ghost town for decades.

The only faults I see with this game that could have been ironed out is its difficulty. The game is too easy to me and a few others, and feels afraid to throw a challenge. Another fault I noticed is the music is too climatic for a title like this. In my personal opinion, if you want to get the best out of this game, cram that music slider all the way to the left.

When this game goes on sale, I think you should pick it up. It'll definitely give you a nice 8-10 hours of gameplay.

You can't get all the upgrades through 1 campaign run, and you can't carry those upgrades to the new game. You have to start all over if you want to play again. Just why? It's so much fun that you start a new game without losing uprades.

The story isn't spectacular per se, but it does a great job of keeping you interested and guessing what's going to happen next during the roughly 8-12 hours it is going to take you to complete it, depending on the level of difficulty and how interested you are in reading notes and listening to audio logs and ponies, which is optional.
I recommend starting to play this when you can play through it in one sitting, allowing yourself to get sucked into the world and its story about a pony that...

Hardcore Olshool Shooter!

Da fühlt man sich zurückversetzt nach HL1 und HL2, keine Selbstheilung, keine Open World, kein SchickSchnack oder sonstiges modernes Gedöhns! 
Einfach nur mal richtig schön rumballern, gegen alles Fiese und Böse kämpfen und diese nette Spielzeug am Arm macht es zudem noch etwas abwechslungsreicher.
Allerdings fühlt man sich fast auch grafisch in die Zeit von HL1 zurückversetzt, gut das Game ist von 2010 glaub ich.
Kurz udn gut!
Mir hats Spaß gemacht.
Und im Sale Angebot kann man doch noch mal zuschnappen.

12594803.review:
Solider, einfacher Shooter - macht nichts neu aber was er macht, macht er gut!

Zeitreisen, Mutanten, Fernlenkbare Gewehrgeschosse... alles schonmal irgendwo gesehen oder gespielt. Bei Singularity kommen viele Ideen vergangener Shooter-Jahre zusammen.
+ Das interessante dabei ist, es ist gut verpackt und passt recht ordentlich zusammen.
+ Die Story ansich ist fantasievoll und halbwegs abwechslungsreich gestaltet.
+ Ein übersichtliches und abwechslungsreiches Waffenarsenal bietet interessante Feuerkraft
+ Grafisch zwar nicht "state of the art" aber dennoch ganz passabel
+ Für einen Angsthasen wie mich abschnittsweise ausreichender Gruselfaktor

+/- Eine Spieldauer von 8-9 Stunden ist übersichtlich kurz, reicht in diesem Fall jedoch aus

- Man begegnet zwar dem einen oder anderen stärkeren Gegner, den man als "Boss" bezeichnen könnte, ansich bleibt klassiche Shoot-Eigenschaft etwas außenvor
- Alte Notzen, Bilder die man durch Zeitmanipulation wieder sichtbar macht und Audioaufzeichnungen können eine Story durchaus greifbarer gestalten, was hier jedoch nur sehr bedingt dazu beiträgt
- Das Spiel läuft zwar komplett flüssig, leider haben die Texturen zuweilen 'Ladehemmungen' ^^

Fazit:
Als Angebot für unter 10€ definitiv für einen oder zwei intensive Sessions zu empfehlen!

12490574.review:
Melhor comentário sobre esse jogo foi esse, só não lembro onde li: 'Singularity é como se Bioshock e Metro 2033 tivessem um filho'

Jogaço, ainda não o terminei mas to curtindo bastante. Os combates são bem legais e com uma boa dificuldade, uma boa variedade de inimigos e a luta com os chefões são maneiríssimas. Dificuldade na medida certa, nem muito fácil mas também não é excessivamente difícil, apesar de umas partes vc provavelmente irá morrer umas 2,3 vezes até pegar o jeito.

O lance de alternar entre as armas e o TMD, que possui várias funções, é onde o jogo lembra bioshock, além da atmosfera meio steampunk. Já a parte que lembra Metro 2033 são os inimigos mutantes, a vibe da história que fala sobre os Soviéticos e seus planos pra vencer a guerra fria e no final das contas tudo deu errado e a ilha foi detonada, e também a atmosfera sombria e inimigos que te pegam de surpresa. 

História legal, jogabilidade muito boa, gráficos e sons bem feitos, não tenho do que reclamar desse jogo. O sistema de checkpoints também é bom, ainda mais que é comum situações de tentativa e erro em que o jogador morre algumas vezes até conseguir passar.

Uma pena não ter feito mais sucesso, com certeza está à altura dos grandes títulos do gênero.

12222446.review:
A criminally overlooked FPS that has some great mechanics as well as excellent action.
You will be jumping in time from present day to the Soviet Union era on the mysterious island of Katorga-12 while also fighting not only soldiers but also nasty mutants that roam the island.
The Time Manipulation Device, TMD for short, is this game's version of the Gravity Gun as it is used in both combat and in puzzles, you can age or revert objects that might be in your way and the same can be done to the human enemies you will be facing, there's nothing better then seeing a Russian soldier turn to ashes as you rapidly age him with the TMD.
And the atmosphere in the game is done really well too, especially in the beginning when you wander through the ruined apartment blocks where the workers of Katorga-12 used to live and also see the ghostly images of those who died there, much System Shock 2, BioShock and other titles where "ghosts" appeared at certain points to provide backstory for the player.
You simply should not pass up on this little gem, especially if you love some of Raven Software's previous titles with their gunplay, like the 2009 Wolfenstein game.

12059018.review: To say that Singularity wears its inspiration on its sleeve is to put it very lightly. The game is almost shamelessly derivative, taking the both the style and character building of BioShock, the gravity gun from Half-Life 2, and throwing in a few nods to F.E.A.R. 12000716.review:
Singularity is one of those fun little gems that hides away in the corner of the steamstore which never really sees the light of day, when really it should have more recognition than its got. All i can say is thaqt this game is immencely enjoyable from start to finish; I it is one of the only game which has kept me entertained and intrigued throughout. Seriously there is rarely a dull moment in it, mainly I think because you're always slightly scared and creeped out by this mysterious island of Katorga-12 where it is set. Mind you this is no horror game, but it will give a nice dose scares throughout which will keep your toes most of the way through. 

Of course game can be frustrated sometimes when trying to work out puzzels, and a couple of enemy's may halt your progress for longer than is ideal, but still it rarely slows down with the action and intresting story.

My recommendation is:

If you want a game which tries something different, and gives a sort of breath of fresh air, pick it up when it's on sale, as £15 is a bit on the steep side. But is you want something fun to play, then just pick it up if you feel like it.

11922223.review:
[h1] A Katorga 12 va di scena lo shooter old-school condito da instabile E-99[/h1]

Raven software ci propone l'ucronia in cui l'U.R.S.S. nel 1955 pone le basi per conquistare il pianeta, scoperto il fantomatico E-99 elemento che fa apparire l'odierno grafene, panacea per tutti i problemi mondiali, un detersivo per lavatrici.

Storia: impersoneremo Nathaniel Renko capitano dell'esercito U.S.A. che come ogni clichè che si rispetti si ritroverà ad affrontare una situazione del tutto inaspettata e più grande di lui. La trama non è originale ma è solida e ben orchestrata presentando 3 finali alternativi. 
Siamo, su un elicottero, diretti a Katorga 12 -un'isola della ex Unione Sovietica- per un problema ad un satellite, causato proprio da un picco d'energia elettromagnetica partorito dall'oramai inabitata colonia. Tuttavia una seconda ondata mette fuori uso il nostro mezzo di trasporto facendoci precipitare. Qui scopriamo gli esperimenti sull'E-99 condotti durante la guerra fredda, quando iniziano i viaggi temporali a cavallo tra il '55 e il 2010...

Gameplay: vecchia scuola; niente coperture o schivate solo uno scatto temporaneo. L'equipaggiamento non vanta un vasto arsenale, ma le armi risultano ben diversificate tra pistola, fucile a pompa, mitragliatrice, fucile di precisione, bombe stasi e soprattutto l'originale quanto riuscito C.M.T. Il congegno, ideato da Barisov, è in grado di manipolare il tempo oltre che possedere abilità offensive (come l'onda d'urto alla Gravity Gun di Half Life 2) e difensive; un'arma che idealmente ci rimanda anche alle meccaniche di Timeshift.
Il divertimento è assicurato dal cambio di ritmo, tra pause narrative ed enigmi ambientali e situazioni intrattenute da frenetiche sparatorie. L'evoluzione delle abilità è garantita dalla scoperta di item ad alimentare gli upgrade per approfondire le modalità d'intervento.
Completa il quadro una serie di file audio che ricorda molto lo stile Bioshock, con cui condivide l'importanza di una location molto ispirata, caratterizzata stavolta dall'elemento E-99 e dalla possibilità di viaggiare in epoche diverse.

I.A: nemica aggressiva e diversificata nei pattern d'attacco; resa meno efficace solo da un level-design non sempre ben riuscito, soprattutto negli ambienti esterni risolvibili troppo facilmente con fucili in grado di ritardare il tempo. 
Le boss-fight sono leggermente sottotono, una difficolta maggiore avrebbe reso più appetibili questi momenti. 

Comparto grafico: che presenta texture in bassa definizione. Buona la propaganda filo-russa disseminata sull'isola atta a donare personalità.

Comparto tecnico non era eccezionale nel 2010, anno di uscita del titolo, e non lo è a maggior ragione oggi a 4 anni di distanza. Il frame-rate è granitico per questo titolo mosso dall'Unreal Engine 3. Gli effetti particolari non stupiscono; c'è dell'aliasing marcato.

Comparto audio: ottimo, accompagna magnificamente alcune situazioni di forte tensione; buono il doppiaggio e l'effettistica.

Commento finale: Katorga 12 è ricca di fascino, così come il periodo storico e l'espediente temporale. Ci sono elementi presi da capolavori assoluti come bioshock e half-life; forse questo ha mosso qualche critica in più nell'immediata uscita, ma il titolo mi sembra valido e con una trama senza buchi . Il gameplay in generale è divertente, peccato solo per il level-design non originale.

voto 7,9

11907578.review: You know, this game doesn't get enouugh credit.  It flew under the radar I feel, and is quite a nice gem in amongst the CoD games.  Dark, somewhat creepy, with monsters that did catch me off guard a few times, was a good, solid game.  Storywise, leaves a little to be desired, with what I think is a clunky ending, but with three possible endings, allows you to think back through the story a few times to make your decision.  Good game, a little under rated.

11890273.review:
You know those games that create a unique, compelling, immersive world?  This is not one of those games.

This game reminded me strongly of the Russian-created game, "You Are Empty," which also sends you through a destroyed world created by Soviet super-science gone horribly awry - AND involves time travel.  One detail - "You Are Empty" came out in 2007.  Hmm.  Funny, that.

Anyway, though "You are Empty" feels like a game created by a small indie studio, the super-Soviet world they created felt more authentic than the one in Singularity, created by big studio Raven Software.

I am still playing it, but my biggest pet peeve so far is when they have English text with silly things like backwards 'R's, I suppose to make it seem Russian.

Anyway, the gameplay is reasonable, though not particularly inspired, so if you get it cheap enough, and you aren't expecting much, you should have some fun. My "thumbs down" is based on the current price of $29.99.

11890132.review:
Singularity is a piece of good, dumb science fiction and really fun to storm through in a couple sittings. The story relies very heavily on its MacGuffin to great effect, you feel like a super powered badass trapsing around levels throwing one of many exploding red barrels or turning enemies into dust. 
It's a little easy near the end once you have powered up your abilities but by that point you're burning through the story at a good pace. 
Singularity isn't perfect but it is a lot of fun.

11886135.review:
자막의 부재가 치명적이다. 그외에도 단점이 많이 보이고 이상하게 그 단점이 내 머리로도 전부 극복이 된다는 점은 심히 유감스럽지만 게임자체는 정말 독특하다.
하다보면 정말 많은 게임의 느낌이 섞여 나오는데, 게임의 외양은 바이오쇼크, 캐릭터 디자인은 울펜슈타인(2009)과 레드얼럿3, 특수능력은 하프라이프2, 홀로그램을 사용한 UI는 데드스페이스, B급 특유의 구리함은 레전더리. 온갖 게임이 한데 뒤섞여 짬뽕을 이룬다. 그 향이 너무나 조잡해서 사실 구매전 기대보다 못미쳤다고 생각했다. 적은 몹의 종류, 무기수는 그리 적지않지만 크게 부족하다고 느꼈던 무기 체계, 특히 판타지에 알러지가 있는 나에게 싱귤래리티의 몹 디자인 센스는 형편없었다. 오죽하면 레드얼럿3가 생각날 정도였으니까. 컨셉아트를 보면 게임에서 등장하지 않는 것도 많이 있는것으로 봐선 게임 제작 당시에 각본에서의 축소가 있지 않았나 싶다. 
언리얼 엔진을 사용해서 시각적인 느낌은 바이오쇼크와 배트맨 아캄 어사일럼을 많이 닮아있다. 그래픽은 평범하지만 성의없는 텍스처가 입혀진곳이 많으며 화면을 돌릴때 텍스처를 자주 불러와서 흐릿하다가 선명하게 바뀐다. 사실 판타지적인 비주얼에 거부감을 느꼈던 탓인지 특기할만한건 없다. 다소 성의없는 슈팅감이 문제긴하지만 충분히 즐길만한 수준이었고 TMD를 이용한 특수기술, 장비 업그레이드, 퍼크를 이용해서 플레이어에게 유리하게 커스터마이징 할수있다. 특히 TMD를 이용한 기술은 그 존재만으로 독특함을 자랑한다. 충격파를 쏴서 사지를 분해시키고, 특정공간의 시간을 느리게하거나, 오브젝트의 시간조작을 통한 간단한 퍼즐같이 시공의 조작이라는 테마를 십분 활용했다. 다만 부족하다고 생각되는 점이라면, 그중에서 가장 호쾌하고 멋진 플레이가 가능하게 하는 기능이 딱 하나라는 점이다. 예를 들면 블랙홀을 만들어 사물을 빨아들인다던지, 서로 통하는 포탈을 생성시켜 총을 쏜놈에게 총알이 되돌아가게 만든다던지 하는 기능이 한가지라도 더욱 멋진 플레이를 할수 있지않았을까하는 아쉬움이 남는다. TMD관련 해서 가장 불편했던것은 각 기술마다 소비되는 에너지의 분량이 정량적이지가 않다는 것인데, 해보면 느끼겠지만, 애매하게 남아있으면 전부 소진하지 않는 이상은 에너지 교체가 불가하여 이것으로 인해서 전투중에 큰 피해를 입는 불상사가 벌어진다. 이건 에너지 표기를 하나의 막대기로 표현할게 아니라 메달오브아너 에어본의 체력바처럼 여러개의 막대기로 표현을 해서 각 기술마다 소비되는 에너지의 양을 막대기 갯수로 정량화했어야 했다. 무기중에서 총기보관함에서 보급받을수 없는 특수 총기 두가지가 있는데 그중에서 총알의 이동방향을 조종해 영화 원티드를 연상시키는 사격을 할수있는 총도있다. 보급받을수있는 무기는 종류가 일곱가지가 있고 업그레이드를 통해서 환골탈태가 가능하지만 쓰는 총만 쓰게 되는 경향이 있다. 특히 센추리온 리볼버는 초반을 제외하고 존재이유가 불투명하며 이는 두개의 무기만을 들수있는 무기 소지 방식의 문제점으로 보인다. 
싱귤래리티가 자신있게 내놓을수 있는 스토리부분은 상당히 완성도가 높고 역시 독특하다. 인트로부터 인상적이고 중간중간 볼수있는 미스터리한 문구들, 크라이오스테이시스같이 과거와 현재를 넘나들며 변화하는 세계를 보는 재미도 있다. 위키에 따르면 엔딩은 세가지가 있다고 한다. 분기점은 엔딩직전에 갈리는터라 멀티엔딩으로 유명한 다른 게임들의 치밀함까지는 기대하기 힘들지만 뒷이야기가 상당히 흥미롭고 엔딩크레딧 뒤에는 쿠키영상까지 있어서 나름 확실한 마무리까지 해준다. 다만, 그 분기에서 다소 웃겼던게, 인물을 선택적으로 총으로 처형을 해야하는 상황에서 처형대상이 "우리의 생사를 주인공의 손에 맡기겠네"이러고 총을 맞기를 기다리는 연출을 넣은건 너무 우스꽝스러웠다. 차라리 두명 다 죽음의 위협을 느끼고 주인공을 죽이려 총을 빼드는 찰나의 슬로모 연출을 넣던가, 아니면 선택 대상 둘이 서로를 헐뜯으며 격렬히 몸싸움을 하는 와중의 슬로모 연출을 넣던가.... 내가 생각을 해도 이렇게 밋밋하게 만들수가 없다. 어떤 모지리들이 총맞기를 기다리고 있겠는가... 여담으로 깜놀이 간간히 함유되어있으니 사람에 따라선 공포물로 느껴질 수도 있겠다. 그외에 단점들로는 주인공 위치에 따라 npc가 대화를 할때 고개를 돌리던가 몸을 돌리던가 해야하는데 그냥 한곳만 응시하고 떠든다는 점, 사용키와 장전키가 같고 TMD 조작키가 중구난방인 점, 먹을게 아직 많은데 npc는 무시하고 계속 전진하는 점이다.

결론적으로 소재는 굉장히 좋았는데 게임이 못따라갔다. 구멍이 눈에 보일정도로 많았고, 더구나 나조차도 메울 수 있을 수준의 것들이라는게 더욱 안타깝다. 발매시기를 고려해봐도 이 정도 연출이 없다는건 확실히 스토리만으로 승부를보기에 경쟁력이 뛰떨어졌을 것이다. A급이 될뻔했던 B급 SF 판타지로 압축이 가능하며 요즘 못느낀 스토리(which was good)와 연출(which was bad)의 중요함을 느낄수 있었다.

7/10

구매가 : 5달러

11878397.review:
Well, this is the problem with Steams thumbs up/down recommendation system. Is Singularity fun? Yes, I'd imagine so, I had fun, at least. Is it a stand out experience? No.

Singularity, in my mind, goes alongside games like TimeShift and Haze as a fairly good time when your playing it but you won't remember it nor care ten minutes after finishing it. This game is a actually somewhat more interesting time than other games I have mentioned but it is still basically a core 'gimmick' mechanic fleshed out with a throwaway story.

If you're looking for some dumb fun in between better games then you could do worse than Singularity but I'd recommend picking it up during a sale.

11846038.review: Paranormal sci-fi horror with temporal-weaponry. 2nd playthrough. Definitely worth playing again. Story revolves around a newly discovered (ficticious) element, e99, and the island Katorga-12 where it is exclusively found. E99 holds enormous energetic potential, but is unstable, mutates organic life, and distorts time where it abounds. You are a captain in the u.s. military sent to the island; thought abandoned, to investigate an energy signature which is blinding u.s. spy satelittes. Upon arriving, a temporal wake engulfs you, sending you back in time to 1955. There you find yourself in the same lab facility as it burns. Without hesitation, you rescue a scientist, Demichev. Only before a 2nd temporal wake brings you back to 2010. Demichev was one of two lead scientists heading research into the element and its application. He will continue recklessly pursuing his controversial research without regard for life. His research results in the development and collapse of the singularity, it kills 1000s instantly and mutates any remaning survivors on the island. The result is a paranormal, atemporal mess, torn by violence. Failing to be disuaded, Demichev develops e99 weaponry and quickly rises to power, empowering Russia to conquer the world. The game is primarily about restoring the timeline, but throughout the game you encounter cryptic warnings, written in messages only you can reveal. Perhaps left by a future-you? or by MIR-12? A mysterious organization with knowlecge they couldn't possibly posess, and whose intentions are unclear. As far as enemies, the mutant survivors of the island, warped by the energy of singularity collapse are almost alien. They move incredibly fast, in and out of phase, or can teleport. Others have heightened hearing, but are blind. Still others have become incredibly large. Temporal rifts frequent the game where you can witness events in the past occuring concurrently with the present; revealing the tragic deaths of the inhabitants. Recordings also build this story and reveal what happened in the time since you traveled to 1955. Mostly detailing the exodus of survivors and their horrific deaths attempting to leave. Weapons are also e99 based. Guided rounds, sniper that can slow down time for precise shots, and standard-shooter semi-auto shotgun, assault rifle, and minigun. The most fun is with your TMD, a device you are led to early in the game which embues you with great power. You can create time manipulation fields that age/rejuvenate items or people/mutants, timelocks which freeze time, you can pull things between time-periods, and jump between the years 1955 and 2010. Futher more, you can unleash a blast of energy from your palm that will send enemies flying or will rip them apart. Graphics were out of date even for it's time, but it's just bloody fun to play. And the story line is eery, but enjoyable. Short, but worth your attention, especially if you're into paranormal or sci-fi horror games. Fans of the metro or STALKER series would enjoy, although the feel is much more arcade.

11765931.review:
Singularity. Singularity. You know, this is what some people described this game: 'Half-Life combined with Bioshock'. Is that right, or wrong? Well, half right, half wrong. While you do feel like you are playing that kind of game, it's not that kind of game at all. And I will explain every one bit why this game does not deserve a 7/10, an 8/10, or a unbelievable 9/10.

First off, the game does not have a memorable story. You play as this army guy- yeah, how original. Anyway, you are at this weird Russian island where this new powerful and rare element called the 'E-99' was found, and the Soviet Union was planning to use this against the USA, when something went horribly wrong.

In the first hour, you actually feel like you are in this dangerous place where something really went wrong, and you need to find out why. But the game quickly tells you everything about the plot in the first 4 hours, and the only momorable thing is the characters, and a good plot twist at the end.

Speaking of characters, this game's 'characters' are not great at all. At least Half-Life didn't have a lot of major characters, it was all just Gordon, and Bioshock had a lot of great characters, while this game doesn't have any of those. There's this heroine character which is so blend I wanted to smack her in the face because she did not have any point to the plot except for her first appearance.

There's also this scientist guy who looked to be kind at first, but he goes beyond and becomes kind of crazy at the end. And there's the antagonist, which is... well, he's bad and he has a scar. That's about it. He also tries to take over the world but- (OF COURSE!) Okay, I'll stop with the characters now.

The story itself? It's not too bad. It makes sense at best, but it takes away immersion once the Russian soldiers start attacking you, and the monsters become so easy, drawing you away from this atmosphere of 'a island where something went horribly wrong'.

The gameplay is great. It's the only thing worth anything in this game. This device- the TMD, short for Time Manipulation Device, can do so much fun stuff like making people older, making objects newer, a energy blast, or telekinesis powers. It was so fun trying out this powers, and since the gun play is very average, you start wanting to use more of this powers, rather then the guns, which is not a good gameplay design.

You can never beat Bioshock using the plasmids majority of the time, you use them so you can kill people more easily, not to kill people. Well, some of them can, but you still use the guns or the wrench majority of the time.

Still though, you can have fun with it, so it is kinda good in my book. But still, it does not makes this game a great game.

This game deserves a maximum of 6/10. It's above average, I still have to say that it's better then most of the modern CoD games, but it's not a great game in the slightest. I can't decide if it's a 'good' game or not, but even if it was obvious that the game was good, I would still have given the game 6/10 because the price tag is too high- 30$ for this game? Seriously, Activision? Seriously? This game deserves an 14.99, or even better, if Activision's gracious enough, 11.99. That's the best price tag you can put on this game.

This game is definitely at least worth checking out if it goes on sale, or if you find this much cheaper somewhere else. The game took me about 6~7 hours, which is not great at all- actually, no, bad for a 29.99$ game. But still, some people even got 11 hours, so don't count me on this one.

11761007.review: This game is pretty cool. I really hated some sections though- like the Time Leeches, but the gameplay and story are pretty mindless fun that's enough to sink your teeth into for a few hours. The atmosphere is very unique but also very strange. It also has no bullet time- aside from a bullettime sniper scope that only works for that weapon. The game, in case you can't tell from the screenshots, has a gauntlet that reverses and speeds up time and blasts things and such. The guns are okay, the enemies are interesting and hard, but the art style and the havoc you can cause is simply a blast to play. The levels have a ton of exploration and are some of the highlights of the game. If you wade through the rather stupid beginning levels things get pretty serious- the messages you see on the wall (pulled through another time period) give you bizarre warnings like "DON'T TRUST THAT LADY YOU'RE FOLLOWING" and make you freaked out. You can turn people into time mutants and watch their friends flip the hell out. I think it's a great title. Between this and timeshift, you can't really go wrong.

11717031.review:
The Good:
The setting (abandoned Soviet Military research base, what's not to like?)
The Plot (although it's a bit patchy in places there are some genuine scares to be had but they may be underwhelming for some people)
The atmosphere (you do genuinely feel creeped out reading through the diary entries and audio logs of what happened before you arrived and seeing 'flashbacks')
Some of the more sophisticated weapons (like the rifle which allows you to steer your explosive bullets straight into enemies)
The powers and time travel work really well and are easy to use without feeling like a gimicky add on

The Bad:
The puzzles (there's about 3 basic types which just get repeated over and over and which mostly rely on you spotting the EXACT piece of rusty metal you need in a room full of bits of random rusty metal)
The enemies (the AI is really dumb and the difficulty just gets ramped up through the game by increasing their health and making some enemies immune to some of your abilities)
The difficulty (it's a really easy game to finish and the higher difficulty ratings don't change things much since I've already completed 2 separate playthroughs taking my time to explore everywhere)

The Meh:
Other than the 'exotic' weapons you've got the bog standard FPS arsenal (i.e. pistol, assault rifle, shotgun, sniper rifle, rocket launcher and grenade launcher)
The Boss battles (by and large the bosses are just bullet sponge versions of the normal enemies with some form of highlighted weakspot that may as well just be a sign saying 'shoot here')
The Graphics are pretty good for a game this old (I suppose they would have been better when it was first released, but they're starting to show their age)

Overall verdict:
A solid and pretty good but (understandably) underrated FPS, but not quite worth paying full price for. My advice is (unless you REALLY REALLY want it) wait for it come on sale and grab it.

Singularity ist ein völlig unterbewerteter Action FPS mit kleinen Horrorelementen. Mir hat es unheimlich viel Spaß gemacht durch Szenerien zu laufen, die an den ersten Silent Hill Film erinnern, mit speziellen Fähigkeiten, ähnlich wie bei Bioshock und das Ganze in eine Story verpackt, die im Fringe Universum hätte stattfinden können.

Es ist kein besonders langes Spiel, wird Euch aber ununterbrochen bei Laune halten. Selbst auf dem härtesten Schwierigkeitsgrad und ohne Zielhilfe ist es keine Riesenherausforderung, umso mehr kann man das Gesamtkonzept genießen. Eine Stelle hat mich zur Verzweiflung gebracht (ja, ich rede mit euch Phasenzecken!), mit der richtigen Angehensweise war auch das zu bewältigen ;)

11435846.review: 몰입감도 있고 재미도 있다. 소재도 꽤 독특한데 '사물'의 시간을 과거와 현재로 바꾸며 퍼즐도 풀어나간다. 게임 배경 자체도 과거와 현재를 넘나들며 진행된다. 별로 질리지 않고 한 번에 플레이를 할 수 있었으며 엔딩은 세 가지가 있고 분기점은 엔딩 바로 직전이니 큰 수고 없이 엔딩 세 가지를 모두 체험할 수 있다. 나온 시기에 비해 가격이 꽤 고가인데, 가격에 비해선 플레이타임이 짧은 편이다. 세일할 때 사면 좋을 것이다.

11435825.review:
It's a decent game, but it has a lot of technical problems and is missing some key features. If you liked Half Life 2, Bioshock and Timeshift, but for some reason don't want to play them again, you could buy Singularity. I would say it's not a good game, but a fun game. 4/10.

Let's start with the bad. There are no subtitles. Just none, at all. Considering there are usually a lot of sounds and music in the background, and all characters speak with a Russian accent, this is a gigantic problem. Also, it's just rediculous for a game from 2010 to not have subtitles. 

The second problem are the options. There barely are any graphical options, and even less for audio options. The lack of the latter makes the subtitle problem even worse; you can't just lower the SFX or Music so you would hear the voices better. 

The graphical options might be a result from a (bad) port. Another minor result of this might be a problem with the controls. In the beginning of the game, you can use a melee attack. However, at some point you get a new power, which is binded to the melee key, and from this moment you can no longer use your melee attack. My guess would be that it's because it was the same button on console, they made it the same button on PC as well. This sucks, since the new power you get on that button is vastly inferior to your regular melee attack.
Another control-related problem is the Use/Reload key. For some reason, they put both on the same key, and you can't change that. That means that you either don't have E as Use key, or the R as Reload. You get used to this quickly, but there is still no reason for this to be inconvienent.  

The graphical options are bad, and possibly as a result, so are the actual graphics. The style is OK, but the texture quality is decent for the best objects, and it's terrible for some. There are some other problems that bothered me in the beginning, but I got used to fairly quick One of them was animations that would get interrupted by other animations, making it look rediculous. For instance, the recoil animation on your pistol is actually longer than the minimum time between shots, resulting the in recoiling animation ending halfway to display the shooting animation. They either should have made the animations as long as the action that they belong to, or they should have made them go over in eachother better.
Another graphical problem is a minor problem with a specific weapon: You are sort of invisible. There is a special weapon that lets you guide a bullet, and it uses a bulled-mounted camera to do so. If you turn the bullet 180 degrees, and look at the position that your character is standing, there is nothing there. Nothing at all. In the meantime, your enemies do see you and keep firing at you. This looks rather rediculous; the enemies fire at thin air...

That were most of the big complaints. It's quite a list, and it's the reason I would never call this a good game. I did however finish the game, and most of the time spent I enjoyed myself. That means there must some redeeming qualies.

Actually, there is one. The gunplay. It's a shooter, and in the end the most important part is the combat. Which is very enjoyable. There are quite some weapons and they vary greatly. That is, however the only good part, and it's still not perfect. There are many weapons, but I used most of them only for a little while, before realizing it's vastly inferior to my main weapon: the Shotgun. It's so strong that it kills almost all enemies in one shot. With your sprint you are fast enough to avoid most damage, get up close, and one-hit them. This is fun, but it also means that it's not possible without thinking "This is so much weaker than the Shotgun" on most other weapons. The only other 2 weapons that I used sometimes were the Sniper and the Minigun, both to deal with enemies from afar. 

Apart from the gunplay, there's not much to the gameplay. You can use Time-powers in combat, but it's pointless. Depending on the enemy, it's either a useless slow, or an instant kill, and even if it's an instant kill it costs a ton of energy (you can only do this twice in a row, three with upgrades I guess), while you could also just use your shotgun for the same effect. I never had any ammo problems while I did have energy problems, and this is while I always used guns and very rarely the energy powers. 

The story is enjoyable, but predictable and full of plotholes and half-explained events. For instance, there are some occasions that you change things in the past that change the future (in big and small ways). The problem is that all characters seem to know this while there is no way they could know. The explanation they give has to do with leaving notes, but it makes no sense, and it would imply that everyone believes something because it's written on a wall somewhere. Another big problem with the story is a spoiler for the ending, so skip it if you want to. [spoiler] In the end the big reveal is that you are the one who changed the past and messed up the world. You saved some scientist from a burning building, and the scientist became a Russian dictator controlling the world. They act like it's a big reveal, but it's glaringly obvious and if you payed any attention to the game you would have know it an hour in. That's not the only problem: the 'solution' they give for this problem is that you go back in time to when you save this scientist, and kill YOURSELF. So you can't just kill the scientist (for no reason whatsoever) and have to kill yourself from the past, creating a time paradox (aka plothole). [/spoiler] That were just some examples of mistakes in the story, and overall I would say this makes the story very forgettable.

There are some more problems related to both story and gameplay. The first is the Time-Slow thing you can do while zoomed in with the Sniper. It's quite fun, but for some reason you can use this before you character ever comes in contact with Time-altering powers. It is a real Time power, and not just holding your breath or something, since it's called something like Time Dialation. There is no explanation given for this, whatsoever.

The last thing I want to point out is the pointless use of the time altering power on objects. You can make objects yourger and older, which is used for puzzles and hidden areas. It's quite fun, but you can also use it on ammo chests, audio logs and stairs, in which case it's often just pointless waiting. If you find an audio log, instead of just listening to it, you have to repair it by making it new again (i.e. press the Q button) and wait for the animation. The same with ammo chests, and stairs; you just have to wait a second before you can use the object. The idea is fun, but if you have to wait a second before using any object it's just tedious and annoying. 

So overall, there's not much to this game. Nothing is exceptional, and the fun part (the shooting) get's harder to enjoy because of missing features and technical problems. In general, I think a 2010 game by Raven, published by Activision should have been much better, and it's just unacceptable to not have subtitles in this day and age. The concept was OK, and if they put a bit more time and effort in, I think it could be a very good shooter. Alas, now it's just a below-mediocore shooter. The only reason to buy this would be if all the things below are true:
1. It's on sale for $5 or less. 
2. You really liked Half Life 2, but have no desire to play it again.
3. You really liked Bioshock, but have no desire to play it again.
4. You really liked Timeshift, but have no desire to play it again.
5. You don't like to listen to music while playing games (since if you do you won't hear a word from the story)
6. You know you can get over major and minor problems in graphics, contols, and desing for the sake of enjoyable shooting.
