11388904.review:
Качественный, но безыдейный сборник из экшенов последних 10 лет. Играл ещё при выходе, и сейчас решил переиграть. Ну, люблю я такую тематику, да и монстров всяких в придачу.

Альтернативная история. После окончания Второй мировой войны СССР ищет способы сдерживания военной угрозы со стороны США. Решением проблемы является минерал-элемент Е-99, запасы которого обнаружены на небольшом острове близ Камчатки. Там же основывается научный комплекс Каторга-12. Помимо увеличения урожайности, выработки огромной энергии и прочих чудес Е-99 вызывает мутации и искажения пространства-времени. Естественно, дело до добра не доходит - на острове происходит катастрофа, данные засекречиваются и о проекте забывают. В наши дни США фиксируют радиоактивную вспышку в регионе и отправляют  на разведку отряд морской пехоты. Главный герой игры – капитан Ренко является одним из членов отряда.

Кроме занятной псевдонаучной завязки сюжету похвастать, к сожалению, нечем. Исправление ошибок прошлого и перемещения во времени на порядок лучше реализованы в серии Prince of Persia. Хотя в игре и присутствует несколько концовок, все их можно посмотреть, переигрывая финал.

Атмосфера создаётся за счёт советской символики и кривой кириллицы. Но чем дальше от начала, тем сильнее она тает, да и весь хоррор улетучивается. Поселение, школа, аудиозаписи, мутанты, неизвестность… Дальше, увы, среднестатистические лаборатории, туннели, доки.

Главная фишка игры – МВП - мобильный временной преобразователь. Данный девайс позволяет перемещать определённые объекты,  содежащие Е-99, во времени. С его помощью можно восстановить сломанную лестницу или превратить солдата в скелет. Похожее в более крупном масштабе было реализовано год спустя в  Red Faction: Armageddon. Также МВП создаёт защитную сферу, время в которой замедляется, как для противников, так и для их снарядов (привет, Ubersoldier). Гравипушка (Half-life) и локатор (Dead Space) также входят в комплект. Собирая оружейные наборы или Е-99, можно модифицировать на специальном станке (Dead Space) оружие и МВП соответственно. Апгрейды банальны и в большинстве своём пассивны, дают плюсы к ёмкости магазинов, урону, здоровью, длительности спринта и т.п. На МВП завязаны простенькие головоломки. Оружие тоже оригинальностью не блещет, но можно отметить, например, винтовку с управляемыми пулями (Clive Barker's Jericho) или гранатомет с катающимися бомбами-шарами, которые, правда, пригодятся лишь пару раз за игру.

С технической стороны игра особых нареканий не вызывает, но и хвалить не за что. Типичный Unreal Engine 3.
Мультиплеер представлен двумя режимами: “Уничтожение” и “Солдаты против Монстров”. Но оппонентов мне опять найти не удалось.

Несмотря на вторичность, играется довольно бодро и за 8 часов игра приесться не успевает.

11367386.review: This is one of my favorite games that I've ever played.  It's seriously a lot of fun, and I actually like it a lot more than Bioshock, which it's compared to a lot.  Any FPS fan, especially those who like having alternate powers in addition to the guns, should seriously take a look at this game.  It's a bit linear, but it's so much fun.

11339131.review:
Singularity is one of those hidden gems that seem to only attract its real fans long after its demise and relegation to the scrap heap. Don't misunderstand that as the game being bad, because it most certainly is not. Singularity is everything that used to be fun in the FPS genre, before mainstreaming took it over. Essentially, Singularity is a popcorn shooter with fluid non-stop combat, lots of enemies, a great story, a lengthy singleplayer campaign and a neat RPG-lite character building system that borrows from System Shock/Bioshock without completely ripping them off.

Your average shooter fan won't like Singularity since it speaks more to the 90s gamers out there, so be warned if you're expecting something modern. That being said, If you want a solid FPS with a clever gimmick, an entertaining story and some great level design....here you go. Thank me later.

11321457.review:
Путешествия во времени,возможность им повелевать, последствия,эффект бабочки и прочее  уже давно и крепко  сидит в мозгу  у множества людей.По эой теме  написано множество  книг,сняты фильмы  но практически нет игр.Если вы считаете  что это  нечестно  сыграйте в  Singularity ,она как раз  про  время и все что с ним связано.
  
Игра начинается с того ,что на  острове Каторга-12(правда замечательное название?)где в  50 годах  20 века проводились  секретные эксперименты  с элементом Е-99(который можно было добыть только на нем )Американскими службами  замечено  странное излучение,обеспокоенное правительство  отправляет  туда  вертолет  разведки  на котором и летит  наш герой  Натаниель Ренко .Попав   под действие странной волны вертолет  терпит крушение  ,придя в себя герой идет  к месту эвакуации,немного не доходит и вновь  встречается с волной...попав в 55  год,все горит,рушится ,а Ренко  спасает человека  который вот-вот упадет  в огонь.Снова волна и вот  мы в 2010 году,вроде бы ничего не изменилось(кроме нескольких статуй и   портетов в комнате)и мы идем дальше и вот тут нам встречаются монстры,потом  напарник,потом советские солдаты,  а потом и  тот самый ученый которого мы спасли ,зовут  его   Николай Демичев и  на данный момент он самый влиятельный человек в мире ,вот вам и эффект  бабочки, именно он убивает  нашего напарника ( которого зовут Джеймс Девлин) ,а мы,благодаря  сопротивлению  ,спасаемся,отправляемся в лабораторию  и добываем   МВП(мобильный временной преобразователь)  с помощью которого можно  управлять  временем.После этого пролог заканчивается и начинается игра.

  Стрельба ,взрывы,монстры,элементы хоррора, футуристическое  оружие ,моральные диллемы, кровь,трупы ,моральный выбор,споры , путешествия во времени,вот лишь малая толика того что может предложить нам  Singularity.Великолепная  история,по-настоящему красиво   проработанные  локации(хотя  русскии люди  найдут множество несоответствий,но что поделать игру делали американцы )  четыре концовки и  очень интересные  внутриигровые документы(везде раскиданы записики и магнитофонаы которые реально интересно читать)превращают  эту игру  в поистине  хороший шутер который просто не успевает вам надоесть(игра проходится буквально за  5 часов)а грамотная дозировка   "вау-моментов" не дает  заскучать.

 Singularity  несомненно  хорошая игра,в ней есть  мелкие  недочеты,есть  погрешности(например   довольно  слабые и невыразительные боссы)но  всего этого не замечаешь ,ведь  это именно  та игра  которую интересно исследовать,в ее мире приятно находиться, а все  фокусы со  временем  довольно неплохо реализованы.Это не шедевр  ,но  это крепкий и очень интересный проект ознакомиться с которым я бы рекомендовал многим  ,особенно  сейчас,когда свежих релизов на горизонте  не наблюдается.

Оценка игры 7.5/10 баллов.

11248785.review:
A Mix bag of: Bioshock meeting Crysis, who both makeout with Dead Space, who's, in turn, seeing secretly Half-life! This epic romance made this child called Singularity! This game is strange in the sense that you'll feel that you've played it before ( if you played the other games then you did!!). 

The setting stage for this entertainment piece of software, its  a kind of "Cold War" roller coaster were you are a hero strangled  between past and future, and in the present(s) of both past and future. You will have to find a way to correct the past (Cold War), so that your future (Post Apocaliptic Cold War) will turn out great and then your present (Today i hope) will be fine! which makes this plot kind of messy!

The Soviets antagonists are the  "Rambo III movie" type: super heavy accent, shoot to miss first, and ask no questions later, well... 'cause they haven't got any! 

The game is linear , but the annoying kind of linear, like you can't jump over a rock with the height of your knees, invisible barriers and debris who push you away from interesting sets. Mid game allies also are the only ones who can open certain doors. The soldier enemies have a set clock agenda to when to strike, some rush and then stay... and stay, until they are gun down!

The female ally is a rip-off of Alyx from Half-Life 2, only eastern european, the doctor is the typical unconscious scientist (seen many times in James Bond Movies and Mission Impossible 2) who never thought the thing he created could possibly mess the world more than the Cold War itself! He gives a task and there you go, all the time, all the game.

Were this game excels:

The TMD - AKA "the mechanical plasmid"- that lets you control time, degrades boxes, electrical boxes and turn humans into monsters later on. Visually and graphic wise its very impressive when you turn a oxidated torn apart train to its ancient glory.

The Monsters - AKA "the soviet splicers/necromorphs" - hyper deformed former soldiers and habitants of the isle, who are agressive and fight in packs (sometimes), some have nice "powers". The mini bosses are tough and challenging. 

The Seeker Rifle - AKA " Curved bullet Wanted movie ability in a stick" - the description speaks for it self, slow pace bullet in slow time.
 
The Ending- 3 possible endings! 


Were is not very good:

The setting - Cold War? Seriously!?  

The sounds - Soldiers have only 3 phrases, they speak 2 and repeat the last one until their deaths or yours, and in every room there is a sound for every a balcony bell, for dead phones and typewriters, wich make no difference in the game or plot wise 

Visually - The graphics, seem rushed and random there are glitches, the hero has a tendency to get stuck.

The upgrade TMD\Hero\Weapons system - only 10 - 30 % of upgrades  are actually usefull, the others are thrown just to keep you occupied.

The Endings - the endings could be something epic, but its disappointing, because in the 3 possible ending its focus in the same mistake, when the solution which is quite obvious its ignored... some say its on purpose because a sequel was in the works for this game... still very bad choice!


Not worth to buy, but reasonable to play, if only to use the TMD

11232036.review:
J'avais voulu acquérir Singularity depuis longtemps. Au final, je n'ai absolument pas été déçu. Très joli graphiquement, c'est un jeu à l'ambiance post-apocalyptique pas trop lourde, qui fait un peu penser à un STALKER. Sauf qu'ici, le scénario, qui part d'un paradoxe spatio-temporel causé par le personnage principal, est bien pensé sans être trop original. Les adeptes de FPS assez brutaux y trouveront leur compte sans problème, tandis que ceux qui apprécient l'ambiance " russo-soviet " plongeront avec plaisir dans un monde iconique et très science-fiction.
L'issue de la partie se devine assez vite avec un peu d'observation. Néanmoins, si le scénario est très linéaire et l'issue inévitable, les opportunités finales sont, paradoxalement, assez importantes. J'ai deviné pas moins de quatre fins radicalement différentes possibles. Pour résumer :

Bons points : joli, musclé, intéressant, bonne ambiance, fin ouverte
Points décevants : linéaire, court (8h)
Adeptes visés : FPS musclés, soviétiques, histoires de voyage dans le temps

11098231.review:
Veľmi veľké prekvapenie. Zpočiatku som bol trocha skeptický, keďže hra mi pripadala ako kopírka Bioshocku. Uzavretý priestor, dychvyrážajúci vstup na miesto, light RPG prvky, nahrávky voľne pohodené po zemi. Ani akcia zpočiatku nebola ničím zaujímavá, no s príchodom TMD na scénu a prvými peripetiami spojenými s cestovaním v čase sa situácia otáča a hra drží a nepustí. TMD má kopu zaujímavých funkcií, ktoré spôsobia na bojisku hotové peklo. V kombinácii so zaujímavými zbraňami (Seeker, WSAD navádzaný granátomet) ide o veľmi zábavnú FPS. Komu je blízka téma cestovania v čase, tak ho určite poteší príbeh, ktorý má tri rôzne ukončenia, z ktorých žiadne nie je vyslovene dobré, čo veľmi oceňujem. Medzi mínusy by som zaradil kratšiu hernú dobu (cca 7,5 hodiny na najvyššej obtiažnosti), miestami slabšiu grafickú stránku (v niektorých častiach zasa exceluje), nevýraznú hudbu a absenciu tituliek.
V každom prípade o solídnu FPS, ktorá si zaslúži vašu pozornosť. Ak sa hra objaví v najbližšom výpredaji, alebo v samostatnej akcii, tj. okolo 5€, tak určite neváhajte.
P.S. Škoda, že hra bola komerčný prepadák a tým pádom sú šance na pokračovanie mŕtve.

11073382.review:
Od daty premiery Singularity chciałem w nią zagrać, bo zawiera pewne niuanse których w grach wcześniej jeszcze nie widziałem.
Od teraz kiedy była w promocji, kupiłem bez wahania i się nie zawiodłem.

Historia gry wciąga [spoiler alert], zawsze interesowały mnie aspekty ZSRR w przeszłości w sprawach nuklearnych i atomowych np. "Czarnobyl", lecz tu wprowadzony jest świat na wyspie Katorga-12, na której odnaleziono minerał E99 który przysłużył się powstaniu TMD (Time Machine Device) który jest znacznikiem gry, który wprowadza ten cały niuans.

Zamiana przedmiotów które są przesiączone minerałem E99, zamiana istnień stworów żywych na martwe, tzw. zestarzenie ich, przerzucanie tych przedmiotów (coś jak np. Gravity Gun w Half-Life 2), tworzenie tych zastopujących czas wygląda wręcz epicko, gdy strzela się w przeciwnika np. z karabinu snajperskiego proste dwa strzały prosto w głowę, a po zniknięciu rozpryska na wszystkie strony.

Trochę dziwne jest to, że jest mało broni a jest to gra firmy Activision którą znamy dzięki grom tj. serii Call of Duty.

Ogólna ocena?

Grafika: +
Ilość broni: + i - (minus z tego względu że mało, a plus z tego że są skuteczne)
Time Machine Device: +
Fabuła: +
Udźwiękowienie: +
Motywy: +
Napisy: - (największy błąd, brak napisów sprawia że czasem nie wiem co się dzieje)
Przeciwnicy: + (AI przeciwników na dobrym poziomie, lecz głos ruskich mnie denerwuje, bo mają nagrane 4 kwestie które się powtarzają w przeciągu 3 sekund)
Lokacje: +
Dubbing aktorów: + i - (czasem denerwujące głosy, sztuczne, ale ogólnie bardzo dobrze)

Gra na wysokim poziomie, tylko najprawdopodobniej martwa na multi-player, co jest smutne.

Ogólna ocena: 9,5/10

Warto zagrać, polecam.

11065700.review:
Finished the game in 11 hours, so it's not very long. Feels about as long as Bioshock 2. 
If you are a fan of HALF LIFE, this game also feels very influinced by it. 

Although the game feels like a mix of BioShock, Metro, Prey,  It stands on its own very well. 

It features game play that slowly takes you through the start, explains the story and builds to full on combat,  The sound design is top notch and should be played with headphones to experience all it has to offer. 
Creepy atmosphere to start, detailed world, time travel, ever changing environments, action, suspense, puzzles, killing, weapon upgrades and mods, lots of hidden items to find, good story, great sound design, smooth controls. It's a game you enjoy taking your time to explore and play. 
Yes, it's linear game play, but the design makes you forget about it. There are extra rooms and areas to explore to find money, ammo, health packs etc. 

The only CONS I can think of 

1. Too short Only about 12 hours
2. No trading Cards
3. No Mele combat abilities. 
4. Few weapons

It's a fun game and I enjoyed it so much I finished it in under 12 hours. Only a few gams have been able to suck me in to complete them and Singularity is one of them.

11059816.review:
Singularity is a really awesome game, which you could compare the most to FEAR in my opinion. It has a creepy atmosphere at the start and although the game focusses more on action overall it still has a dark and threatening atmopshere in some levels. Additional to that you also find notes and audiotapes throughout the game, which provides you with background information about Katorga 12.The developers made a good job to keep that time travel theme in your mind. During your journey you will see visions of former citizens of the island how they talked to eacxh other or you see the scene of their death.

The gameplay itself is pretty fun and besides the standard shooter weapons there are also some sci-fi guns like the Seeker, which allows you to control your bullets after a shot. The Singularity powers are also fun to use. I have to agree that there are not much of them, which gets compensated by the fact that every enemy reacts different to your aging ability and the "time sphere" can be used in an agressive or defensive way. 

In short I can say if you liked Bioshock and FEAR I think you will have fun with this game as well. And if you are concerned about the time in which Singualirty play you don't need to worry. The game is set in 2010, but you also make some short trips to 1955 and fight WW 2 Soviets.

11022464.review:
[u]Short Answer[/u]

Should you buy it - $30 is a little bit much for a four year old game but it is a good game and if you really like FPS's, Yes
Should you buy it on sale - Absolutely

[u]Long Answer[/u]

Singularity is a standard FPS with just a little bit more that sets it above the norm.

Visuals : The visuals in the game wont destroy your graphics card or anything but it does tax it a little bit. The scenery and set pieces look very nice, sometimes really pretty. There is no reuse of areas that I can tell ( aka same corridor syndrome ) and you will get a good feeling of progression ( you can visually see getting closer to your goal). The enemies look nice but dont change much in the looks area but at least you dont get the same guy but his time hes red! Overall - Good looking game that helps to visually immerse you into the world.

Story and Setting : (Spoiler Free) The setting is an Island off the coast of Russia that has some dirty little secrets and as a US special forces soldier you have to infiltrate the island and find out what is going on. As a base story it is just like most of the other FPS games out there but Singularity adds a nice twist on the basic formula that makes it feel new and refreshing. Overall - The story wont break the bank on amazing plots but it will engage you very well and help to keep you playing to find out what happens next.

Gameplay : This is were the game really sets itself above a normal FPS. It has a slight rpg feel with upgradeable weapons and skill selecting although neither is a game changer or breaker. It has good gun play and the powers that you use are fun and work well but what this game does really well is that it lets you play the way you want to. No, there is no stealth or anything like that, it is all action and if something is in your way it has to die but the game gives you incredible freedom on how it dies.   You can play and complete this entire game with nothing but guns or once you get your powers you can complete the entire game with those. It never limits you and it gives you plenty of ammo or easily throwable items no matter which way you want to play. Overall - The gameplay is great and gives you a great feel of freedom that never tells you how you should play it 

Replayability : While the story does give this game a little bit of replay ( you might want to play again just to see all the clues you didnt understand in the first playthrough ) and the gameplay lets you play it again in differnet ways, there is really no reason to play it more than a few times.

Personal overall enjoyment - This game was a good change of pace to me for normal FPS's. I enjoyed playing the game and was glad of the purchase I made. I will probably play it again sometime down the line and have no problem recommending it as a good game.

11021590.review:
Le pitch et les screens font penser à un FPS venu de l'Est et il pourrait effectivement trôner sur la même étagère que Metro 2033, celle qui est juste en dessous de S.T.A.L.K.E.R.

Singularity se parcourt agréablement.
Les armes sont efficaces même si toutes déjà vues. Deux armes pourront être choisies simultanément mais le jeu n'engage pas le joueur à se servir de celles-ci et, au final, les armes de début de jeu pourront se montrer les plus efficaces durant toute la durée de celui-ci.
Les pouvoirs sont sympathiques mais pas très originaux et ils sont surtout parfois prétexte à des puzzles redondants et peu imaginatifs, ce qui casse le rythme inutilement quasiment à chaque fois.

Le jeu ne délivre pas tout son potentiel dès le début et le joueur est récompensé par la suite d'avoir tenu un début pas forcément prometteur: Singularity devient de plus en plus agréable au fil de son avancée.

Visuellement, cela serait à rapprocher (du moins au niveau de la palette de couleurs et des décors en destruction) d'un Gears of War en beaucoup moins chiadé mais toutefois plus coloré (genre 2 ou 3 couleurs en plus dans la palette en fait, donc 5/6 au total). Bref, tant qu'on est pas trop regardant dans les détails ou qu'on ne commence pas à faire les fonds de décor, ça passe plutôt bien.

Le scénario ne casse pas des briques non plus mais donne suffisamment envie d'avancer pour connaître la suite. Le développement de celui-ci par les enregistrements audio est par contre assez rébarbatif (et pas aidé par la VF d'ailleurs) et souvent franchement mal amené (bon déjà est-ce-que c'est crédible d'enregistrer chacune de ces actions sur magnétophone dans l'espoir qu'un sauveur de l'humanité en ait besoin un jour? Mais le débat philosophique et social n'a pas lieu ici).

Malgré cette pléthore de défauts , Singularity diffuse tout au long de son aventure (assez courte : 6/7h) un parfum old-shool et assez de plaisir pour en faire un jeu plutôt sympa qui, il est vrai, s'oubliera certainement bien vite.

I'd say that Singularity is underrated considering I've not heard much about it; I decided to buy it during the summer sale.  It took me about 8 hours to complete and I enjoyed the gameplay. I was probably about two hours in before the game picked up so if you're feeling bored at first, don't be too discouraged to continue on. You're given the Time Distortion Device and are able to upgrade it throughout the game. The TMD lets you solve puzzles and perform combination attacks on enemies. The combat was fun and the boss fights were also fun; you're given at least a couple options for killing things so it is entertaining in that aspect. There are notes to read and audio logs to listen to throughout the game that will help fill in the story.

I enjoyed the audio and the graphics were decent but consider that this game was made in 2010 so the visuals aren't just awesome. There is no anti-aliasing setting in the game's options but you can simply override that in the NVIDIA Control Panel and it should work. I likely won't replay the game since I read everything the first time through, but it was worth the sale price.

10908437.review:
'Singularity' is an action FPS which delivers not only a satisfying experience in terms of atmosphere and visceral combat but also tries to spice things up with a few gimmicks. These gimmicks mostly revolve around time and gravity manipulation mixed in with an above standard FPS-shooting experience.

Most of what 'Singularity' has to offers has been seen in different games: the package here is just a variation based on known ingredients. I might be reading too much into this, but I believe one could make a drinking game out of all the reference/homages/rip-offs presented. FEAR, Dead Space, Bioshock 1 and Clive Barker's Jericho all seem to get, at the very least, a tip of the hat. I also saw some of Half-Life 2, Resident Evil and even a little bit of Silent Hill (with walls ageing as you pass by) and Portal (in the form of the blue and orange slider to age or revert objects). Even the spectral plants reminded me of Final Fantasy – Spirits within, but that might be pushing it a bit. 
Anyway, in my book, these references do not diminish the game. Just don't expect anything ground-breaking here. The most original aspect of 'Singularity', to me, came in the form of the grenade-launcher, which uses a rolling and jumping remote controlled brightly orange ordnance. Not very effective, but quite entertaining. 

What really worked for me was the atmosphere of the game. I enjoyed the slower parts, but I was also in the mood for it: I didn't expect balls to the walls action all the time. I let the game set its hooks into me and do its schtick. The environments really helped in that regard, with pleasing aesthetics and exploration worthy level-design. 
Still, I'm not too sure about the overall tone of the game. Granted, with that many references, it must be hard to keep a semblance of coherence. What I mean by disturbing changes in tonality is going from tense and oppressing almost survival-horror experiences to flat-out drawn-out stand-off fire-fights against dozens of enemies. Or jumping the shark with an giant boss battle, for little to no reason. Sure, it was very impressive and entertaining but it also seemed completely out of place. I guess 'Singularity' is like a blended mix: a smooth experience overall but with some chunks here and there. 

Since the story revolves around time travel and time manipulation you should expect a convoluted mess plot-wise. If you thought Bioshock Infinite's was headache inducing and lacking in basic sense, then be ready for the plot of 'Singularity'! I'm just gonna say it but, by the end, the story doesn't really make sense. It tries, and it helps to think about it in terms of “constants and variables” but that still leaves a whole bunch of plot holes to fill. Regardless, it didn't really bother me since I did enjoy trying to wrap my head around the story and tried to figure it out. And while the endings did not offering the best of explanations, they still managed to reach a satisfying conclusion, and even offer some options for the player.  

But the strongest part of the game is the combat. With a decent arsenal and a bunch of gimmicks, not to mention the environmental kills, the player is really spoiled for choice. Ageing an enemy ; turning him into a zombie so he will attack his former friends ; creating a time bubble as a shield for the player, or a trap for the enemies ; using melee energy waves ; sniping in slow-motion ; using guided missiles or bullets ; rolling grenades around corners ; burning, freezing or exploding enemies with different barrels ; or just shooting them with rifles, shotguns, railguns, gatling-guns ; etc. are some (most?) of the options at your disposal. It helps that there is a decent variation of enemies, -ready victims for your tools-, and that the impacts of bullets is quite satisfying. That their limbs don't seem to attached to their bodies also helps, as do their death animations. The game has a little bit of gore going for it. And on top of that, you have character perks and upgrades as well as limited weapons upgrades to round things up and tune the action to your affinities. 

Still, this doesn't mean that the game is without flaws. With such destructive power literally at the fingertips of the player, the game could stand to be a little bit more challenging. By being careful, you will avoid most deaths, and apart from the suicide-spiders (are those floods? Did I miss a Halo reference?), the enemies are manageable.  
The run time of the game is decent, but I would have liked a bit more. To give you an idea, it took me less then 10 hours for my first playthrough on hard, and less then 5 for the second one, also on hard.
Also, the video game logic present here can be quite silly: going back in time to change the present is fine, doing so to get a box in the past to use as a stepladder in the present is lazy. Still, when one wields a hammer, everything looks like a nail, so if you have a device that can bend time and space on your hand... Yeah...
Finally, on both playthroughs, one of the NPC glitched as he was in the middle of some explanation and, while it didn't break the game or anything, the exposition would have been nice to hear. Still, as it was rather obvious, so I just looked up the completed scene on the internetz. 

In conclusion, when all is said and done, I'm really glad to have bought and played 'Singularity'. It's a safe yet entertaining experience. It is worth your time, if there is a steam-sale for it, grab it if you like those kind of games. While perhaps lacking in intuitive controls at the begin, with all the different abilities you can use, it is still a game that I will launch from time to time, like the first FEAR actually.

10868353.review:
0.- Introducción:

Singularity es un videojuego de acción en primera persona con toques de terror desarrollado por Raven Software (creadores de Quake 4 y Wolfenstein) y editado por Activision. Fue  publicado el 25 de junio de 2010 sin apenas promoción.


1.- Historia:

Durante la Guerra Fría entre Estados Unidos y la antigua URSS, Stalin mandó a buscar uranio en una pequeña isla en la costa sudeste de la Unión Soviética. Allí los ingenieros rusos encontraron un nuevo material el llamado E99. 

El E99 es un potente mineral con una enorme energía, para ello Stalin concede fondos ilimitados para la investigación de este nuevo mineral con pretensiones de iniciar una guerra contra EEUU y así dominar el mundo.

Cuando Lenin sucede a Stalin, este manda a experimentar con el E99. Pero el E99 es un mineral muy volátil por lo que se produjo una catástrofe que acabó con la planta de investigación de Katorga-12 fundada en la isla. 

Ya en 2010 la radiación inutiliza un satélite espía americano. El pentágono manda una misión de reconocimiento sobre la zona por miedo a un nuevo Chernobyl.

La historia irá avanzando según avancemos en el juego y además con grabaciones que iremos encontrando de la gente (al estilo Bioshock, el famoso juego de Irrational Games).


2.- Jugabilidad:

Todo gira alrededor del DMT, un arma desarrollada a partir del E99 capaz de manejar el tiempo. Podremos ir mejorándolo poco a poco con máquinas para tal fin. Con este arma podremos realizar ondas de energía, ralentizar enemigos, matarlos directamente, etc. No sólo lo podremos utilizar en combate sino que además será una parte fundamental para realizar puzles. El DMT gasta energía que iremos encontrando durante los distintos escenarios.

Hay una gran diversidad de armas tanto las típicas como son la escopeta, fusil de asalto, rifle francotirador, lanzagranadas, etc. Y además dispondremos de una serie de armas que utilizan el E99 con las que por ejemplo podremos dirigir las balas. Para cambiar de armas podremos recoger las que encontremos o también podremos cambiarlas en unas máquinas de armamento y comprar munición.

A toda esta variedad de armamento hay que sumar que podremos mejorar cada arma mediante unos maletines de mejora que tendremos que buscar en los escenarios. Podremos mejorar ciertas mejoras del DMT, de tu estado físico y de tu habilidad como soldado con el E99 que iremos encontrando.

Hay una variedad de enemigos que podríamos clasificar en infectados por la radiación y los soldados soviéticos. Iremos alternando zonas de unos enemigos y de otros, e incluso habrá zonas en las que están peleándose entre ellos. Cada uno de ellos tiene su propia forma de atacar y una habilidad especial.

En los escenarios podremos encontrar munición, botiquines, E99 y por último las ya dichas mejoras de armas que se encuentran más escondidas.

Disponemos de tres niveles de dificultad (fácil, normal y difícil) y de varios finales distintos dependiendo de nuestras elecciones. Además tiene un multijugador, aunque actualmente no hay nadie.

Por poner alguna pega a este apartado es que hay munición por todos lados. Es difícil que te quedes sin munición. También que la dificultad de los enemigos está un poco mal medida ya que el enemigo más insignificante es el que más problemas puede dar sin ninguna duda.


3.- Apartado gráfico:

Singularity utiliza Unreal Engine que obviamente es potente pero se nota que le falta algo más. Los escenarios destruidos por la catástrofe están muy bien recreados, y la atmosfera es opresiva. Sin ninguna duda el juego está muy optimizado y es algo de admirar.


4.- Apartado sonoro:

Los efectos y las melodías cumplen muy bien. Además viene doblado al español con unas muy buenas voces.


5.- Conclusión:

Singularity es un gran juego que bebe mucho de Bioshock, Metro 2033 o incluso Half Life 2. Tiene mucha acción frenética y con una trama bastante buena. Es un gran olvidado por la poca promoción que se le dio pero que bien merece nuestra atención ya que es un título único y que merece ser jugado. La duración de este título no es muy larga alrededor de 9 horas depende de cómo juegues.

I love time travel stories - and this delivers!

*minor spoilers*

Yes, it is very linear. Yes, the story is not *that* original. And yes, in normal difficulty the game throws medipacks and ammo at you continously so that you never need to worry. There are some easy-to-solve switch puzzles that make for rather quiet situations, followed by explosive killfests with mangled bodies flying around. The weapons are awesome, especially the "experimental" stuff like the steerable bullet that make your targets explode in a fountain of flesh and blood. Very satisfying :)

Although the story isn't outstanding, it is brilliantly told! Scripted events, explosions, dialogues, story twists... the Half Life-Formula is working great. The level design is good enough to let you dive into the world - which is disturbed by invisible walls you often walk into. 

Overall I was entertained from start to end - and that is what I want when I play a science fiction FPS ;)

10716796.review:
Клюквенную кашку в начале Холодной войны заварил СССР, откопав на каком-то таинственном острове новый элемент — Е99. Находка грозила обеспечить Союзу невероятный прорыв чуть ли не во всех отраслях и серьезное превосходство над США с их жалким ядерным оружием. Естественно, совсем скоро дело пошло не по плану, и безалаберные russian работяги Каторги-12 (именно так называлось прекрасное место, где исследовали Е99) все поломали, взорвали и уничтожили, а правительство СССР быстренько свернуло лавочку.

Все было тихо и мирно, пока американские спутники в 2010 году не зафиксировали радиоактивный выброс посреди Охотского моря. Разбираться отправили несколько коммандос, но «разведка облажалась» — на месте их поджидал ЭМ-удар, уронивший отряд, в составе которого был и наш герой, прямо на злополучный остров.

Очнувшись, Нэтан Рэнко обнаруживает себя у врат Каторги-12, откуда и начинается его долгий путь по выставке лучших идей создателей BioShock, Half-Life 2, F.E.A.R., Portal, Timeshift, Dead Space… Raven Software без всякого стеснения позаимствовала целый воз чужих наработок, за что, впрочем, винить студию совсем не хочется, уж больно ладно она эти наработки скроила.

Нахватав чужих идей и добавив немножко от себя, «вороны» сварганили хороший боевик старой закваски. В Singularity есть все, что нужно для развлечения жарким летним днем: дробовик, монстры, стремительно развивающийся и не обременяющий мозг сюжет, зрелищные сценки, большие «боссы» и подгружающий прямо у вас под носом текстуры Unreal Engine 3.

10680672.review: Although fairly predictable and unclear or non-specific in places, the storyline was still quite good and the gameplay has some very fun quirks on top of a traditional fps feel. Worth playing through once for the experience, and worth the money if it's on sale. But the multiplayer is now devoid of any players so I will likely uninstall it now that I have finished it.

10650783.review:
Wanna find out what happens when Half Life 2 meets Call of Duty? Raven Soft did.

Pros 
- Legitimate Time Travel Plot
- Secrets throughout the game
- Dead Space style upgrade terminals for weapons and character
- Optimized very well
- Immersive
- TMD is useful
- Good characters that are for the most part fleshed out
- Puzzle Gimmicks
- Fun Boss fights
- Multiple Endings
- Time Stop/Slow-Mo Gimmick

Cons 
- Generic Russian Enemies
- Hardest Difficulties make the enemies feel like sponges
- Felt very short
- Press F and the puzzles are gone
- Lack of control and ingame video options

Not going to lie to you guys. This is a gem, a true gem. One of the best shooters from "Last Gen" and I am glad it was Raven Soft that  brought it to us, too bad the game is so short. The game itself revolves around the main character polluting the past and corrupting the future, obviously for spoiler reasons I won't say anymore about the story other than that. One of the biggest draws for me was the secrets. The secrets in this game feel very much like Bioshock. The customization reminds me so much of Dead Space, both of these, the secrets and customization, are NOT complaints. This game also has puzzles much like in Half Life 2 and the games special tool, the TMD (Time Manipulation Device) is used to solve many of them, this does lead into one of my biggest complaints about the game, when you press F the TMD displays foot prints on where to go next if you are lost, while nice, this ability has no drawbacks to prevent you from constantly using it, basically trivilizing one of the gimmicks this game has to offer just by pressing F. Pressing F also leads into my next point, control options and video options. This game has basically none of either, you can change a few basic controls but things like reloading are tied into the USE button as well, so things get very confusing, very quickly. Lastly, I would like to talk about general game design. In terms of actual character design and appearence everyone felt very generic, this is actually a bit ok though as the story itself is a big enough draw to keep you going, rather than the characters, who themselves have great personalities, just terrible designs. In terms of boss design, the few bosses this game has are fucking sweet, they all are very different and they are really fun, one of the ones in mid game felt very unique, I won't spoil it, but it involves a train. 

10/10 - Despite the flaws, most specifically its length, the unique story, gameplay, and the time travel gimmicks help keep this game at the top of my list, I highly recommend this to lots of people, not very often a give a game a 10!

10625372.review:
Estamos en época de exámenes, y como todos sabéis, cualquier cosa es buena antes que tirarse toda la tarde estudiando encerrado en tu habitación adquiriendo el denominado "Moreno Flexo" también conocido como "Amarillo radioactivo". Así que, como no tengo mas ganas de estudiar, y recientemente me acabo de pasar un juego, voy a hablaros de él.

Singularity es un juego creado por el estudio Activision (si, los creadores de Call Of Duty). Sinceramente nunca me ha llamado la atención este juego, pero tras escuchar a Teo Merchán hablar una y otra vez de él y gracias a una rebaja muy jugosa en Steam pues decidí comprármelo. 

El juego tiene lugar en 2010, la linea del juego se reduce a hacer una expedición a una isla en Rusia, ya que un pico de radiación ha desabilitado un satélite americano, aunque despues todo va a adquirir un tono mucho más interesante. Como no quiero entrar en muchos detalles para hacer spoiler voy a ir al ajo. El juego en si, es un shooter no muy sobresaliente, teniendo en cuenta que está hecho en 2010, puedo decir que las animaciones pueden parecer un poco toscas, pero cuando llevas un tiempo jugando a el te acostumbras. A nivel argumental he de decir que tiene un punto muy interesante, que es lo que me atrajo para jugarlo. Y es que la acción, aunque transcurre siempre en esa isla, se va a dividir en dos momentos históricos diferentes, si, vas a jugar en épocas diferentes. Y esto es lo mas interesante de todo porque claro, cualquier intervención tuya en una época pasada tendrá sus repercusiones en el presente.

Si bien ese es el punto fuerte del juego, también tiene sus contras, la linea argumental es un poco simplona, pudiendo haber sido mucho más elaborada y jugando con ese pasado/presente y metiendo guiños de una época a otro y que el jugador tuviese constancia de ello. A falta de esto ¿que hicieron? meter momentos de Survival Horror, con algunos momentos interesantes, pero bueno, el hecho de tener una escopeta en las manos le quita tensión al asunto. Siendo realistas intentó hacer lo mismo que un juego de 2007 llamado TimeShift, y sinceramente, lo ha superado con creces, haciendo tanto la trama, los saltos temporales y los efectos producidos tras ellos mucho más vistosos y coherentes que su predecesor. 

¿Lo recomendaría? Si, es un juego entretenido, cortito, con lo cual no se te va a hacer muy pesado, y ver como cambias el curso de la historia viajando al pasado siempre es interesante. Así que si estas de exámenes y buscas un juego con el que poder jugar unos 20 minutos para relajar y después seguir estudiando, te lo recomiendo, puede ser desestresante.

10438546.review:
Cuando comencé con Singularity me pareció un FPS del montón, un clon más o menos decente de Bioshock aunque pasillero, repetitivo y sin alicientes... pero la verdad es que tras una hora se me hizo muy entretenido.

El juego combina muy bien las virtudes de Bioshock (la forma de contar la historia, variedad de armas, poderes secundarios) con detalles más típicos de un Castle Wolfenstein por el tema nazi-rusos y la estética general, aunque es pasillero no te sientes más limitado que en cualquier otro FPS y el desarrollo de la trama se hace muy ameno, la historia se va desarrollando mediante animaciones con el motor gráfico del juego y notas de audio y texto que vas encontrando. El uso de la física diría que es su punto fuerte, tan importante como en el propio Half Life 2, pudiendo controlar el tiempo da muchísimo juego para abrirnos paso hasta el final. Los enemigos no presentan ningún reto y casi siempre mueren de un tiro pero como FPS cumple con un arsenal variado, posibilidad de mejorar las armas y se hace divertido acabar con un pelotón en segundos gracias a la combinación de las armas con los poderes.

En definitiva, no es un juego de 10 pero está bastante por encima de la media y da para unas horas muy entretenidas.

10393126.review:
Proč bojovat o lepší budoucnost, když můžeme změnit minulost?

Na malém ostrově na východě Ruska byl nalezen nový prvek. Prvek, jehož moc překoná i sílu atomu. Co jsou ale soudruzi schopni obetovat pro odhalení plného potenciálu prvku E99? Každý pokrok má přeci svou cenu.

Vydejte se v roli člena speciálních sil prozkoumat ostrov a odhalte jeho tajemství.

Singularity je lineární FPS, která po grafické stránce dnes už neohromí, ale obsahuje mechaniky, které nejsou v žánru akčních her zrovna běžné. 
Zpočátku se jedná o nezajímavou střílečku, jak ale postupujete hrou, zpřístupňují se vám nové schopnosti, zajímavé zbraně (hra obsahující rotační kulomet přece nemůže být špatná :)) a hlavně manipulace s časem. Právě schopnost ovládání času a velmi dobrý příběh na tom založený, posouvá Singularity za hranice průměrnosti.

Potěší možost volby konce hry, easter eggy, dobrovolná stealth pasáž a starý dobrý časový paradox.
Hra obsahuje i MultiPlayer, ale ten je vzhledem ke stáří hry už totálně mrtvý.

Singularity je prostě jednohubka, kterou by si měl vychutnat každý milovník akční řežby.

10358519.review:
Singularity é mais um daqueles "jogos subestimados", um jogo que me merecia muito mais atenção do que teve, infelizmente acabou meio que caindo no esquecimento.

 Ele é desenvolvido pela Raven Software, empresa consagrada por ótimos jogos, posso citar Hexen 2 (jogo que me marcou muito), Star Wars Jedi Academy (pode pesquisar, esse é um dos melhores games baseados em Star Wars junto Knights of the Old Republic e Republic Commando) e também Quake 4 (deixa um pouco a desejar, mas ainda assim é um jogo bom, eu fiz análise dele).

 Posso considerar Singularity como "o Darksiders dos FPS", aí você vai me perguntar "mas porque isso Caio ?", é simples: assim como Darksiders, Singularity mistura elementos vistos em vários jogos, mas consegue ter identidade própria e ser competente em diversos aspectos, você vai notar algumas semelhanças com alguns jogos da própria Raven como o Quake 4, e também jogos de outras empresas como Bioshock, Half Life, Twin Sector entre outros.

JOGABILIDADE

 Bastante agradável, no início levei alguns minutos a me acostumar com os comandos mas logo peguei o jeito, conforme você ganha mais habilidades o jogo se torna mais interessante pelas diversas combinações e estratégias que você pode usar, essa é justamente a parte divertida do jogo, o que torna ele prazeroso.

ENREDO

 Não sou acostumado a falar de enredos de jogos pois realmente não é o que me atrai mais, porém em Singularity realmente vale apena prestar atenção na história. Não vou citar sinopse ou coisas do tipo, pois isso tem até na descrição do jogo, o que posso adiantar é que o jogo possui um enredo bem interessante e intrigante, o jogo possui três finais, e pelo menos pra mim dois dos finais são do tipo "Mindblow" (aqueles finais com uma surpresa muito grande que te deixa intrigado e pensando horas sobre ele). A história é contada de mais de uma forma, além de cutscenes, também há a influencia de Bioshock, com Flashbacks e audios que você encontra durante o jogo. Só para concluir, um dos finais (que foi o meu primeiro) deixa a possibilidade de uma continuação, algo que seria ótimo.

VISUAIS

 É aí que vem a reclamação, não é exatamente de gráficos que falo, mas o que  deixa a desejar mesmo foi a direção de arte, o design dos inimigos tanto monstros quanto humanos é legal, mas as cores do jogo não são em totalidade agradáveis para o olhar, é algo que não sei explicar, eu tive o mesmo desconforto visual que tive com o jogo The Chronicles of Riddick Assault on Dark Athena. Por volta de 2008 teve uma moda das desenvolvedoras utilizarem esse visual cinzento nos jogos, talvez para querer transpor de certa forma melancolia, ou "realismo", particularmente não gosto dessa mania não.

FALANDO UM POUCO SOBRE ALGUMAS MECANICAS DE JOGO

Você tem uma luva, que faz diversas coisas, como alterar o estado temporal de alguns objetos, criar campos de força, dá um impulso que joga os inimigos longe e tambem uso de telecinésia como a Gravity Gun de Half Life, essa luva é o a coisa mais legal de Singularity. As armas também são ótimas e com certeza devem lhe agradar, principalmente se você está acostumado com FPS Old-School como eu. Mais alguns pontos que acho importante citar: O jogo possui alguns puzzles (alguns são legais outros não tem nada de especial) e os BOSS são excelentes.

CONCLUSÃO

Fãs de FPS que estão a procura de um bom modo história, encontrarão em Singularity

Game has multiple plot holes which can easily be explained away by the fact that time travel in this game is dependent on the element E-99. If a subject (living or not) does not have any amount of E-99, then time changes upon said subject is nil.

Now, depending on the amount of E-99 in a subject (we are talking particles here), then the more "powerful" the time changes is on the subject.

That's a big premise to the game. You just can age or make new every and any thing in the game. Graphics are fine. Weapons are nice. You can upgrade your weapons, your time manipulation device, and Renko, which you play as.

Story is...meh. Multiple endings. Missing one in my opinion.

10268443.review:
Singularity es uno de esos juegos que, en mi opinión, son tachados de "mediocres" o "no tan buenos" de manera prematura. 

Para mi es un juego con una historia bastante interesante, que aunque tiene algunas lagunillas por en medio y en los tres posibles finales, se sostiene muy bien.

En cuanto a jugabilidad, mecánicas, etc, es un juego de disparos en primera persona bastante estándar, con diseños de armas retrofuturistas bastante originales. A parte de eso, la integración del DMT y el juego que te da a la hora de enfrentarte a los enemigos hace que cuentes con una decente variedad de alternativas al "disparar a todo lo que se mueva".

La ambientación está muy cuidada. En cada escenario que entras llegas a tener esa sensación de "parece real". La música y los efectos de sonido también están en consonancia, y te ayudan a ese sentimiento de inmersión.

Los gráficos... normales. Está bien teniendo en cuenta el año en que salió el juego, y bueno... siempre me preguntaré por qué las empresas desarrolladoras no cuidan más las texturas, pero eso es salirse del tema.

Algo que me gustó del juego es que sabe equilibrar los momentos en los que te conviene que no te vean y debes ir con cuidado, con los momentos heroicos en los que debes atravesar largas distancias corriendo y disparando a todo lo que se mueve para salvar el día, sin olvidarse tampoco de las situaciones en las que la cobertura táctica te puede salvar el pellejo.

Para mi este juego vale la pena.

Teniendo en cuenta todo lo arriba descrito, yo le daría un 7/10.

10225118.review:
Singularity is a First-Person Shooter made by Raven Software, it is designed in a similar vein to games like the Bioshock series.. There's very light RPG elements, and a fair amount of story, much of which is told through audiologs spread throughout the world.

Gameplay wise, Singularity plays like most modern FPS titles, with a few minor exceptions. For the most part, you'll only be able to carry two weapons. On the otherhand, outside of some of the upgrades you can buy, there's no regenerating health, meaning you'll have be on the lookout for health packs throughout the world. The level design consists of your fairly standard corridors with enemies with the occasional larger arena designed for combat. The game decently rewards exploration, with E99 Tech (the games currency for upgrading weapons/your character), health packs and ammo and audiologs. Asides from the standard running and gunning, you'll also find yourself solving a puzzle every so often, those these are mostly straight-forward, and shouldn't cause much trouble. From a gameplay standpont, the big gimmick is the TMD, or the time manipulation device. As you might guess, it is a device that allows you to maniuplate time in a multitude of ways. The main ability of the TMD is being able to age certain objects. A broken stair-case can be sent back to a time where it was no longer broken etc. Enemies can also be aged, slowing them, damaging them or in some cases outright killing them. This mechanic is cool, but I found it to be under-utilized in the game. Most of the time you'll simply be reparing a stair-case or similar thing, and then continuing on your way. While the combat implications are interesting, the resource cost of being able to age enemies way too high for me to justify using in most combat scenarios. In additon to the TMD's aging abilities, you get a half-life 2 style gravity gun, where you'll be able to pick up barrels and what not to throw at enemies, and finally you have the ability to create spheres where time is slowed down. It's a cool mechanic, that spices up the combat of the game. The weapons in the game are mostly your standard fair, you have your pistol, shotgun, automatic rifle etc. There's a few more interesting weapons, one weapon allows you to control the bullet midfliight, and another creates a ball that you can control directly, but these are mostly gimmicks that you won't use more than once or twice. After I got the Autocannon, I probably used that weapon 90% of the rest of the game. Enemy design is decent, with a fair amount of different ranged and melee attackers. There's a few boss fights, but they usually boil down to shoot the glowy spots on the enemy. There's an upgrade system for both your character and weapons, but these systems felt mostly inconsequential, outside of increasing my max hp. In the end, Singularity is a short (I clocked in at a bit less that 5 and a half hours), but solid FPS with some sorely underutilized mechanics that could of made the game amazing.

Story wise, Singularity takes places in an alternate history world where the Soviet Union rises to power by utilizing an element known as E99. It is your job to to set the worlds time-line straight. The story utilizes standard time travel tropes decently enough, and the twist at the end is done well. The audiologs and flash-back scenes do a good job at creating an interesitng world. In the end, it's not the most orginial story, but it kept me interested and entertained until the end.

Raven created a decent enough game, that's well worth buying at 5-10$. However in the end, Singularity is no Bioshock, and I would say it's not even as good as their earlier Wolfenstien title.

10162490.review:
Singularity is a quality, fairly short blast of silliness. It aspires to be comparable to 'Bioshock', a worthy aim that it comes admirably close to fulfilling. 

Although Gamespot said that the game's visuals were a little lacking (their overall review was positive, giving it 8/10, and a 'Great') I thought the environments were pretty awesome. Highlights for me were when you saw a location in the present, only to be flung back in time 50 years, to see the same place in all its shiny freshness. I was surprised that they didn't actually do this more often in the game really. Another iteration of this visual effect was walking though a ship where sudden time-pulses would age it, as you stumbled onward. A wall of rust and corrosion would move like a wave over every surface, an original and interesting idea. 

Furthermore, the gunplay of the game was slick and satisfying, suffering from none of the 'sludginess' that some FPS's can have. Comparisons to that of 'Bioshock' are again tempting - the enemy body physics, the art design of the guns, the damage effects of your weapons: all were oddly similar. 

But there were more obvious similarities. For example, the character enhancement and gun customization elements seemed like brazen copies (perhaps I should say 'respectful homages'?) to the 'Bioshock' franchise. The 'secondary weapon' in your other hand (here, the so-called Time Manipulation Device, Singularity's answer to Plasmids) was identical! While these elements worked well, they were all ultimately a little limited because the game is so much shorter. 

As regards developing a credible 'alternative world' and engaging in deeper philosophical questions, Singularity only dabbled the fingers of its TMD-adorned-hand ever so slightly in these areas. Ultimately the game puts playability and humour first - think Red Alert crossed between Metro 2033, and you're warm - and there is never any shame in that.  

It's a short game - even if you're a thorough completionist, like me, it will still all be over in about 10 hours - but the price reflects this. The game offers a fun, silly and satisfying ride. 

There's no doubt that a Time Manipulation Device would be useful in reclaiming all those wasted hours frittered away on medicore games, but here at least it's time well spent!

10160469.review:
Okay. I am going to start this out by saying something: THIS IS A HORROR GAME.

I personally picked it up because I enjoy games with interesting twists, like using time in combat. Nowhere said that this game is scarey. It fucking is.

That said, lets review:

THE GOOD:
Time and combat work very well together, you can (once you get the right upgrades) slow/nearly stop time, blast people's legs, arms and heads off, age/reduce in age objects, people, and mutants, as well as shoot them up with a big ass shotgun, or whatever else you fancy.
If the game is meant to do horror, it does it well (for me), with various jumpscares that are very nicely implimented (ie. scare the shit out of you since you don't expect them), and the atmosphere is one of uncomfortable ruins.
The shooting works. You shoot people, if you shoot them enough, they die. The guns sound quite weak, which is normal for modern shooters, but people react to some extent when shot (especially with the shotgun)
Basic upgrade system for guns, with some customisation for your time powers, and various perks you can get.
New mechanics are added constantly through the game, so you never feel like your game is stagnating.
Although the game is completely linear in its story until the end (2 endings and a 'hidden' ending), there are plenty of areas to explore that can add 1-3 hours onto the game (its about 6 hours if you just follow the footsteps)

THE BAD
The plot is a little hard to follow at times, and there are some questions at the end I just want answering, and don't seem to be answered. I won't leave them here as they WILL spoil the game for you.
The AI is a little off. People with guns will generally either stay where they are (which is typically in the middle of a corridor with no cover) or just run to their set position and start firing. Mutants just run towards you on the shortest trajectory.
Not many bosses as such, only a couple of points where you meet more powerful mutants that are annoying to kill. To make up for that, you have a couple of timed RUN AWAY sequences. Yay.
One of the time powers is really annoying to set off, as it involves pressing the button for another power twice quickly, which rarely works. I guess this is probably a legacy from consoles, where you have about 8 buttons for everything.
The description on the store page isn't quite telling the truth. You do no 'travel seamlessly between 1955 and 2010'. The game pretty much orders you into a rift so you can go back in time, do something to alter the future, then go back into the present to carry on as normal. You don't get the choice of when you want to go back, you just have to.

The Ugly
The graphics are quickly aging, and not terribly gracefully.
Those mutants are not going to win any beauty contests any time soon.

Overall score: 74/100. If you like horror FPS games, pick it up, if not, then its probably for the best to leave it. I got it on sale and it was well worth the cost, even if it did leave me with a couple of nights when I regretted playing it in the evening.

10155203.review: Игра Singularity представляет собой фантастический шутер от первого лица, разработанный известной компанией Raven Software. 10139933.review:
Singularity is a visually engaging fps that does not try anything new.  The game is a good length, has a solid story, a hand-full of strong characters and a nice variety of combat.  The game undoubtedly feels like a side project but a finished one!  It  might not have the detail and love that one would expect in a CoD game, but I was impressed with Activision's ability to begin and end a story with the time that was given.

The game takes many ques from other games.  While Singularity might not bring anything new to the table, it does bring a well blended action fps for any gamer to enjoy.  Nothing is taken too far with this game.  There is a good number of different enemy types, but not so many that the player isn't able to learn how to combat them before the game is over.  Also, there are at least ten weapons to choose from -- most of which can be upgraded and changed out at weapon stations.

The "TMD" device that the player is given adds a shocking amount of combat options.  The different uses of weapons and "TMD" abilities with the added upgrading and leveling system could make for another good play-though -- maybe two.  Unfortunately, the fights are scripted, and that takes a bit from the replays.

Over all, the game gets a good review because it feels "humble."  It isn't a ground breaking or epic title, and it does not try to be.  The game gives the player a gripping intro, good progression and good old fashioned boss fights!  

Note: $30 would have been spot on the day this game came out.  Best bought on sale now.

10135359.review:
这游戏很不错，剧情方面大家已经讨论很多了，这里还是感慨一下，只要是穿越这题材，基本不会有“一般般，说得过去”的这种中庸评价，穿越剧，几乎就介于神作和雷作两个极端里，大家可以拿拿别的作品参考一下。
这里讨论一下游戏本身的素质，毕竟是Raven出品的：
1.不知道这游戏为什么还要出多人模式，现在也玩不了了。
2.血条设定，但是敌人还算平衡，熟悉你的技能，那样的话会轻松很多。
3.武器设定有点问题，当然考虑到单机的话也没啥了，但是结果就是很多武器你几乎不会去自虐用。
4.接上条，因为要贴合游戏设定所有武器都是架空的，样子帅不帅见仁见智了，个人觉得有种玩具枪的感觉。
5.武器箱和技能箱出现的频率很不科学，前期走半天找不到一个，后期两个箱子之间甚至没有出现过战斗，有点浪费。
6.流程里的解谜要素初期还是很让人眼前一亮的，但是很可惜后期有点敷衍了事。
7.解谜的时候游戏的物理引擎很奇葩，你经常会被箱子卡着一跳一跳的，不过所幸没有恶性bug。
所以总结一下，剧情满分，但是游戏系统拖了后腿，赶工货的感觉，但还是希望有续作推出啊。

10114697.review:
I awaited a bit long for a sale before buying this game; I must say that I shouldn't have awaited so long and just bought it at full price, because it worth it.

Around the internet you'll see some people comparing Singularity to Half-Life 2 and Bioshock, so I'll compare too, but I'll show what points those games has in common with Singularity, so you can form your own opinion.

[b] Story [/b]

You play as captain Nathaniel Renko, who comes to a misterious island called Katorga-12 after the military has received some signs of radiation while its radar was passing by the Eastern Russia; when you arrive at the island, it is a desolate place, abandoned long ago for unknown reasons, while some kind of military reasearch has gone completely wrong when the russians discovered a new element called E-99.

[b] Gameplay [/b]

Some people say that this desolated island has some resemblance with Bioshock's rapture or even Half-Life 2's City 17, because of the abandoned post-apocalyptic feel it has; but Katorga-12 has its own charm, you can think it as a second Chernobyl (if you played the Stalker series you'll know what I'm talking about). People who used to live there abandoned their normal lives for good, leaving papers on the tables, schools are full of children drawnings and kitchens are still filled with canned food and pots. It's a wonderful game, full of places to explore and learn about what happened in the island, and Singularity really rewards exploration, so please, don't rush while playing this game, take your time because you'll be rewarded with secrets that only the devs at Raven could have done so well. Most of the plot is explained by notes you find scattered around the buildings and audio logs. Some are well hidden, requiring even a bit of thinking before you can reach them, which I myself think it's just awesome. This is a feature that you'll find in Bioshock, but in Singularity I find it particularly better, because the voice acting is just perfect (at the beggining of the game you'll hear some audio logs made by the children themselves, trust me, it'll give you some chills). There is a couple more features that will bring Bioshock to mind, for instance the way you collect items in the game: you must interact with them pressing a key, only ammo you can actually pick up running above them; the health system isn't regenerative as in most shooters, you must collect aid packs to use later pressing another key, as with Bioshock. 

Singularity has kind of the same pace as Bioshock, that is having you searching the place for clues, secrets and items, then entering in some fire-fights. During the action scenes you can use a very well selected variety of weapons, and it doesn't limit itself with the everyday shotgun and machine gun: you have weapons that let you literaly guide the bullet, and even a grenade launcher that let you "drive" the grenade around the environment; even the usual sniper rifle has a feature that let you slow down time to aim well at your targets. Unlike in Bioshock, in Singularity you really feel the 'oomph' of the weapons, they aren't just pea shooters and the enemies aren't bullet sponges who just loves to break your immersion. I wouldn't call Singularity a shooter, because it has more to offer; but when you have to shoot somebody, it does well, with solid shooter mechanics, reload animations and weapon upgrades.

The main feature of the game is presented by the Time Manipulating Device, or TMD, which works as a glove that you wear in your left hand. With it, you can solve puzzles buy aging and renewing some objects, like crates, stairs and machinery. As you progress within that game, you can upgrade it with new powers, just like you do with the plasmids found in Bioshock, but as I said, Singularity has its own charm, it only takes inspiration in Bioshock, although sometimes I felt as it was the other way around, because everything Singularity does, it does better than Bioshock. These new powers let you launch pulse explosions, create bubbles that stops time within it, age enemies until they're just a pile of dust and manipulate objects just like the Gravity Gun (again, Half-Life 2).

Singularity has a total of three endings that conclude the narrative in three awesome and distinct ways, that you would finish in something like 8 hours or so.

[b] Sounds [/b]

Everything in this game sounds good: the voice acting, gun shots, explosions, the russian lines spoken by some enemies, the soundtrack that changes accordingly... It's everything well done.

[b] Technically [/b]

I saw some people saying it runs badly, but it is one of those games that was completely polished and well optimized; I could reach 120fps (it doesn't have fps limit as most games out there), and my PC is kind of mid range: i5 2400 3.10GHz, 8GB ram, Windows 7 64bits and a GTX650 1GB.

So, if you are the kind of gamer who likes plot oriented games, with a good shooting mechanics and full of out of the ordinary places to explore, just like Half-Life and Bioshock, you definitely should give SIngularity a go. But don't expect a rip off, because this game was well done, it has all of the Raven style that old gamers love and it's really one of its kind.

10109538.review:
Hab das Spiel im Sale für 5 Euro gekauft - hat sich definitiv ausgezahlt. 
Die Grafik ist schön, das Gameplay flüssig. Das Leveldesign ist sehr linear, da aber der Fokus eher auf Action als auf Erkundungen liegt stört das eigentlich nicht. Die Story ist spannend und durch die Zeitsprünge komplex. Wer darüber hinaus noch mehr erfahren will, kann das an in der Welt verteilten Audiotagebüchern und Notizen nachholen. Nebenbei wird das ganze noch durch kurze Rätsel aufgelockert um Hindernisse zu überwinden. 
Im Verlauf der Geschichte bekommt eine Maschiene auf den Arm geschnallt, mit der man die Zeit manipulieren, den Zustand von Gegenständen verändern und anderes nettes Zeug machen kann. Das ist gut gelungen, ich denke es hätten sich aber noch mehr Anwendugen gefunden. 
Fazit: Ein guter Mix aus Horror und Action-Shooter, der mit einer netten Story und Atmospähre besticht. Es hat Ähnlichkeiten mit Bioshock, nur ohne dessen speziellen Humor. Auf mittlerer Schwierigkeit in 8 Stunden durchgespielt.

10104451.review:
Довольно неплохая игра, напоминающая гибрид "Call of Duty 4: Modern Warfare" и "Bioshock". Интересный сюжет, завязанный на "Сингулярности", одной из особенностей которой является путешествие во времени при помощи приспособления под названием "МВП". Немного запутано? Так в игре все еще хуже, что, конечно же, большой плюс.

Также к достоинствам можно отнести приятную графику, но местами разработчики явно зажали полигоны; динамичная музыка, хорошо вписывающаяся в геймплей; встречаются несложные головоломки, связанные с "Сингулярностью" со всеми вытекающими последствиями. Кроме того, в игре вовремя сменяют друг друга перестрелки с людьми и жертвами того-что-вы-и-так-поняли. 

Если детально, то это шутер, где много оружия, которое улучшается по характеристикам, но нет кастомизации. Ранее упомянутое приспособление "МВП", сопровождающее нас практически все действие игры, дает большой выбор его использования, включая функции грави-пушки из той-самой-игры, но явно на этом не ограничиваясь (можно еще, например, поднять корабль со дна реки). Кстати, при первом прохождении, я не думал, что можно сделать свой "TimeShift" с бл... ну вы поняли. 

Не стоит забывать и про 3 концовки, которые можно открыть с интервалом в 5 минут, а как это сделать - узнаете сами в конце игры.

Одним словом, очень интереная игра, которая не отнимет у вас много времени (с обыском каждого угла весь процесс занял у меня 7 часов), но которую просто необходимо увидеть самому, пока "картинка" не стала слишком старой.

10081825.review:
[i]Итак,Сингулярность......Красочный и сочный экшен от издателей Ravensoft и Activision сделан очень необычно.Смешение яркого и жёсткого сюжета Quake с таким знакомым приевшимся движком Call Of Duty с добавлением улучшений текстур и беспричинной (типичной для Activision) агрессией по отношению к России.В этом сразу можно увидеть минус сюжета-злобные советские учёные разрабатывают способ путешествия во времени и создания супероружия для уничтожения США (кто бы сомневался...) на маленьком острове Каторга-12 на Дальнем Востоке матушки Руси.
Действие разворачивается параллельно в двух временных зонах:1955 и 2010-ые года.Персонаж-человек,который неким образом связан с событиями,приведшими к катострофе на острове.Случайно он меняет ход истории,и теперь в 2010-м году в мире появляется господствующая сверхдержава (Как вы думаете,какая?)Наша задача-вернуть правильный ход истории и остановить Insoviet Russia от контроля над техонологией для путешествий во времени....
Несмотря на некую абсурдность и приевшуюся банальность,сюжет принимается легко и просто на фоне прекрасно проработанного экшена.Уверен,ценители качества картинки смогут увидеть,что дизайн игры максимально проработан и разработчики вложили душу в этот небольшой проект.....
Игра на любителя,можно пройти за 2 дня,но процесс очень затягивает,остановиться очень сложно.Музыка-ни рыба,ни мясо,вполне подходящая для действа,но далеко не аховая.Боевая система-здравствуй,CoD,как будто и не прощались с MW2,хотя графически и с дополнением системы улучшения оружия и персонажа,а также устройства для манипуляции временным потоком,мы видим совершенно новый продукт,такой скачок вперёд для издателя,что не может не радовать наш глаз.
Цена для игры,конечно,СЛИШКОМ уж большая,брать следует только по скидке,но если вам не жалко в очередной вечер выходных дней поиграть во что-то стоящее-берите смело,игра не заставит вас пожалеть о выборе.От себя поставил бы игре 8.5\10,так как небрежно подобранная музыка и невероятное количество "скрытой" ненависти к Рассеи не могло не оставить своего следа.

10075306.review:
En primer lugar cabe a decir que estamos ante un buen shooter. Es un juego divertido y que entretiene, tiene armas satisfactorias, entornos que varían y no aburren, poderes temporales/telequinéticos que se usan con satisfacción y soltura, historia tirando a buena, etc.

Con esto quiero decir que el jugador aficionado a pegar tiros y a hacer repetidos clicks al ratón lo encontrara de lo más entretenido y lo disfrutará. Si os habéis leído otros análisis de Estim sabréis que el juego recuerda a muchos otros en algunos aspectos, y es cierto. Digo esto como algo bueno, por supuesto, ya que una de las partes más logradas del juego es de hecho la ambientación tipo S.T.A.L.K.E.R/metro 2033 y los poderes, grabaciones y anotaciones que recuerdan a los primeros Bioshocks.

AHORA BIEN. El juego resulta sorprendentemente fácil aunque sea jugado en dificultad alta (jugarlo en fácil y normal es, sin ir más lejos, irrisorio). Tal vez puede que sea porque yo soy un tío muy JuArCoRe y todo ese rollo, o tal vez sea porque es de activision, compañía que nos acostumbra a coger de la mano, poner cámaras lentas y darnos palmaditas en la espalda mientras nos dice ''JUASH! COMO HAS HECHO ESO?''.

Otro aspecto muy negativo es que el juego solo explota los poderes temporales en lo que refiere a la acción, si en vez de hacer el juego sumamente lineal y con entornos muy limitados lo habrían hecho más abierto y hubiesen aprovechado los poderes de manipulación para puzles y secretos (más allá del divertido PAIUM PAIUM) a lo mejor estaríamos ante un juego más significativo e idolatrado.

La historia por su parte está bien, aunque a mí los rollos temporales esotéricos extraños no me llaman mucho la verdad.

El juego te dura 7 horas, cuesta 20 euros y su multijugador está muerto.

¿He de comprarlo?
...

10073627.review: Haut mich nicht vom Hocker. Auf der technischen Seite handelt es sich um eine schlechte Portierung eines Konsolen-Titels. Angefangen bei fast nicht vorhandenen Konfigurationsmöglichkeiten in der Darstellung bis zu einer Steuerung die sich keine Mühe macht ihre Wurzeln zu verstecken. Zum Spiel selbst lässt sich sagen, dass hier immenses Potential einfach verschwendet wurde. Ein Szenario um ein Gerät das die Zeit manipulieren kann hätte Raum für ein gigantisches Maß an Rätseln geboten oder für alternative Lösungsansätze bei verschiedenen Missionen. Was jedoch geliefert wird ist ein linearer Shooter ohne große Denkarbeit. Außerdem ist das Spiel zu leicht. Auch das dürfte an der ursprünglichen Auslegung für Konsole liegen. Die Upgrades sind viel zu stark, die benötigten Ressourcen für die Upgrades werden einem hinterhergeworfen, Munition gibt es im Überfluss. Die Fähigkeit Zeitblasen zu erschaffen die die Gegnerscharen stillstehen lassen und einen selbst mehr oder minder vor Kugeln schützen drückt den Schwierigkeitsgrad dann endgültig in den Keller. Hinzu kommt, dass die Gegner selbst bei Streifschüssen das zeitliche Segnen und sich auch sonst nur minder intelligent verhalten. Die Story selbst ist undurchsichtig und das Ende kommt ohne großen Höhepunkt "mitten im Spiel". Unterm Stich: Wer Zeit hat und das Spiel im Sale kriegt kann es sich antun.

10067827.review:
While there are not a lot of new mechanics that Singularity offers, they do hit all of the FPS checkboxes. 

The levels are linear but well planned and with enough hidden goodies that it is worth seeing them. Most of those hidden goodies are E99, the main currency of the game and the major plot device of it too. The human enemies have a decent enough A.I. and the non-human enemies tend to rush you like a giant bullet sponge. 

The weapons are all the general FPS weapons; pistol, shotgun, rifle, sniper rifle, and rocket launcher are all there. There is one weapon, the Seeker, that allows you to control the flight path of the bullet while slowing down time. Like the killshots in the game Nazi Zombie Army, the Seeker lets you lay out a plan of attack. The Seeker is also the closest you'll come to actually controlling time. 

The device used to control time feels underwhelming and pigeon-holed into a few uses. It eventually has two upgradeable powers, the ability to send out a pulse to hurt and push back enemies and a time bubble that greatly slows down anything caught in it that isn't you. For the bubble your bullets will go slow and so will enemy fire, but it will still be moving and able to cause damage. Exploding barrels (I mentioned this game hit all the FPS benchmarks didn't I?) don't explode until after the effect of the time bubble has ended. The pulse is essentially useless, even when at the end <spoilers> the device becomes "uber" and can rip off the limbs of unarmed enemies, the actual distance the pulse reaches is so small unless something is right next to you, it won't help.

However the game has a great amount of detail and production and is similar to Bioshock both in style and mechanics so I do recommend it.

10065562.review:
Рекомендую сию игру , но оговрюсь сразу. Игра на  одно-два прохождения и желательно на лёгком уровне (сбережёте нервы и время)  Почему- напишу ниже. 
 И так встречайте - Singularity. Типичный представитель линейно-рельсовых шутеров. Причём настолько рельсовый , что вы можете двигать только вперёд. Влево-враво  вас не пустят невидимые стенки и преграды, а чтоб небыло резону назад отступить, за вами игра заболиво закроет двери, как тока вы их прошли, обрушит что нибудь  и тому подобное. Видимо чтоб не отвлекались от сюжета и не тратили время на шастанье по кустам. Пээтому проходится игра быстро - исследовать  в ней нечего. Только то что по сюжету задумано.
 К слову - сюжет неплох, вполне приличный. Игра мне даже напомнила другую игру где тоже есть манипуляции со временем - TimeShift. Манипулировать -состаривать/омолаживать будете разными предметами и врагими с помощью наручной приблуды -  временного преобразователя.  Довольно необычный и редкий девайс для шутеров.  Стандартное  же, для шутеров, оружие, можно прокачивать, улучшая его характеристики. Примерно как в Fallout 3 -нашёл чертёжик, или насобирал "денег" - можешь усовершенствоваться, чтоб потом врагов "огорчать" новыми возможностями- скучно не будет, Атмосфера игры -  озвучка  и графика вполне этому  способствуют. Довольно старенький Унреаловский движок неплохо ташит графическую часть, ничего не тормозит
 Добавим сюда 3  варианта концовки, всё это ради чего играть  стоит.
 В качестве приятного бонусика добавлю. Есть такое оружие, хлам по большему счёту, детексомёт - стреляет минами, в альтернативном режиме которыми можно рулить. И есть небольшая секретка, которая открывается именно управляемой миной - её надо  прокатить и попрыгать по лабиринтику

 А теперь о грусном. Почему играть не стоит. Игра разрабатывалась и издавалась америкосовскими  канторами. Игра не для русских, но про русских агрессоров(которые хотят захватить мировое господство) - будете мочить красноармейцев в пилотках. STALIN, GULAG, KATORGA-12, это из лексикона игры. Главный негодяй Демичев зверски (кинематографично) мочит одного из американцев, чтобы вы его сразу возненавидели. А потом игра всё время будет вас подгонять. -"быстрей быстрей, Демичев уже близко". Задрало..
 Интерфейс  английский, и придётся отдельно скачивать локализацию (это несложно, в стим сообществе есть) с хорошей озвучкой, но иногда со странными текстами, переведёнными гугл транслейтом. Пример: таблица Менделеева - Периодический Стол из Элементы". Непонятно так же, это странности локализации или так задумано - нафига на секретной русской базе  двойные надписи на английском и русском? чтоб англицкие шпиёны лучше ориентировались?
 ишшо минус - прохождение по чекпоинатм, как и всего что  издаёт  Activision, я один участок 9 раз проходил. Это когда отобрали всё оружие а потом вручили один револьвер - я пол игры проходил с револьвером, оружия после убитых врагов не оставалось - НУ ОТКУДА МНЕ БЫЛО ЗНАТЬ, что чтобы в арсенале взять дробаш, или автомат, надо вверху менюшки арсенала потыкамть маааленькие квадратики - прокрутка мышью как и стрелками не предусмотрена, я штук 20 арсеналов прошёл и не выьрал ничего, ибо не знал как - первым в арсенале стоит этот сраный револьвер (прямо таки всё было очевидно и просто по разумению разрабов игры).
 Также нельзя сейвится или загрузить какую то главу игры- не предусмотрено. Вопшем, решайте сами, покупать, или нет  енту игру.

 P.S. если решите всё таки игру купить, то не прокачиваете из оружия ничего, кроме  снайперки и  дробовика. Всё остальное стреляющее барахло просто даром не надо.

10044413.review:
A very good game. A bit easy on "normal" but had some difficult parts even then.
You are a member secret military strike force with a mission into the heart of Russia. They have discovered a very powerful energy resource and a bad guy has taken it over. As your birds approach a blast in the distance produces an energy shockwave that knocks you out of the sky and you crash on the island.
You are trying to be evaced as the story unfolds, and the story is pretty good. :)
You follow a tight path with little exploreing. You can search some areas for hidden items and power ups. 
The game play is arcade like with power and ammo drops.
You find new weapons at key times- just before a new type of baddie. Even though most of the monsters are really cool and one or two gave an okay challange.
As you find canisters of "E-99" you use it to add powers to your character like slowing time in a makeshift bubble or blasting back creeps with a blast of plasma.
The ending gives you a few differant wrap ups depending on the path you choose- I sugjest checking the alts out ;)
The multi-player is dead nobody is playing it but seems to be a team deathmatch with "flag" capture points versing the monsters against the soldiers.
All in all I feel it was worth the cash I spent... It was on sale but hey....
If you like games like Bioshock and Metro chances are you will like this one.
