10041945.review:
Well, that was satisfying. This game liberally embraces and extends, and everything it copies, it makes better.
At times, it looks like Fallout3 without the silliness (it also lets you inspect a metric ton of flavor notes and recordings); it has a bit of a Half-Life 2 feel ("scifi settings + mute protagonist + gravity gun equivalent"), but much better pacing (and you don't want to kill the Alyx equivalent), and because of the whole "time" shtick, you justifiably get bullet time (as a slowdown with the regular sniper gun, and as a harder to explain, but immensely satisfying "slowdown + bulletcam + bullet control that lets you bend the path of the bullet around obstacles and corners" with the experimental sniper rifle, the "Seeker."), and of course the combination of "spookiness, Russia, anomalies" suggests comparisons with the S.T.A.L.K.E.R. series.
Other than that, it has a late '80s/early '90s flair to it; nihilistic scifi played straight, by the numbers shooter with solid mechanics, etc.
As for the "time manipulation device", that's a really nice addition to the game that sets it apart. While you can only use it to time travel when you find a "rift" (at which point you can travel back to the time it was created), you can use the TMD to age/youth objects (and later enemies) quite often, sometimes in the context of simple but satisfying puzzles. Some reviews imply that the TMD is under-utilized (making me expect something like Remember Me where they made a big deal out of the memory remixing which then only appears in the game four or five times) -- not so. Or arguably, so but only if you look only at time travel and ignore object manipulation.

Things to consider:

- The game isn't that long and can be finished within a day / two evenings. I appreciate manageable commitment in a game; you may not. (Even then the sale price of around $3 is more than fair.)

- The number of enemy types is somewhat limited. I find that to usually make a setting more believable, you may find it repetitive.

- The number of boss fights is also very limited (but at least one of them has a nice setup, even if the actual fight is a bit by the numbers).

- The game feels extremely linear. It's not outright painful (a la "I am alive"), but it's quite noticeable. Sure, it could be argued that that goes for all non-sandboxy games and that after the paradigm shift of open world, there's no satisfactory going back, but we don't even see much in the way of DN3D's "do you want to take the left or the right air vent / the vent or the regular corridor to get to the same place" kind of thing that doesn't slow the game down. On the upside this doesn't just go for maps, but for the plot as well: this means no side-quests (on which I've OD'd a bit), and the main plot uses that thing very sparingly where you're trying to do something, then it turns out you'll have to achieve a prerequisite first, then while trying to do that, you'll end up with a prerequisite for the prerequisite, et cetera ad nauseam, and instead of achieving objectives, you have a stack of half-finished objectives ten deep. So yeah, Singularity mostly avoids that, doesn't stack objectives too deeply when it stacks them, and the objectives they give you tend to feel justified rather than forced or an interruption.

- This is a 2010 game, so the graphics are mildly dated, but I found them fit for purpose. I have no regrets. Your mileage may vary. On the plus side, even though the game is mildly scary in the beginning (it's night, you have no or no good weapons, and you don't know what you're up against -- or worse, you've found out what you're up against, but still don't have anything decent to defend yourself with), it never stoops to the whole "It's scary only because you can't see shit" level. (If I never have to see a flashlight again, especially one that only illuminates 1/8 of the screen, it'll be too soon. If I pay for a whole game, 1/8 won't do.)

- No Steam achievements. :( This is particularly sad as the console versions are said to have achievements/trophies.

- I started this instead of surfing when my net went down. Game would freeze for a second every few seconds until net came back, not sure whether "always online" requirement, or initial activation, or what. Research this if that sort of thing is incompatible with your setup or principles.

- I wouldn't have minded the option of a female avatar. Seeing as we're pretty much dealing with a mute protagonist here, it's not like it would've incurred much extra cost for voice work. In fact as we pretty much never see our avatar, it may not matter much, but then as we pretty much never see our avatar, it would've been all the easier to implement, simply by not making references at all and just calling you Captain, Renko, or a combination thereof.

- There's multi-player (which I haven't tried), but no co-op.

- No proper saves ("When you want, where you want, however many you want"). Game auto-saves fairly often so even if things go wrong, you rarely lose much progress, but obviously this way, you can't replay "just that bit you really liked" or show your friend "that super cool scene" to get them to buy the game too, so as in all other games with that defect, the developers are idiots for limiting replay value and word of mouth.

VERDICT

Very solid single player experience; hard to beat at current price point. If linearity doesn't put you off gameplay wise, or the lack of proper saves, female avatars, and possibly an always-on requirement doesn't politics-wise, go for it!

10037397.review:
Годный шутер, без открытого мира, содержащий легко узнаваемые элементы многих игр, таких как Quake, BioShock, Call of Duty и других. Повсюду чувствуется дух Quake IV и Star Wars: Jedi Knight 2, ведь игра именно от разработчиков этих игр: похожая атмосфера, локации и геймплей, даже некоторое оружие взято прямиком из Quake IV.
В игре не заставят выслушивать длинные диалоги, ходить и решать головоломки, или тыкать NPC в поиске заданий. От начала и до конца - это интенсивный линейный экшен, в котором за каждой дверью ждет коридор с врагами. По ходу игры можно находить предметы для улучшения оружия и перков, но на РПГ (даже уровня BioShock) не рассчитывайте.
Unreal Engine 3 в этой игре не слишком красив, но игра все-таки атмосферна за счет дизайна локаций и красок. Чудовищных подгрузок текстур, которые наблюдались в то время, когда игра только вышла - теперь нет. Сюжет, где главную роль играет перемещение во времени, до финальных титров интересен и не пестрит фейспалмами.
Минусами можно отметить:
* невысокую сложность (игра все-таки консольная, для геймпадов, а не ПК-эксклюзив), и возможность носить только два оружия одновременно, что не похоже на Raven Software.
* короткую продолжительность
* явный недостаток в боссах (их всего пара, да и боссами их назвать язык не повернется).
* очень куцый набор улучшений оружия
В общем же, это хорошая игра, которая не даст заскучать за счет своей скоротечности. Она как будто проходит сама себя, как это делали раньше игры от RavenSoft. 
Всем фанатам этих старых добрых разработчиков игра рекомендуется. Однако, консолью пахнет. Приготовьтесь...

PS: Тихий звук? На Win7 идем: Панель управления/Звук/Связь/ * "Действие не требуется"

10037135.review:
I really liked it. I am surprised it was published by Activision as all they really do now is COD. A much better shooter than COD has ever been and liekly ever will be. Shame we didn't get a sequel. I am not going to give it a score but I will give it pro's and cons.

+Nice lighting effects and pretty descent graphics esspecially for it's time.
+Nice fairly original story
+Fairly interesting characters
+Good monster and enemy design
+Fairly interestign guns
+Nice not in-your face progression
+Good level design, also good puzzle design. Puzzles are nto stupid hard btu nto really easy either and there are not too many of them either.

-Gun sounds need more work. Not very punchy sounding. The Magnum style gun in particular and the sniper rifle.
-A bit short hwoever if you want a short game this is perfect. I completed it in 7 hours. I explored everywhere as well.
-Gun's could have been a bit more interesting. Mabe a secondary ability on the autocannon would have been nice adn the shotgun.
-Progression system and weapon upgrades are very boring. Would have liked to have seen some E-99 infused guns like the autocannon rounds fired E-99 shells, fires slower but packs a hell of a punch. That would have been cool.
-No side quests.
-Linear game but encourages exploration.
-Difficulty is a strange one. I would have liked to have seen a setting between Medium and Hard. Hard is stupid difficult and Medium is just too easy.

There arfe probably more pro's and con's but I cannot think of them all.

I decided to give it a score in the end but at the end so you ahve to read it all......hahahah.

I give it an above average of 6/10. In comaprison I would give BF4 a 5/10 so thats pretty good. Average is a 5 and this game is not average in anything. An overall great game if I am honest and is great value for only £2 soemthing.

Edit

The game is a great PC port. There are a descent amount of settings. Nice sound assets other then the guns. Frame rate is wanderful. 10027550.review:
Now this is a nice suprise a bargain on steam at the time I got this game. I read a lot about this game. Like there is a huge budget for this game and there were worries that it wouldn't sell that well. 

The story
The game is about a secret Soviet weapon that has been fueled by an element called E99. That can be used to temper with time on a very local scale. It is travelling foreward and backwards in time that eventually clears the reasons and causes of all the troubles and combat you are in. There are some good suprises in the story and some very good "shock and awe" moments. I really enjoyed it all I must admit. I couldn't really stop playing till the end of the story and thus the game. 

The theme "time travel" always fascinated me from the time I saw the movie and read the book Time Machine by Orson Wells. So that of time travel is a very big plus or pro for me. 

Way of telling
The story telling is being done with ocassional cutscenes that reminded me of Call Of Duty in a way. You start out with a search of a secret Soviet base on an remote island close to the Russian border. You search the base or island I must say for clues what happened in the past and why there such strange mutated creatures roaming around the island? This gave me the feeling of the game Stalker where a nuclear accident also created strange mutations among the wildlife or even to the human inhabitants. Ocassionally you see ghosts from the past acting out scenes of mayhem that happened years ago. Those scenes reminded me of the game FEAR somehow. Where you also had flashbacks via ghostly like scenes. That sented chills down my spine. 

Film and sound footage
The story is good and even backed up with some very amusing films and sound footage that have been scattered around the base. Those recordings you can listen to or even see in film projectors still functioning at the base. Most of the time the have that eerie looking sound or damaged footage of aging of some other violent event. 

Graphics and sounds
The graphics are superb and the sounds are very well done. Although the story is very amusing to say the least. It also makes the maps a little linear in a way. There is no free roaming around the maps like you can with so many roleplaying games. But do not let that spoil the fun. There are still plenty of places to search for loot like ammo and the E99 fuel metals. 

You have to find certain characters in the game. Get this tool or this element find it take it somewhere and all backed up by a more or less logical story line. Do I recommend it? Oh yes you should try this game if you like the elements of timetravel and some scary horror moments in a game. 

A game for mature players
So I must add this game is for the mature players that like some gory scenes from time to time. There are a lot of dead corpses  some even impaled (like in games like Doom) and bloodbaths. When you shoot enemies they lose limps and other body parts by the impact of the bullets. There is even an time weapon where you can "age" people very fast. 

A very good game & get it if you can
So be warned or informed what ever you like. This is a good well done game. You can see there has been put a lot of effort in this game. So I do recommend this game. Go for it if you like the things mentioned above.

10022150.review:
Let me preface this review by saying I waited 4 years to play this game. I liked the look of it when it released in 2010 but could never bring myself to buy it at full price. I picked it up on sale from Steam for about $8 and for that price is it probably worth it.

The Singularity isn't a bad game in any way but it relies to much on being derivative of it's peers and often makes the classic modern FPS mistake of using a brown color pallet and heavy industrial level design.

The shooting itself is good if not great, the enemies are varied (shades of Doom, Wolfenstein, Half Life and even COD can be seen here) and weapons and your TMD (read Half life 2 gravity gun mix with some other stuff) can be upgraded. Towards the end of the game you can do some really neat things with your TMD/weapon combos that keep combat fun and lively.

The story is a little convoluted and the characters are muddy. Much like the TMD rips off Half Life 2's gravity gun in some respects so the cast here are retreads of the characters in the older game. The female lead is a poor man's Alyx Vance but does a serviceable job guiding you through the story. I just had a hard time connecting with the characters, although I will say the multiple endings to the game is a nice touch!

The TMD does also allow for some minor puzzle elements that can initially seem taxing but once you have seen one of about the 3 or 4 puzzles that are used through the game you can quickly identify and solve them. In the end what strikes you as an “oh wow nice touch” trick the first time ends up feeling played about by the 25th.

This leads me onto my biggest gripe with the game: the level design. The Singularity has some amazing potential and wastes it utterly with brown industrial environ after brown industrial environ. The levels set in the past are, varied, bright, colorful and full of unique little touches that made me want to explore this cold war era lab (it really reminded me of half life 1, a living breathing facility I wanted to inhabit not just visit). It is a crying shame that you never visit them for more than 10 minutes at a time. These levels are also filled with Russian soliders that act half way intelligently and are fun to fight. The modern levels by contrast are by the numbers brown boxes that remind me of quake 1 or painkiller with less character. The enemies that inhabit them are varied and some are fun to fight but too many simply charge at you. Once you acquire some decent weapons and TMD upgrades they become a chore to fight.

The split between old and modern sums up the Singularity well for every good moment there is something dull and bland. A unique feature or moment here is followed by a dull 30 minute sepia section shortly after. If only Raven had stuck to using the 50's setting throughout the game we may have had a truly unique and classic game on our hands. It's still a decent shooter and well worth a blast through if you can get it for under $10 but I came away feeling happy I played it but sad that it wasn't as good as it could have been.

7/10

10019638.review:
✮✮✮✮✮

Il gioco ci vede nei panni di un marine americano di nome Renko, mandato col compagno Devlin in missione di ricognizione sull'abbandonata isola Katorga-12, dove durante la guerra fredda le forze sovietiche stavano sviluppando una tecnologia basata sul minerale E99, presente solo su quell'isola e dotato di una potenza superiore a quella della bomba atomica nonchè di proprietà incredibili. A causa di un evento radioattivo l'elicottero dei due soldati precipita e finiremo col separarci dal nostro compagno; durante il percorso per ricongiungervici verremo colpiti da un secondo evento radioattivo, che ci porterà indietro al 1955 portandoci in un punto cruciale che darà inizio ad uno stravolgemento della verità storica che dovremo ripristinare. Strumento eccezionale in nostro possesso è il CMT, un dispositivo alimentato dall'E99 che ci consentirà di piegare lo spazio, il tempo e quelche legge fisica qua e la. Non aggiungo altro perchè è un gioco che merita di essere giocato e gustato in tutte le sue sfaccettature, assolutamente da acquistare ed uno dei giochi più belli a cui ho giocato.

PRO
- Trama stupenda, molto curata ed elaborata.
- Comparto grafico gradevole nel complesso.
- Le note, i proiettori, le registrazioni e le riminescenze del passato danno un enorme senso di immedesimazione.
- Il CMT da un senso di onnipotenza tangibile, ed i suoi usi sono tutti interessanti.
- Stupende le mutilazioni.
- Buone le musiche ed il doppiaggio italiano.
- La costante atmosfera di angoscia in alcune sequenze è resa molto bene.
- Bella la gestione dei potenziamento e delle abilità.
- Buona la diversificazione dei nemici.
- Belli i paradossi temporali.
- 3 possibili finali, tutti belli.

CONTRO
- Il look delle armi non mi piace per niente.
- Molte texture sono orrende.
- Il multiplayer è deserto, e comunque è stato inserito solo per incentivare all'acquisto... un titolo come questo merita di essere acquistato solo per la campagna, che è una delle più belle degli ultimi anni.

10015306.review:
Нельзя никак менять прошлое, ибо это может привести к непредсказуемым последствиям. Чему нас, собственно, и учит Singularity. В результате лишь одного действия заброшенный островок в Охотском море становится источником энергии, достаточной для захвата мира. И только один человек - капитан Натаниель Ренко может предотвратить катастрофу в прошлом, потому что все нити сюжета указывают именно на него. Человека, который и сам хотел бы распутать этот клубок тайн и узнать, почему только он может всех спасти.
От себя лишь хочется добавить, что это добротный, но немного подзабытый шутер, в котором все аспекты работают, геймплей держит до самого конца, подкреплённый неплохой графикой.
И, хотя до содержания финальных твистов можно дойти и самому, концовка не разочарует.

P.S. И да, в игре нет хэппи-энда, даже несмотря на то, что концовки три. Потому что у этой истории просто не может быть хорошего конца.

10011077.review:
I'm going to be very blunt in my review: Singularity is Activisions version of Bioshock. So Russia is involed.

So, you're a black ops agent in an op in Russia and you decided to save a guy in the past. The butterfly effect therefore tells you to bend over and bow down to the soviet union as this new element, Adam- I mean, E99, has time manipulation abilities. You use your plasmids- I mean TMD, to freeze people and shoot them, age them, turn them into monsters, or teleketically grab objects to improve your abilities. You find shiney metal "Power to the People"- I mean, weapon boxes, to upgrade your weapon that absolutely no one has heard of, but are remarkable similar to the AK-47, a shotgun, a rail gun, a sniper, and other guns.

The game is very liniar and eventually leads to a paradox that is just absolutely looked over. I'm sure there's multiple endings but the one I got was "You killed the Russian leader and the guy that was helping you. Then you disappear and become president of the US with the hand of God. cuz FUGGIN 'MERICA!!!"

Is it worth $29.99 after 4 years of it's release? Fuck no. Is it worth $7.49 during special sales? Fuck no. Wait till it's... like... $2.49. Or find the console version in the shitbins at a local game store.

Also if you read all the notes and listen to all the voice recordings that may add more depth to your story like it did mine. This game trys to scare you at some points, but it isnt a scary game. I rate this a 9/10 only becasue I wish the story was a little bit longer and it had more options for weapons. they only have one gun per type for example only one pistol. 10009872.review:
Nachdem ich das Spiel jetzt gemütlich durchgezockt habe, (Gute 7 Stunden auf Normal) 
kann ich es nur weiterempfehlen. Ich bin sehr zufrieden. 
Das spiel ist jeden Euro wert. 

Positiv aufgefallen: 
+ Gute Story
+ Top Leveldesign
+ Lebendige Charaktere und Gegner
+ Unterschiedliche Waffen, welche sich auch in der Handhabung und Auswirkung unterscheiden. 
+ Interessantes Spielen mit der Zeit
+ Erfreudige Bosskämpfe
+ Ausgesprochen gute Deutsche Syncronisierung mit Russischem Akzent

Einziger Kritikpunkt:
- Einige Texturen sind sehr schlecht und passen einfach nicht rein. Ein ganzes Stück am Ende des Spiel wurden scheinbar sogar alle Texturen nicht richtig geladen, was dementsprechend aussah. (Bug?)

Fazit: 
Es wird immer für Abwechslung gesorgt. Die Bosskämpfe machen Spaß. Gegner sind gut platziert und abwechslungsreich. Auch von der Menge genau richtig. 
Was ich persönlich noch vermisse, ist die Möglichkeit manuell speichern und laden zu können. Vor allem für unterschiedliche Fortschritte. Ist schade, wenn man merkt, dass man sich für die falschen Waffen entschieden hat und dann nicht mehr zurück kann. Aber das ist kein Kritikpunkt.

10009321.review:
이 게임은 늘어나는 아이스크림 가지고 장난치는 터키 아저씨같은 게임이다. 근데 큰 차이점이 하나 있다면, 아저씨는 돈 주면 아이스크림을 진짜 주는데 이건 똥을 줘.

대작들을 이거저가 짜집기한건 좋은데 정말 엿같은 점만 조금씩 가져왔다.

업글 시스템 : 똥같은 업그레이드 넘쳐남, 업그레이드 구매해도 자동으로 안박아주는게 있어서 사놓고 놀리는 경우 발생, 무기 업글은 바쇽인피수준 곁다리 장식
시간 조작 : 씨발 TMD 밧데리 수동장전하게 만들어주는게 그리 어렵더냐? 위기상황 -> 시발 임펄스! -> 장ㅋ전ㅋ의 악순환
붕대질 : 자동회복시스템 극혐이라는 분들을 위해 없애드렸습니다 ^^ 안 그래도 스프린트 느린데 붕대질하면 스프린트 멈춘다. 뒈지란거지
틱 : 개발자들이 최소시급 받고 일했다는 증거. 쳐만들기 귀찮아서 레벨 대충 틱 바글바글 튀어나오는 터널로 때운 레벨이 몇 되는데... 레벨 디자이너 새끼 명치 존나세게 때리고 싶다 진짜. 갑자기 떼거지로 나와서 펑! 사망! 체크포인트 시작부터 다시! 여기에 붕대질이랑 TMD 자동장전까지 합하면 레알 극혐의 장
캐서린인지 뭔지 기억안나는 썅년 : 모두의 극혐대상인 시간제한 미션 + 호위미션 2관왕! 존재감 ㅈ도 없는데 나왔다 뒤짐. 내가 죽일 수 있길 바랐는데...
틱 : 중요하니까 두번 말한다. 이 게임에 틱 넣은 새끼... 너를 찾아낼 것이다. 반드시... 죽일 것이다.

사지마라. 하지마라. 받지마라.

Singularity takes different video games ideas, it's undeniable! (Doom 3, Half-life 1&2, Dead Space series, Portal, Return to Castle Wolfenstein (RTCW), and more). The good thing is that the Scenario is good. Not great, but good. The ambiance is interesting also. Some people would say that this game is way under-rated, I would say no because it is linear, there is some repetitive actions, you can't go where you want because of tons of boring invisible walls, but at least you can find some secret areas and there is many predictable situations.

I recommand you Singularity if you are a fan of FPS's in general! But now, if this game is one of the greatest FPS ever? Of course not, but at least it is very interesting and entertaining! So yes, you can purchase it now!

Singularity is based on Epic Games - Unreal Engine 3. 

[b] Graphics / Mapping: 7/10 [/b] - Invisible walls and some ugly and blurry textures!
[b] Action / Scenario: 7/10 [/b] - A little bit of deja vu.
[b] Musics / Sound: 5/10 [/b] - Good... but not great.
[b] Programing: 9/10 [/b] - Why 9? Because I prefer ID Software 3D engines for many reasons but Unreal Engine is amazing too.

10001064.review:
I have been really surprised by this game: I didn't expect it to be that good. Of course, the unreal engine helps a lot, visually, but the story is surprisingly good, the mechanics are solid, the gameplay sometimes challenging, the level varied. I did play the whole game without realizing it, and I enjoyed almost every single minute of it (there have been some minor issues, especially with linearity-with-checkpoints-that-prevent-you-from-exploring, but nothing game-breaking, just minor frustration).

I did also not expect that much detail and commitment into the plot, which, overall, is coherent and interesting. The endings are also worth it, and the game lets you experience all of them without having to re-beat all of it to access another one.

If you're looking for a visually appealing, pleasant to play FPS that is worth a few bucks, look no further, it is worth it.

9998658.review:
Well what can I say? It was pretty to look at, the story intrigued me, and the zombies made me jump on two occaisons. However, it lacks a quick save function, which prevented me from completing the game. Now I'm no save wanker, I don't need to save every five seconds because I'm prone to dying - no, I need to save when I feel things are about to get serious because it's very possible I've missed something and would like the chance to go back if it turns out I have. 

Basically I found myself with next to nothing ammo in a colourful room full of teleporting zombies. My knife is made of plastic, I have 3 bullets on my pistol and about 12 bullets on my rifle. There's no ammo anywhere, and the bastard game wants you to kill your 6 ( i think) attackers. After doing some digging, it turns out I walked right past a refill point. My fault for not seeing it, but the game has locked me out of that area so now it's pretty much saying "Your fault for looking at the pretty scenery and not the glowing box thing a second ago, sucks brah". 

My only option? To replay.

This game is not good enough to earn a replay. The frustration factor vs the OH WOW factor is just too one sided for that. 

It's probably a good game, and I did enjoy it until the mishap, so I would recomend it to someone who wants to kill the time. Maybe I'll revisit at some point. Probably not.

Cranked out this single-player campaign in just under 7.5 hours. This game holds up well 4 years after its release. It's a solid Linear FPS experience, felt like a mix of Bioshock and Metro 2033 in terms of game feel and atmosphere. Time-manipulating powers were different and varied enough to keep me mentally engaged through puzzle-solving and combat. I should note that if you aren't quick on your feet in combat you can get overwhelmed pretty easily, so use of guns and TMD effectively is a must. Story was probably the highlight for me, it was intriguing (though it was basically powerhungry white men vying for power, the events that took place were fantastic).

Would recommend for single-player, haven't played multiplayer yet.

9844305.review:
I found Singularity to be a pleasant suprise. Having enjoyed many of Raven's previous games I completely missed this on first release. The graphics are not the best of generation and look a bit muted but this game is an excellent example of the sadly disapearing A-AA game. It won't win awards or get great acclaim, but it is hugely entertaining. 
The shooter mechanics are solid, the guns feel suitably meaty and the enemy impact is satisfying. The story is very interesting, the time travel aspects and "ghosts of the past" give haunting views of the events on Katorga 12, much improving the now standard notes and recordings way of telling the story. Especially creepy is the "duck and cover" in the school. I would recommend this to anyone looking for an entertaining story or a more fast paced, slightly goofy alternative to Battlefield or COD. I would rate it 8/10

9788516.review:
★★★★
Es casi increíble lo poco que se escucha nombrar a este juego, Singularity es por mérito propio una de las grandes sorpresas que nos dejó el 2010, un título que se aleja a lo que nos tiene acostumbrado Activision, y es que el trabajo de Raven Software es una obra de arte con todos las letras. Un título con una historia simple pero no por ello mala, y es que todo lo contrario, ya que los sucesos que suceden en "Katorga 12" van de la mano con una historia con enganche de principio a fin con un marcado gusto a LOST, y para darle el "toque" final posee 3 finales alternativos.

Singularity es una apuesta diferente a nivel jugable. Sus principales logros radican en la variedad de situaciones a las que somete al jugador, ya sea por exigencias del guion o por la diversidad de objetos que tenemos entre manos y en la ambientación, que gracias al nivel artístico bajo el motor Unreal Engine 3 y a un argumento efectista enganchan de principio a fin.

Singularity es el resultado de una mezcla entre Bioshock, Metro 2033, Half Life, Time Shift y F.e.a.r. obteniendo un adecuado y muy buen resultado cuando normalmente, este tipo de juegos que combina elementos de otros suelen ser un fracaso o no están a la altura de las expectativas. 

Singularity es singular, pero en el aspecto bueno de la palabra. Es una de esas pequeña joya que sale al mercado muy de vez en cuando de la oímos hablar bastante poco porque nadie se ocupa de otorgarle el mérito que se merece, ya que lamentablemente no será reconocido por la misteriosa falta de promoción que ha tenido.

Si lo que buscas es olvidarse de todo por un rato, y divertirte, el título de Raven Software es una bomba altamente recomendable  en especial a todo fanático de FPS., y si te gustaron los  mencionados  Bioshock, FEAR, Metro. etc., este juego formara parte de tu colección sin dudas, ya que   no queda más que viajar a la isla Katorga 12, en donde la acción está a la orden del día, en u  mundo plagado de pequeños detalles que lo convierten en un juego fantástico aparte de ser un FPS mucho más que notable.


Raven Software lo hizo de nuevo. Singularity es un juego que hay que jugar, un FPS a la "vieja escuela" y que demuestra, que por más ideas innovadoras o cosas que se quiera copiar de otros juegos, hay que saber cómo implementarlo y hacer que funcione por sí solo.

Me levanto y me saco el sombrero para aplaudir a Raven Software. Muy buen juego.
★★★★

9616511.review:
Singularity is an underrated FPS game from Raven Software released roughly 4 years ago. It is a story-driven shooter which puts a lot of emphasis on changing your environment - beside the conventional weapons (pistol, rifle etc.) you have the so-called Time Manipulation Device at your disposal, a device which enables you to modify your surroundings. You can repair objects which is necessary to progress in the story or simply use this device to stun or kill your enemies. It is a nice touch as the device comes handy when in a firefight.

There is not much to say about Singularity. It is an OK shooter - nothing special but there's nothing wrong with it. I played it years ago and its multiplayer mode was already dead so if you pick this one up do it only for its story-drive single player option. The game looks good and runs smoothly at 60 FPS thanks to the good old Unreal Engine 3 so you won't have any technical issues with it. I only missed the achievements which are available for consoles.

9288493.review:
Couldn't get into it. Singularity has a lot of interesting ideas, but takes advantage of none of them. The game's big gimmick, the TMD, is nothing more than a contextual extra "use" key. While it has other abilities to use against enemies, none of them I encountered were entirely necessary to use. This is mostly because the game's assault rifle is the greatest weapon ever created in the history gaming. With plentiful ammo, high accuracy, low recoil, and able to take out most common enemies with one headshot, there is no real reason to use any other weapon. It's effectiveness causes the novelty of the games "unique" weapons to wear off very fast. Sure, you can use the gun that allows you to guide bullets into enemies around cover, or slightly out of your line of sight. But in the time it takes for you to guide that bullet into a single enemy, you can kill that same enemy and his 5 comrades, and the rest of his reinforcements in the same amount of time with that godlike assault rifle. There is nothing else to the gunplay, just shoot them in the face with the AR and gg. You can't even throw grenades. You'll find more depth in a CoD game, which is an impressive feat I must admit.

Beyond the boring gunplay there is not much else of merit. The story suffers the same logical inconsistencies of any story involving time travel. My favorite part was going back in time to stop the evil Russian general from killing the good scientist, and after bursting into the room, unloading 10+ bullets into his face and blasting him through the window several stories above the ground, he ends up surviving and going on to rule the world. Fuckin Russians man. The characters are dull cliches ripped off from other, better games. The evil general, the good scientist, and the random woman helping you are basically the Russian copies of Dr. Breen, Dr. Kleiner, and Alyx from HL2. There's also the incredibly generic soldier buddy that you'll find by the dozens in any CoD game. You spend about the first 30 minutes of the game with him until he gets shot in the face by the general because he's a stupid fucking moron. This of course is after you get randomly sent back in time and accidentally save the general because you're a stupid fucking moron as well. The only interesting attribute of any of them was the well modelled ass of the woman, but I digress...

Overall, Singularity is an incredibly bland shooter with some well conceptualized yet poorly executed ideas. If you absolutely must try it however, or you think I'm full of shit, at the very least wait to buy it when it's on sale for $5 or less.

8750430.review:
Not really a bad game, it's just kind of an ugly, boring shooter that doesn't know what it wants to be. It starts out reminiscent of Bioshock, where you are in a facility where something has gone wrong and you only have notes and film projectors and such to seemingly place together the story. However, you then are introduced to the time travel mechanic and the game becomes a lot more plot heavy and "shootbang".  There's about a 2 hour interlude of sorts where everything slows down and there's a drastic darker tonal shift which makes the game resemble something more like Metro 2033. I suppose it's interesting to have a game that blends different styles together but instead of being its own thing, Singularity ends up just seeming rather incoherent. There's also plenty of sections where you are simply running down corridors and shooting up nameless goons, where it really doesn't resemble anything other than maybe Call of Duty, only without any real spectacle.

The weapons are interesting, but I ended up using the assault rifle 90% of the time. Sure, I suppose you can say it's up to the play to spice up their loadout, but none of the enemies really suggested that anything else would have been a better option. The vigor/plasmid type powers are actually pretty cool and, unlike Bioshock Infinite, I found it pretty cool to not only rely on gunplay, but to also use the TMD abilities in the firefights as well. 

There's really only 2, maybe 2.5 "boss fights" in the game, which are interesting enough. The game doesn't look the greatest and there are a lot of bad bad textures.

So if you've already played all of the Bioshock games and the Metro games and you want something vaguely similar and have a few days to spend on it, sure, grab this. Otherwise I can't really recommend it over any of those.

8266662.review:
Although short, this game is worth a play through. The story doesn't offer too much to say "wow" about, but the way the developers played with time is pretty interesting and offers for some interesting game play mechanics. This is not to say they are mechanics that have never been seen before, but they do offer interesting puzzles and fun methods of fighting the baddies. Controls are decent, the art was decent for the time, and enemies can be somewhat challenging; that is not to say the game is incredibly hard - it won't be terribly difficult to beat if you have much experience with shooters.

Alternate history is always fun, and the fact that this game centers around Cold War-era environs and shies away from the typical WWII trope that had become commonplace makes this game well worth at least one play.

I can't say that it will warrant a second run through as once you've uncovered all the "twists" the game offers, there isn't much to go back to.

7960094.review:
7.5 из 10 баллов.

Кто-то говорит, что RavenSoft - компания, которая делает игры категории "Б", поэтому их первая самостоятельная игра, Singularity, является творением, не заслуживающим внимания - плюньте таким людям в лицо сразу же! RavenSoft - одна из немногих студий, которая не делает своих движков, а сосредотачивается целиком на самое игре и ее геймплее, не изобретает колесо, а берет популярные идеи и доводит их до уровня "велосипеда", доказательством чему является данная игра (за плечами RavenSoft, кто не знает - игры серии Quake, Return to Castle Wolfenstein, Star Wars: Jedi Academy и Jedi Outcast, Call of Duty (MP): Black Ops, Modern Warfare 3 и Ghosts - так что назвать эту студию разработчиком второсортных игр может только несведующий).

Эта прелюдия - с целью пояснить, что разрабатывая Singularity, RavenSoft не пыталась принести в жанр что-то новое, а просто делала игру с душой. Что есть в "сингулярности" - интересная история, разнообразные враги, оружие на любой вкус и цвет, отличные и запоминающиеся боссы и, самое главное, несколько концовок, из которых нет ни одной "хорошей". Одной фразой - одна из лучших игр 2010 года, которую большинство игроков довольно несправедливо обошли стороной.

Любой геймер, любящий шутеры (FPS) просто обязаен пройти данную игру.

P.S. Для меня Singularity стала первой игрой-шутером, которую я проходил на геймпаде - могу сказать, что каких-то проблем не доставило, поэтому любители покричать, что в шутеры на геймпаде играть это бред, заблуждаются - развалясь на диване играть с комфортом на порядок лучше, чем с клавиатурой и мышью. А вот по сети против людей "с мышью", конечно, уже не побегаешь.

7888938.review:
Singularity, Singularity Singularity, what a gem of a game. Alright, I am not going to lie, I played this at a friends house and did not know what to expect, other than the fact the reviews were meh and the game looked cool. I have to admit, I REALLY like this game. Like, I liked it more than Bioshock Infinite.

Gameplay: The gameplay is very fun and straight forward, the gunplay is intense and satisfying, you get a cool device that supports you in fights and puzzles, and while linear, you are rewarded well for exploring. You get the standard FPS arsenal with some extra twists, a revolver, a assault rifle, shotgun, sniper rifle (which slows down time when scoped), a rifle which fires spikes into your enemies and explodes on them, a grenade launcher that allows you to control the grenades, and a minigun. Two more weapons you get are limited in ammo but fun as hell to use, these are the rocket launcher (self explanatory) and the seeker rifle, which when fired, allows you to control the bullet which explodes on enemies. Weapons can be upgraded throughout the game to level up damage, mag size or reload speed, so you can pick your favorite gun and when tougher foes appear, it wont become useless. Now the TMD you get is a nifty little device, it allows you to control time in your advantage, so you can use it to solve puzzles, pick up useful items and bring them to you (like the gravity gun in Half Life), age enemies to the point they are dust, or change the environment (mostly used for puzzles, or to get extra goodies such as health and ammo) I did enjoy the gameplay more than Bioshock Infinite, since the games play VERY similarly, but in Singularity I find the upgrades for my guns and character a lot more fun then in Infinite, and the fact that the game has better ammo economy then in Infinite, and while I love myself a 'oh sh!t' situation, Infinite hardly gave me any ammo to work with, most weapons just carried a spare clip or two, while in Singularity you are given enough ammo to last a firefight or two, but its enough to where you should think about what you are using. I know it may be a small part of the game to nitpick but lack of ammo can really slow down the pace of a game. (also, this game can be REALLY hard at some points, not frustrating hard but challenging, this is on the normal difficulty too)

(The game took me 8 hours to beat my first time playing it on the Xbox 360, then 5 hours through playing it on the PC, I am judging this game only on single player, as I have yet to play multiplayer)

Graphics: The graphics get the job done, they look pretty damn good like any other game nowadays, explosions are magnificent and the sci-fi elements are colorful and cool to look at. Not much to say honestly, other then some areas where textures take a second to appear or kinda mess up but that is kind a small complaint from me.

Sound: Same as in the graphics, not much to say really, the weapons sound powerful and the voice acting gets the job done. Also a nice shoutout to some creepy atmospheric sounds you hear when the game gets creepier.

Story: While the story is not the best, the story kept me interested through the whole game, with a cool ending to boot. The story in a nutshell is you are sent to a Russian island of Katorga 12 to investigate some weird crap going down, your helicopter is shot down, and you are left to find your friends and gtfo the island, but some more crap complicates with a huge Singularity that has been on the island for quite some time that has been mutating people and creating rifts in time. Backstory on the island and what has been going on is told through notes to be found, writing on walls and tape recorders which are fairly interesting to listen to (Although I will complain they lack any form of subtitles) The things you find that give you story gives the story a good amount of life as you hear or read what the people think as the Singularity fails and the mutants and military take action. Like I said, the story may not be the best, but it is interesting and fun to go through. The game does remind me of Bioshock Infinite like I said before, with the game playing very much like it, the audio logs and time travel, but honestly I though the time travel parts and bits of the story were done better in Singularity)

Conclusion: Honestly, if you want a fun FPS adventure, give this game a try. I know it did not review the best and not everyone has heard of it, but I find it as a nice little gem. The story is a nice medium length and interesting, and I liked the gameplay a lot. I'll give this game a 9/10, the story could be better, and the graphics kinda mess up at points, but I really enjoyed myself, I even played the game twice through (kinda back to back) because I liked it so much.

EDIT: I strongly recommend you play on hard for your first play through, you progress through the game but enemies tend to fall off, but on hard the game stays consistent with your upgrades and provides a mostly fair challenge.

7766297.review:
Singularity is something of an underappreciated FPS from a somewhat underappreciated developer. Having already put out classics like Heretic, Hexen and Jedi Knight II, Raven again went on a solo effort with Singularity in 2010 and it was largely deemed 'pretty good' by reviewers. However, I think it's much more than that. Although hamstringed a little by a few modern FPS conventions, Singularity does a great job of feeling like a classic shooter, ending up somewhere awkward between Serious Sam and Call of Duty.

To its merit however, the enemies are smart and strong despite being a little cliché, the weapons all have a lot of punch and character, even if they're a machine gun, shotgun, sniper rifle, etc. and there's many secrets, upgrades, and places to explore despite being a mostly linear game. In short, Raven seemed to want to make this game much more than the sum of its parts, and in my eyes, they completely succeeded. The time manipulation mechanic, despite being vital to progress, seems more like icing on the cake than a core game mechanic however, so don't expect anything more spectacular than an amazing FPS with some additional superpowers!

Average Game Length? I took around 8 hours to get through the story on the hardest setting, it could take more or less depending on your skill or desire to be a completionist.

A Bit Like? TimeShift, BioShock
 
Is It Fun? The TMD provides some serious fun, the story is engaging and the weapons make mincemeat out of your enemies, a big yes.

Worth The Price? £14.99 is pretty much half the price of a retail title, fitting considering you'll be lucky to get a multiplayer game going given the game's age and lack of popularity. For the price, the solo campaign is more than worth it although consider carefully that that's all you'll be getting out of it if you're on the fence.

Singularity is a fantastic singleplayer FPS. In the tradition of all the B-tier shooters in the 90's this game, like Bioshock, takes solid shooting mechanics, wraps in a unique gameplay twist and presents an interesting setting for the game to unfold.

The setting is an abandoned Russian facility that did experiments on a mysterious substance that affects time. That's the gameplay hook, you explore by dilating time and the age of objects around you. You can make enemies decay right in front of you. It's a fun experience.

Unfortunate for the developer Raven, Activision sent this solid gem to die at retail with no advertising support and so the game was religated to obscurity. I'm sure the multiplayer is dead at this point but the singleplayer alone is worth the price of admission.

2248240.review:
Singularity, a 2008 release developed by Raven Software and published by Activision, is a good example of a game made with no intent other than to ‘follow the leader’: while the game incorporates gameplay ideas with some potential, it suffers from an incredibly flimsy plot and disconnected design choices.

Let’s start with the positives: some of the weapons, like the Seeker and the Dethex Launcher, offer some creative opportunities in combat, and combined with the TMD, combat gameplay almost never becomes a chore, which is good since it’s pretty much 95% of the game.

That’s where the positives end, though: the game lacks any creative thought outside of combat. For example, the TMD is a pretty see-through attempt at combining the Plasmids from BioShock and the Gravity Gun from Half-Life 2, with a gimmick that just adds one extra button press to crate-stacking sequences. The art design feels like a poorly made Soviet AU of Rapture, and the voice acting makes Hollywood Russian accents sound genuine.

The plot is the worst part of the game: I understand, time travel isn’t exactly an easy trope to work with. But even taking that into account, the story is horrendously full of plot holes, and is little more than a barely-connected series of events to get you from setpiece A to setpiece B through combat arena C.

Overall, I’d say: if you happen to own the game, give it a spin to play around with the combat mechanics, but don’t bother throwing away any money on it if you want a satisfying game experience.

2925942.review:
Singularity è un gioco che contiene un mix nel gameplay, per la precisione è proprio preso da ispirazione da Bioshock e qualsiasi fps comune. Soprattutto molta ispirazione è presa da Bioshock per quanto riguarda l'intera ambientazione, con qualche aggiunta di un qualcosa come i viaggi temporali. Per il resto come FPS non è tanto un FPS, per la maggior parte del tempo si sta a fare i vari obbiettivi senza avere nemici contro, e poi quando arrivano le sparatorie, il tutto si conclude in maniera semplice, perché quando inizia una sparatoria, hai sempre la migliore arma del gioco a portata di mano e piena di munizioni. Infatti in questo gioco è difficile morire. 
La forza di questo gioco è nascosta nella trama, una trama davvero con un bel spunto interessante, il tutto trae dal periodo della Guerra Fredda, prendendo piede proprio nella Madre Russia. Una trama quindi con un background non da poco, ma ben sviluppato, mentre la trama stessa procede in modo standard, finché al finale non ti spara in faccia un plot twist davvero inaspettato per poi arrivare anche a una scena post crediti che mostra un piccolo retroscena sulla trama stessa.
La trama però non riesce a coprire i buchi di gameplay presenti, dove presenta anche un'IA piuttosto scarsina, che a momenti è proprio pronta ad essere uccisa dal giocatore. 
Quindi nel complesso un buon gioco, che vi consiglio al prossimo sconto, però attenti che lo scontano di più su amazon.com che su steam.

Как же сильно меня впечатлила Singularity! Один из самых любимых линейных шутеров, в котором каждый аспект радует неимоверно. Остров уютный до невозможности, пугающие монстры и напряженная атмосфера. Мы попадаем на странный остров в качестве солдата, призванного разобраться в чём тут дело. И в самом начале игры... попадаем в прошлое и тем самым изменяем будущее. И так несколько раз на протяжении игры. За этим очень интересно и необычно наблюдать. Несколько финалов, каждый из которых вызывает удивление, потому что по сути мы вольны изменить целую историю человечества. 
Ознакомьтесь пожалуйста с этой игрой, она несправедливо непопулярна. Любите фильмы про путешествия во времени? Тогда от этой игры будете в восторге. Не интересны межвременные приключения? Не врите.

A generic Sci-Fi FPS that distinguishes itself by having a Time Reversal gameplay mechanic. Basically at a certain point in the game, you will get an equipment that lets you reverse or forward the effects of time on objects and enemies.

Its an interesting concept that works well in some of the puzzles it presents, and the various interesting ways of dispatching your enemies. The basic FPS element in this game is however nothing special, and is as generic as the next FPS on the market.

Sound is acceptable, with the usual standard clunks and effects one would expect. Music while good, is not particularly memorable and you will not be talking about it anytime soon after finishing the game.

The story is interesting, if abit cliche. Its pretty short however, at only about 8 hours. While its a competent game in itself, it brings nothing special or revolutionary to the FPS genre.

Overall Rating: 6.5 / 10
An average run of the mill FPS with a few tricks. Give it a try if its on sale.

1641762.review:
Alternative history games I feel generally fall into two categories; absurdly grim alterno-dramas that take themselves too serviously, and the nonsensical cheese fests that know its a silly parody. Its a premise that can go both ways in quality. Singularity treads a good balance in melodrama and campiness, and offers up a decent shooter.

Story is your standard Cold War 'what would happened if'. 1950's Russians discover an all powerful, time distorting element E99 (not to be confused with Einsteinium) on a remote island, experiments go horribly wrong and left to stew for fifty years, and a botched American black ops mission changes the timeline and basically gives Russia the world, and you have to jump back and forth to fix the present/future. There have been better plots in games, but this isn't a totally laughable B movie. It is forunate that the games atmosphere saves it from B movie hilarity. Being trapped inside a decaying, direlict research complex greatly enhances the overall mood and plot of Singulariy, adding a mounting sense of dread and horror that; at least for me, was almost too much to handle.

Singularity's gameplay is pretty competent; starting off as your traditional FPS with generous doses of action survivor horror thrown in for good measure. It shortly becomes what I can only discribe as a 50's sci fi shooter with the introduction of the Time Manipulation Device, a powerful wristband that let you age and revert certain objects and enemies at will, it is perhaps not as solid as Half Life's Gravity Gun. But its still pretty fun. The guns you find throughout are varied and not half bad, but as you find your formula to fight Mutants and Russian soldiers, you'll find yourself using and upgrading only a combination of three or four for everything. Finally there is a lot of variety to them, some of them are not the smartest AI's I've seen; But some, like the mutants that shift in and out of the material world, are unnervingly tough to deal with.

Singularity is a little rough around the edges, but at the end of day its a very satisifing shooter. It does a worthly job of blending its story, atmosphere and game mechanics into something I found memorable and be more willing to replay some day. And in an Era of throw away military shooters, that is saying something.

本作品の特徴的な要素である時間を操作するデバイス「TMD」を手に入れるまでは
少々特異な武器もあれどライフ手動回復制の一般的なFPS
だが、TMDを手に入れてからはTMDを活用したアクションが必要になる。

どの能力も汎用性が高めなので、戦闘を手助け、危機的状況を脱出する手段ともなりうる。
さらに、マップの各所に配置されているE99と呼ばれる未知のエネルギーや、
武器のアップグレードを見つけることで、TMDと武器の強化をベンチにて行える。
こちらはDead Spaceのノードやクレジット、石村ベンチと言うのが

謎解き要素もあるがいい意味でも悪い意味でもさほど難しくない。
TMDを利用したアクションなども、最初は頻繁に利用するが、

Yes, I'm writing to get a piece of coal.  But no matter, this game deserves more love.  You're a soldier sent to investigate an abandoned research station off the coast of Kamchatka.  Wouldn't you know it, you crash and the place is not as abandoned as it looks; in fact it's full of things that want to kill you.

There's three  very neat things about this game: 1) the art direction, a wacky combination of Soviet propaganda art plus steampunk; 2) the superpowers you get, which all have to do with time; my favorite is the sniper rifle with bullets you ride; 3) the various endings, all seemingly designed to mess wtih your mind.

It's something like Half-Life 2, in fact-- mostly shooting, a few physics puzzles, some cool toys to play with.   I think they could have done a little more with the time mechanics, but it's still a fun ride.

550274.review:
While the multiplayer aspect of this game is sadly extinct, Singularity thankfully still exists as one rare gem: As the greatest lovestory between two men ever told, without pandering to the usual cliches seen in representations of homosexual men in the media.

Thats right. Singularity is the best, to date, representation of homosexual romance in a FPS.

Are the pseudo-RPG elements gimicky? Yes. Is the story only slighty more existant than that found in the 'Metro' series? Yes. Is the 3-optional ending choice rather pointless? Also yes.

But the tragic romance between our pseudo-silent protagnoist and James Devlin is truly one to be witnessed. A romance that, though as I stated IS tragic, is truly and literally timeless. You must simply experience it for yourself to understand.

All provided with the soothing and not-overused-at-all voices of Nolan North and Steve Blum. Play it, and witness this tasteful homosexual romance story of loss and grief for yourself.

Corridor shooter with all the modern FPS garbage checkboxes marked off. 2 weapon limit, boring "realistic" weapon selection, virtually unlimited ammo and health kits, clausterphobicly linear, and enemies that range from boring to bullshit. Tries to steal all the best elements from recent releases but ends up feeling more like someone tried to glue together a jigsaw puzzle instead of solving it. There are some beautiful sets with great texture work & models but the glaringly awful random bad textures cancel out most of them. Probably the most infuriating part is that even with multiple endings they are all BAD END. Multiplayer is consolified "Quick Match" matchmaking only with no lobby system or friends-only private games. There are upgrade systems for your weapons and character but if you are thorough (which it isn't hard to be in a corridor shooter) you will have everything maxed by the end of the game anyway.

This game is the cancer killing the industry. Don't bother.

704280.review:
Singularity is Raven doing what Raven is known to do - delivering a solid first person shooter experience. 

Singularity takes elements of Bioshock [audio logs everywhere, similar-looking UI]; Timeshift [manipulate time]; Dead Space and Bioshock [machines everywhere to upgrade your equipment and skills]; and STALKER [takes place in Russia]; and Half-Life 2 [FPS games w/ puzzle sections]. 

Singularity is a game w/ lots of variety that often really hits or just misses its mark by a little bit. In the end, Raven delivers a solid experience that is worth your time - though, it just isn't anything special. 

Grade: C+.

A fun game that borrows pretty heavily from other FPS', namely Bioshock and Timeshift. It even manages to steal Portal's reticule :O
Thieving aside, this is decent corridor shooter, with some fairly decent puzzles and fun time manipulation mechanics. It looks very nice, with aesthetics that resemble Arkham Asylum's slick-yet-gritty environments combined with Bioshock's bright, neon orange light sources.
Raven have always made solid if unspectacular shooters, and this is no exception.
It lasts around 10 hours (not bad for a shooter these days) and revolves around a pr
etty cool story of time paradoxes and past/future changing events.
There's upgrade options with regards to weapons and your TMD
(Time Manipulation Device), though more upgrade choices would have been nice.

Overall pretty decent, and worth a punt if you see it in a sale.

A fun FPS with good but not quite top-tier graphics, solid controls, and an interesting story. There are several additions to the standard single-player FPS abilities that are fun, and everything in general is well implemented.

My only real gripe is the limited replay value. The story is only about 8 hours long, and the ending is entirely determined by your final choice (which is right after the last autosave point), so there's not much motivation to play through the whole game again.

Definitely worth buying, but wait for it to go on sale.

576967.review: Not a bad game by any means, but not amazing either. It has an interesting story, but again it's not going to blow your mind. If you're thinking about buying this game expecting fun time tools, you may be disappointed. Aside from scripted events, the only time-based powers you have in combat are 3 things. The first is aging - you can age humans into dust. The second is a sphere of stopped time, which is cool, and it's fun to unload tons of bullets into things and then have them die as soon as the sphere dissipates. The third power lets you "revert" a human into a mutated monster. The weapons are mostly standard fare as well, but one that really stands out is the Seeker rifle. It fires a bullet that you can control. Yes, you can drive a bullet. This is the single greatest thing about this game. It's incredibly satisfying, but it doesn't quite make up for the rest of the game being pretty... average since you only get to use it in a few spots in the game. Overall, I'd say 7/10. Not bad.

Good graphics, very distinct almost alien landscapes at times.

Good gameplay (although NPC AI is basic, the idea is generally to kill enemies asap not marvel at their cognative abilitys, am i right?)

Decent story with multiple endings, several shocks to be had but more creepy than horror for the most part.

The time control mechanic is well implimented and fun as is the game in general, as well as having several functions blatantly ripped from valves "gravity gun" mechanic.

111196.review:
One of the most enjoyable shooters I've played in years! Half-Life meets Bioshock meets  Timesplitters: Future Perfect meets F.E.A.R meets C&C Red Alert meets Wolfenstein meets Timeshift meets Lost. The result isn't terribly original, but it's amazingly fun.

The game constantly surprises with a change in gameplay and mood every 15 minutes. Unlike Duke Nukem Forever, it actually does a good job of blending "old skool" gameplay with modern game design.

Pro tip 1: weapon lockers allow you to swap weapons, not just upgrade them. Pro tip 2: the upgrades for the "Deadlock" time-freezing bubble are incredibly overpowered and yet suprisingly cheap, so unless you want to make the game very easy, don't upgrade Deadlock, or at most only upgrade it once. Pro tip 3: if you have Windows 7 and the audio seems quiet, one solution is to Alt Tab out of the game, go into your volume controls, find the entry for SIngularity and boost the volulme.

1431095.review:
Beautiful graphics, great storyline, and a fun gameplay mechanic.

Singularity is a hidden gem that sadly doesn't shine bright enough to be a 10 out of 10 game, but is a great one nonetheless.

The game revolves around the Time Manipulation Device, or T.M.D. which one uses to travel between 2 eras in the same areas in the game. Depending on which time zone you're in, different things happen.

The voice acting is pretty nice, and the graphics are phenomenal for a game of it's time.
The storyline, while interesting isn't anything special, sadly, but is still well-written.

The game provides several hours of fun and 2 ways to play the game based on your preference for the T.M.D. and manipulation of enemies or just a run-and-gun style.

Overall it's a pretty fun game and a recommended buy, but maybe for $10, not $20 or $30.

Join one AMERICAN man on his quest to become a time wizard who can cause death through willpower alone! It's Russian Call of Duty-Shock! Very linear, story that completely falls apart, but damn fun. Singularity would've been much better if it didn't take itself as seriously.

Your character is completely throw away, half of the other leads hardly do anything, and level design is hamfisted and forced. You get amazing guns, but you can't carry around the most original one (allows you to curve bullets in slow-mo). Nice items are placed in action sequence areas, forcing you to stop combat to collect them.

And yet the combat is gleeful. Every gun is ridiculously strong, but enemies still swarm well enough to make hard mode challenging. The sniper rifle one-shots everything no matter where you hit and lets you slow time. Controllable rolley-polley grenade launcher. Stasis bubble lets you shoot 3 guys in the head, and watch them all tumble to the floor simultaneously. A fun romp.

I love the plot, all of the creepy moments, and the amazing atmosphere. I dare say this game is almost as good as Metro 2033 in terms of atmosphere. Finally, the end wraps everything up nicely and allows you to choose one of four endings, but since the game uses checkpoints, you do not need to replay the game to see all of the endings. However, the game lacks achievements that the console versions have; it's not a big deal, but it would have been a nice touch to add to replayability. As it stands, there is virtually no replayability value, unless you simply want to play through it on a harder difficulty.

154272.review:
The plot is as follows: You're a marine sent to investigate a deserted island when suddenly, you find yourself caught in a blast that sends you to an alternate reality. Now you must fight to restore the natural order.

Prior to my purchase, I had no idea this game was under the horror genre. While it is occasionally scary, my biggest gripe is that Singularity mostly pulls of "cheap" scares, pumping loud and abrupt music in the face of danger.

Singularity's gimmick is its time warping tool. With it, you can restore certain items to its prestine condition or decay it (amusing when used on enemies). You're given a few puzzles to solve and while at first it may seem fun, the gimmick quickly wears thin. The problem is that much of the game mechanic's potential stays untapped. There are about two different puzzles that are recycled throughout. So much could have been done to make this a thinking man's game, but alas, I can only brand Singularity as another generic shooter.

Grade: B

The time reversion and advancement make this game very unique for an FPS and open lots of strategies for some of the harder opponents. A must buy for any FPS fan.

The performance of the game is pretty Stellar, I mean its smooth (Max @1080p, 8x AA, 16x AF, 4xSSAA transparent surfaces) kept a constant 60 fps (minus one or two areas, not noticable to 99% of gamers out there) 
The weapons (although the selection isnt massive, meaning there isnt a lot to choose from, but there is enough) They are unique, and the actual gunplay is fun, and the ways to kill using your special skills and technologies! 

It was a fantastic game and Highly recommend it to any of my friends who are fans of FPS. 

This is based solely off of the single player campaign!

295415.review:
From the get go it is obvious this is a straight up console port. The game doesn't support proper widescreen video resolutions and comes with some serious sound issues. When you get to actually playing the game you'll find the weapon selection lackluster, with a few exceptions. The upgrade functionality feels tacked on and many of the enemies are more annonyances than anything else. The time manipulation mechanic is okay, but I feel they could have done more with it. Multiplayer is a crapshoot and dead.

Even so, Singularity does have some redeeming qualities. The story is a real head spinner with 3 seperate endings; although which one you get has nothing to do with your actions throughout the game and instead comes down to one decision at the very end of the game. The plot will have you guessing to the end, and then some. Some of the set peices throughout the story are really amazing, and the boss fights stand out as high points. 

Overall, I'd give it 5/10. Wait for an under 10$ sale

Surprisingly enjoyable game. Singularity borrows a lot of elements form Half-Life, Bioshock and even the piece of shit Time-Shit but manages to turn those elements on it's own special thing.
It's a fun, solid shooter with good pacing, kept me hooked till the end without being repetitive and it actually scared the shit out of me on one occasion. It's sort of like FEAR 2, but decent.

The actual time bending thing is rather limited, you can use it to pulverize some enemies and restore some destroyed elements but that's it, though there are some puzzles that make use of them that are rather clever. 
You level up by purchasing abilities in stores around the world, and by the end of the game you can become an indestructible killing machine (which for once was fun).

The story was pretty good too, the ending was fucking awesome, I cant remember the last time I was this pleased with a game's ending.

1574828.review: Doc Brown may have invented the Flux Capacitor, but leave it to the Russians to manipulate it into a weapon, or a Time Manipulation Device(TMD) in this case. Don't get me wrong, it's awesome, just not practical. Of course it's up to Americans to go in and clean up the mess. Enter Captain Nathaniel Renko, a good ol American GI, sent to figure out what kind of shenanigans those crazy Russians are getting themselves into. Throughout the game you discover more of the story through visions and time rifts caused by the "Singularity", a structure built to further enhance the TMD's power. The TMD is pretty awesome in itself, but there are plenty of other weapons at your disposal. Each one supports a different style of play for different situations. Some of the weapons are pretty sweet, I kept one of the guns throughout the whole game because I liked it so much. It came in handy quite a few times while fighting all the mutants and Russian soldiers. Fun game overall. Buy it, play it, love it.

2839562.review: Long live the Trash. The Journey shooter Singularity Raven Software proves that even absurd stories can provide great entertainment

437393.review: I have been a long time fan of Raven Software ever since discovering Jedi Knight 2 when I was a wee 9th grader. Last year's Wolfenstein was a bit tedious after you got into the meat of the game, yet was still quite entertaining to me. Starting Singularity, I was immediately captivated and interested in where the story was heading, invoking a cheesy albeit charming science-fiction-B-movie feel. The pacing is great and the game mechanics heavily remind me of a hybrid of Half-Life 2 and Bioshock. I was honestly taken aback by how much I liked this game, though the $50 pricetag is steep for a June 2010 release (I bought it in October for the full $60!). I say it was still worth it though, they deserve my money, they did quite well!

2341877.review: A hidden gem in the crowded world of Steam games. It doesn't do much new, but it brings a lot of different mechanics together and executes them all well. The over-the-top abilities the Time Manipulation Device (TMD) are always entertaining, and umerous enough to always give you a few options in the heat of combat. Also, enemy types are numerous and unique, so you'll never feel bored. The story is entertaining in a way that will please Sci-Fi lovers with its great use of cliches, but is also just deep enough to keep you thinking. It's no Bioshock, but it's extremely underrated. Thumbs up from me: it's just fun!

Although the singleplayer story is great, the animations, sound, and texture streaming system are all hindering this game. Multiplayer was alyways terrible in this game and is now non existant.

Do not buy this game at this price, period. Title is worth roughly $14.99-$19.99 for an only singleplayer experience.
